item.title: CD Counselor III (BA/MA CADC/CSW/Licensed)
item.description: Details: CD Counselor III (BA or MA CADC or CSW/Licensed) JADAC - Intake/Evaluation The following position will be working at Seven Counties Services, as a Laurus Strategies Resources employee, JADAC Center, which is a treatment facility that provides inpatient, outpatient, detoxification and residential services for people with addictions and their families. This position requires experience working with substance abusing clients. Position is full time working both 1st and 2nd shifts. The hours are a combination of 9:00 am - 5:30 pm and 10:30am - 7:00 pm, Monday through Friday in our evaluation unit. GENERAL SUMMARY Under administrative direction only, assesses client needs for program admission, develops treatment planning, and administers therapy to chemically dependent individuals in a safe, structured environment.

item.title: Fleet Driver
item.description: Details: AAA has an immediate opening for Full-Time 2nd shift drivers in our Cincinnati, OH towing and light service fleet. This is an exciting opportunity to work for an industry leader. No driving experience necessary although mechanical aptitude is preffered!! If you are motivated to provide 100% quality customer service to our members and you enjoy helping people; please come visit us! As a driver your primary focus is on towing, tire changes and/or inflations, lock-outs, fuel delivery, battery checks/jumps or replacements, and selling AAA products. Flexible schedule required including working nights/weekends/holidays and during inclement weather. We offer a competitive salary plus bonuses, paid training and excellent benefits including medical, dental, 401k, paid time off, uniforms, tools, vehicle and opportunity for advancement.

item.title: Systems Administrator
item.description: Details: We are looking for a Systems Administrator for a Permanent Position in Wausau, Wisconsin. The salary is up to 60K. ------ SUMMARY Performs analysis and resolves end user hardware and software computer problems in a timely and accurate fashion, and provides end user training where required. Responsible for ensuring the stability of the operations of the company?s computing environment. This includes planning, developing, installing, configuring, maintaining, supporting, and optimizing all hardware, software, and communication links. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS 1.Engages departments and Finance in budget and procurement process. 2.Develops Service Level Agreements (SLA) for Core Services. 3.Develops Disaster Recovery (DR) strategy and test. 4.Participates in corporate Business Continuity Planning (BCP). 5.Develops, enhances, and maintains comprehensive Change Management process following accepted industry standards for IT-Governance (ITILCM, ITILSM). 1.Supports Core Services ? Active Directory, DNS, Hyper-V, Group Policy, Backups, Exchange 2.Recommends, schedules, and performs improvements, upgrades, and repairs. This list is not inclusive of all duties and responsibilities that may be assigned. They are only listed as typical. Any other duties or responsibilities assigned will be of a similar nature requiring the same relative skill and capabilities.

item.title: Outreach Coordinator
item.description: Details: Job Title: Outreach Coordinator Reports to: VP of Business Development Salary: DOE&E + Benefits (after successful completion of introductory period) Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Solid Landings Behavioral Health (SLBH) is currently seeking an Outreach Coordinator, to identify, secure, develop and maintain referral relationships with industry professionals. SLBH is a private, for- profit corporation located in Costa Mesa, California. It stands as the flagship brand and managing organization for its core and affiliate centers: Sure Haven Addiction Treatment and Rock Solid Recovery. Solid Landings Behavioral Health was founded on the fundamental principles of commitment, quality care, and individualized recovery programs for men and women.

item.title: Dietitian
item.description: Details: Job Title: Registered Dietitian Reports to: Health Care Manager Department: Clinical/Operations Salary: DOE Summary: Registered Dietitian wanted for dual diagnosis program in Orange County Job Duties: • Registered Dietician wanted for dual diagnosis program in Orange County. • Experience in the treatment of eating disorders required • Will be responsible for oversight of the nutritional aspect of our program and work collaboratively with our multidisciplinary team. • Will conduct individual assessments, prescribe meal and exercise plans, and facilitate educational and experiential groups. • Other responsibilities include timely documentation and consultation for non-ED population.

item.title: Accountant/Bookkeeper
item.description: Details: Achieve more by stretching your boundaries at CLA. Our people bring the full breadth of their talents, experience, and personal style to make an impact on those they serve. If you think like an entrepreneur, believe that collaboration multiplies opportunity, and want to push the limits of your own potential, then we should talk. CLA's outsourcing practice is known for high-quality people who contribute efficient processes, valuable financial information, and industry-specific knowledge to assist management and boards to more effectively plan for the future. We're hiring full-charge bookkeepers with 2 year's related experience to join our practice in either our Quincy, Wenatchee, or Omak locations to provide customized short and long-term finance and accounting solutions. The Accountant I will process payroll, transactions, complete non-complex account reconciliations, and support the client's accounting function. Job Description Support a variety of accounting functions for clients including payroll, financial statements, bank reconciliations, completing sales tax returns, and more on occasion. Responsible for accounts payable/cash disbursements processing, accounts receivable/cash receipts processing, and payroll processing or coordination. Develop working knowledge of appropriate accounting software-previous experience working with QuickBooks is highly desired. Complete non-complex account reconciliations to be reviewed by senior accountant, accounting manager, controller, or CFO.

item.title: Audit Engagement Director
item.description: Details: Achieve more by stretching your boundaries at CliftonLarsonAllen (CLA). Our people bring the full breadth of their talents, experience, and personal style to make an impact on those they serve. If you think like an entrepreneur, believe that collaboration multiplies opportunity, and want to push the limits of your own potential, then we should talk. CliftonLarsonAllen, one of the nation's largest public accounting and professional services firms with more than 50 years of experience of providing excellent service to our clients and great career opportunities for our people, wants you to join our team! At CliftonLarsonAllen, you will gain the experiences and training needed for you to build a great career in your chosen industry. We develop outstanding professionals and leaders who grow with our firm and who help our firm grow. We're looking for an Engagement Director in our Broomfield or Greenwood Village office to work in the Public Sector group to oversee significant audit engagements, manage talented staff, and assume the role of mentor on audit and accounting technical issues and overall professional development. Bring your own style of leadership to impact clients' success and coach the people you manage. Job Description Serve clients in a high impact manner, demonstrating command of their major area of specialization. Demonstrate deep technical skills, general industry knowledge, and knowledge of the firm's capabilities. Excel at engagement management and operational excellence, developing standards in these areas for the firm. Provide leadership on client engagement, effectively managing the expectations of clients. Exhibit strong people management and team building skills. Establish leadership authority with team on engagements. Work effectively in executing engagement responsibilities. Demonstrate personal productivity and maintain high levels of utilization and region profitability by supporting multiple industry and service areas when not working in their respective major areas. Understand the firm's financial model and ensure profitable delivery of engagements. Expand technical and professional knowledge through greater exposure to new client situations, regular self-study and formal training opportunities. Support business development opportunities as a high ranking expert and expand existing relationships through demonstrating high value and good strategic partnering capabilities. Build lasting relationships with clients and subordinate staff.

item.title: Certified Nursing Assistant / CNA / Healthcare Nursing
item.description: Details: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) – (Entry Level / Full Time Healthcare) Are you passionate about healthcare, working with the elderly, and ready to start your career with a dedicated healthcare team? Come join our team at Lexington Place Nursing & Rehab! Lexington Place Nursing & Rehab offers quality care combined with a caring and family-like environment for our clients. We are looking for Certified Nursing Assistants (CNA) to join our team in entry level full time CNA roles. As a Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA), you will ensure that our resident’s personal care needs are being met in accordance with residents’ wishes and healthcare plan objectives. If you meet our qualifications and are ready to jump start your career in healthcare, we want to talk to you! Apply today! Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) – (Entry Level / Full Time Healthcare) Job Responsibilities As a Certified Nursing Assistant, you will be responsible for performing duties such as feeding, bathing, dressing, grooming, moving patients, or changing linens. You may also be responsible for transferring or transporting patients. Additional responsibilities of the Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) include: Monitoring resident health, safety, and well-being while promoting a safe environment for residents Encouraging resident socialization and participating in coordinating resident activities Promoting the lifestyle wellness program to the residents and chaperone activities Assisting residents with the activities of daily living – such as bathing, dressing, eating, hygiene, and mobility Shift: 2 PM - 10 PM.

item.title: Human Resource Specialist - Houston, TX
item.description: Details: Has responsibility for providing highly responsive administrative support within a generalist HR team supporting approximately 600 employees across multiple departments within the bank. This includes clerical support for HR Manager, HR Business Partner and Recruiter, including administrative duties, such as scheduling meetings, maintaining calendars, answering phones, completing expense reports, preparing correspondence and creating presentations. Specialist duties include new hire processing, coordination of leaves of absence, conducting new hire orientation, I-9 completion, recruiting support (scheduling/telephone prescreening), posting staffing requisitions, tracking and processing employee referral award payment submissions, use of HR systems for position management and generating reports, completing automated employee status changes, answering general HR questions for employees and managers related to practices, policies, payroll and benefits, facilitating worker’s compensation process, respond to Texas Workforce Commission notices, processing employee terminations, submitting employment records for scanning and compiling HR data for various reports. This position also includes involvement in a variety of HR special projects and annual processes, such as succession planning, workforce planning and salary administration.

item.title: Audit Manager
item.description: Details: Achieve more by stretching your boundaries at CliftonLarsonAllen (CLA). Our people bring the full breadth of their talents, experience, and personal style to make an impact on those they serve. If you think like an entrepreneur, believe that collaboration multiplies opportunity, and want to push the limits of your own potential, then we should talk. CliftonLarsonAllen, one of the nation's largest public accounting and professional services firms with more than 50 years of experience of providing excellent service to our clients and great career opportunities for our people, wants you to join our team! At CliftonLarsonAllen, you will gain the experiences and training needed for you to build a great career in your chosen industry. We develop outstanding professionals and leaders who grow with our firm and who help our firm grow. We're hiring an Audit Manager to join our Public Sector team in our Broomfield or Greenwood Village office. In this role you will supervise and perform significant audit and review engagements for our clients, build lasting relationships, and assure continued close personal attention to client needs. Primary Responsibilities: Assume full responsibility for planning, supervising, and controlling all phases of the firm's regular services for those clients delegated by principals. Delegate or assume in-charge responsibility; project and plan the timing of the workload to promote the most efficient operation of the staff. Lead the decision-making process for assigned engagements/clients; keep the engagement principal fully informed of major decisions, engagement progress, the client's situation, and potential problems. Develop a responsible and trained staff through assistance in recruiting, planning assignments, resolving problems, providing direct consultation to staff, evaluating staff performance, and acting as an instructor or discussion leader in professional development programs. Delegate or supervise preparation of the engagement letter for approval by the engagement principal, discuss the nature and terms of the assignment with the client, estimate fees, and ensure client signs and returns the engagement letter prior to the start of the engagement. Evaluate internal controls and audit programs prepared by staff, revise as necessary, and present to the engagement principal for approval. Follow the engagement progress through monitoring time budgets and deadlines for adherence; communicate important developments to the engagement principal along with facts, conclusions and recommendations; provide ongoing attention to client management; and prepare final client meetings.

item.description: Details: National General Contractor based in Kansas City seeks full-time experienced Senior estimator with national tenant finish experience. Qualified candidate will have a minimum of 5 years experience in commercial estimating with a minimum of 3 years directly related to running a estimating department. Estimator - Construction Job Purpose: Estimatoris a critical position within our company and is responsible for developingcost estimates, maintaining accurate budgets from bidding to completion, and ultimateproject profitability. Salary: Very Competitive Salary for the right candidate Please send resume with cover letter to

item.title: Systems Engineer
item.description: Details: Job is located in Morrisville, NC. Overview: The main function of a systems engineer is to apply the principles of computer science and mathematical analysis to the design, development, testing, and evaluation of the software and systems that make computers work. A typical systems engineer analyzes user needs, and then designs, tests, and develops software to meet those needs. What you will do: • Modify existing databases and database management systems or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.• Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.• Work as part of a project team to coordinate database development and determine project scope and limitations.• Review project requests describing database user needs to estimate time and cost required to accomplish project.

item.title: Hospice Director - Registered Nurse - RN
item.description: Details: Hospice Director - Registered Nurse - RN The Administrator is accountable for directing the overall clinical activities of the agency to ensure consistent quality levels of professional health care provided are maintained with the professional standards, regulations and goals set forth. Supervises Registered Nurses’, Case Managers and Home Health Aides to deliver quality care and coordinates delivery of care services. May act in absence of the Administrator. Reviews and evaluates each case by reviewing the services provided by clinicians, conferences, record review, discusses and verifies impressions, instructs and guides clinicians to promote more effective performance and delivery of quality home care services, and is available at all times during operating hours to assist clinicians as appropriate. Reviews client’s clinical diagnosis, medications, procedures and clinical course. Assists clinicians in establishing immediate and long-term therapeutic goals, in setting priorities, and in developing plan of care. Schedules and facilitates interdisciplinary team meetings to coordinate care plans, follow up on changes, problem solve, etc. to ensure client’s progression and treatment are properly communicated, documented and in conjunction with the physician’s orders. Conducts record reviews as requested and communicates findings and recommendations to the QA Coordinator and appropriate personnel. Assists in the screening and interviewing process of new agency personnel and makes recommendations for employment of individuals. Assists in the orientation of new agency personnel. Assists the Administrator in the planning, implementation and evaluation of in-service and continuing education programs. Reviews all aspects of documentation to ensure timeliness, accuracy and completeness in coordination with QA Coordinator. Monitors staff productivity and ensure productivity expectations are being met. Assists in the formulation, revision, implementation and evaluation of policies and procedures, as well as strategic goals and objectives. Responsible for directing, managing and supervision all staff’s plan of care, documentation and performance. This includes staff development of current and new staff, performance evaluations, staff competencies and corrective action measures to include interviewing and orientation of new staff members. Directs, develops and implements programs for the education and counseling to clients/families/staff regarding community services for discharge planning, disease progression, self care techniques and rehabilitation nursing procedures. Participates in on-call rotation, community programs and committees as required. Maintains a positive and interactive working relationship with service vendors and corporate staff members regarding appropriate cost effective services and accurate billing. Complies with accepted professional standards and principles. Participates in public relations and community activities that promote the Organization’s role as an effective member of the health care delivery system. Fulfills the role of the Registered Nurse in their absence.

item.title: Mechanical Technician - CONUS
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: Public Trust Shift: Day Category: Logistics Support Services Job Duties: Repairs, rebuilds or overhauls major assemblies of internal combustion automobiles, buses, trucks or tractors. Work involves replacing worn or broken parts such as piston rings, bearings, or other engine parts; grinding and adjusting valves; rebuilding carburetors; overhauling transmissions; and repairing fuel injection, lighting and ignition systems. Performs other, related duties as assigned. Requires well-rounded training and experience usually acquired through formal apprenticeship or equivalent training and experience. Performs other duties as assigned. Position Requirements: • 4+ years of proven experience in maintenance, repair and technical experience and background in industrial manufacturing, commercial maintenance or military operations or maintenance. • Preferred areas of experience may be with light or heavy duty trucks, tractors, tactical vehicles, ground systems, generators, power plants, aircraft or any diesel or gasoline powered equipment or vehicle. • Maintenance support includes operations, system troubleshooting, engineering, design, installation, analysis, maintenance and repair of U.S. systems and subsystems to component level. • Proficient with a variety of hand tools, diagnostic tools, power tools, multi-meters. • Effectively applies industry or military standard troubleshooting procedures to localize and isolate faulty system components. • Preferably familiar or knowledge with MRAP/RCV systems • Prior training or maintenance experience on MRAP FOV systems preferable. Security Requirements: Secret Security Clearance **Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.** ManTech is an equal opportunity affirmative action employer. We encourage Minority/Female/Protected Veteran/Disabled applicants to apply. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access http://www.mantech.com/careers/Pages/careers.aspx as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, please click and provide your name and contact information.

item.title: Test Engineer - Temporary position
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: Public Trust Shift: Day Category: Engineering & Support Services ManTech has an immediate need for a Test Engineer to provide functional, sprint, positive and negative testing against user stories, acceptance criteria and requirements for development, enhancements and bug fixes to existing Next Gen systems and new developed systems in an Agile test environment. Maintain, setup and configure software test environments and labs. Design and implement system test and regression plans test cases, and automated test scripts • Report issues by using a formal bug tracking system and interface with the development team to help resolve bugs/issues. Review test cases of more junior team members to ensure adequate test coverage (positive, negative, and exception handling), adherence to coding standards and appropriate automation) • Test Complete experience • Experience with Continuous Integration Software Engineering Practice and Configuration Management Systems Engineering Process • Knowledge in applying test automation procedures Experience implementing, designing, planning, and conducting comprehensive release and regress • Experience in the following technical areas: • Software Packages: Requisite Pro, ClearCase, ClearQuest, Functional Tester, Quality Manager, Test Manager, HP Quality Center, HP Winrunner, Subversion, Nexus, Sonar, Jenkins, Rally, Selenium • Operating Systems: Windows 7, UNIX, LINUX • Languages: C, Java, Java Scripting, .net • Meets deadlines, achieves results, and adjusts quickly to alternating priorities • Customer-focused • Ability to triage issues • Reacts well to changes • Works independently or with teams Able to multi-task on tests

item.title: COMSEC Manager – Level IV
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Category: Security ManTech, a well-respected industry leader, is actively seeking talented professionals eager to support mission critical programs and solve some of the toughest problems critical to our great Nation's security. ManTech has an opening for a well-rounded industrial security professional to operate in a highly dynamic environment. The person selected for this position will be responsible for personnel security processing and maintaining individuals requiring Department of Defense (DOD) clearances as well as performing duties as an ACSSO in compliance with the NISPOM and NISPOM Supplement, DoD 5105.21-M-1, current ICDs security program. The person selected for this position will also be required to exercise positive control over documents, media, and equipment in a professional and efficient manner, as well as taking a leading role in the day-to-day operations of the Classified Material Control Center (CMCC) for one of our government customers. This individual will also be required to provide access control support to include processing visitors; escorting emergency personnel; receiving and processing incoming packages; monitoring intrusion detection system; responding, assessing, and resetting alarms; and monitoring CCTV systems. As a member of the security operations team, this person will work closely with the projects and operations staff as well as senior managers and executives. This person must be comfortable providing short security presentations and answering questions about procedures and requirements. The person selected for this position must have strong data entry skills using Microsoft Office and SIMS applications, and should have a working knowledge of the Industrial Security Facility Database (ISFD) Scattered Castles and JPAS. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: • Receipt from and/or issue to hand receipt holders, maintain remote accountability and master inventory records, conduct transfers, and destruction of all COMSEC items. • Maintain accountability and inventory of Controlled Cryptographic Items and records. • Conduct COMSEC violation investigations; prepare reports and findings for appropriate authorities. • Maintain accountability and currency of keying material from time of receipt to time of transfer, suppression or destruction. • Maintain records and files, report incidents. • Provide required COMSEC briefings and training materials. • Remain up-to-date regarding NSA instructions and guidelines. • Working knowledge of the NISPOM (DoD 5220.22-M), NISPOM Supplement, DoD 5105.21, ICD 705, DCID 6/4, and other current government regulations pertaining to administrative, physical, and information security. • A working knowledge of TEMPEST and TSCM programs is a plus. • Knowledge of supporting security disciplines, including document control, visit certifications, personnel security processing, SCI and security processes and procedures. • Required experience with E-QIP/EPSQ/JPAS/ACAVS. • Working in joint environments with military and defense contractors. • Excellent written and oral communication, as well as excellent interpersonal skills. Highly experienced in interfacing with Government customers and executive management. • Experience with SCIF management a plus. • Facility experience with robust connectivity across multiple security domains. • Accurately enter all documents and media into the SIMs database. • Ensure full accountability requirements by logging, assigning ownership, tracking, and certifying destruction of all documents and media in SIMS. • Prepare for and conduct classified document inventories. • Properly mark, store/safeguard, and package material properly for transmission via various authorized methods. • Maintain accountability of all classified media entering, generated within, and leaving the facility. • Ability to change lock combinations on GSA-approved containers and properly record such changes. • Ensure the physical security integrity for CMCC and secure work areas. • Must be able to make independent decisions within security guidelines regarding the control of classified material. • Perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed to include opening and closing the facility. • Utilize ISFD and JPAS daily. • Complete and transmit visit requests. • Monitor security clearance processing activities. • Assist in updating and maintaining the overall clearance/access database JPAS, and ManTech&s personnel security database. • Ensure files are maintained and compliant with customer requirements. • Additional duties include maintaining classified document accountability for project teams. • Other security administrative duties as required such as but not limited to providing access control support. EDUCATION: Bachelor&s Degree Business, Finance, Logistics or other related field with (6+) years of experience in industrial, Government, or military security environment. EXPERIENCE: NSA qualified COMSEC Custodian with proof of attendance at NSA sponsored COMSEC Custodian training, such as IAEC-2112. Experience with SCI programs. Experience using the DIAS database and completing Standard Form-153 Experience transferring keys using a CYZ-10 and KYK-13 DTDs through a STE. Full understanding of KG-175 A, KG-250, Experience with EKMS, STE, KOV-14 and secure facsimile. Working knowledge of NISPOM and DOD5105.21 M-1 Bachelor&s Degree coupled with 5 years DOD COMSEC experience; OR 2-4 years experience in document/media control and personnel security. 3-5 years experience in SCIF operations. Experience in an industrial security setting. Well versed in E.O. 13526 and applicable marking directives for classified material. Confident, mature, and professional demeanor and appearance. Flexibility to do whatever task is required and willingness to learn new functions. Self-starter able to work well within a team environment. Experience with locking CDX-09s and setting alarms. Experience managing individual visitors and large groups of meeting attendees. Solid working knowledge of NISPOM/M-1 requirements and JPAS. Position requires an active TS clearance, and current DCID 6/4 eligibility.

item.title: Configuration Management Specialist - Level III
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Category: Engineering & Support Services ManTech, a well-respected industry leader, is actively seeking talented professionals eager to support mission critical programs and solve some of the toughest problems critical to our great Nation's security. ManTech is looking for a Configuration Manager to provide support services to the U.S. Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM) from our Stafford, VA location. This person will have a working knowledge of the Configuration Management (CM) functions in accordance with the DoD 5000 acquisition process, MIL-STD-973 and applicable Army Regulations/Guidance. Responsibilities: • Provide CM support to INSCOM projects and programs • Create/Assist with publication of Program Manager (PM)-level Configuration Management Plan and Configuration Control Board (CCB) Charter • Maintain a comprehensive CM tool and CM Database • Conduct periodic CM audits and provide analysis of audit reports • Resolve CM issues quickly, efficiently and effectively • Manage requirements that may vary based on specified Command requirements • Ensure change control, status accounting and auditing of functional and physical configurations • Conduct Engineering Review Board (ERB) and Configuration Control Board (CCB) meetings • Prepare Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs)/Software Change Proposals (SCPs) • Manage/support the program&s IAVA/IAVM/IAVB management efforts • Support the functions of the Army IT Governance Process Qualifications: • Bachelor&s degree in business or related field (+3 years CM experience) • Experience with DoD CM Processes and Standards (MIL-STD-973, etc.) • Industry-recognized CM certification • Familiarity with applying CM practices and procedures across Agile Methodology development environments • Experience using and maintaining CM tools and databases (e.g., CMPro) • Experience with the Army IT Governance and CM Processes • Familiarity with Office of Management and Budget, Government Accountability Office and other federal mandates Desired Qualifications: CMPIC Certification Security Clearance Needed: Current Top Secret SCI Clearance

item.title: IT Cyber Engineer
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: Secret Shift: Day Category: Scientific / Analytical Become an integral part of a diverse team at the leading edge of advanced research and development. This challenging position offers opportunities to serve on multi-disciplinary Scientific, Engineering and Technical Assistance (SETA) teams for various federal government agencies within the DoD. Job Description : As an Engineer, Senior Principal you will interface with the government Program Manager who is responsible for the daily operations of this advanced research portfolio focused on cyber security, information security, information assurance, large data sets, system development, integration, and test. You will participate on project teams with other highly motivated technical experts who are focused on achieving technical breakthroughs. You will work with the nation&s top experts and be mentored by ManTech&s experienced engineers and supervisors. General responsibilities : o Assist in the development and research of new ideas for formulation of new programs and seedlings within the timeframe requested o Provide research expertise and program support of Government activities with regard to procurements, program schedules, technical risk, user impact, and technology transfer efforts o Provide in-depth expertise in the assessment of proposals to determine the technical merit of proposal objectives and methodologies o Assist Program Managers in the liaison with Government agents, performing contractors, and technical community to review and document technical progress at program reviews and to track milestones, funding profiles, and deliverables for ongoing efforts o Assist in identifying and translating user requirements into specific technology research and development objectives; illustrating the benefits of applying technology to military equipment users and developers; and identify the commercial utility of new products and technology developments o Develop and provide program progress reports and briefing materials on an as needed basis within the time frame requested. o Assist in conducting benefit analyses and program assessments on an as needed basis within the time frame requested o Develop test plans for assessment of program performers systems. Coordinate with program performers throughout the testing of programs to ensure ranges, testing, and systems meet the test plan requirements. Focus Areas: secure cloud computing systems software code with mathematically provable security properties automated cyber security systems preserving security on untrustworthy computational infrastructure insider threat detection and response maintaining security and mission effectiveness of systems after attack, including detection, cleanup, and reconstitution computational tools and scalable algorithms advanced user interfaces pre-processing technology for data sets, including those that are corrupted, incomplete, or disaggregat processing and computational approaches (including, highly desirable. item.title: COMSEC Manager – Level III
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Day Category: Security ManTech, a well-respected industry leader, is actively seeking talented professionals eager to support mission critical programs and solve some of the toughest problems critical to our great Nation's security. ManTech has an opening for a well-rounded industrial security professional to operate in a highly dynamic environment. The person selected for this position will be responsible for personnel security processing and maintaining individuals requiring Department of Defense (DOD) clearances as well as performing duties as an ACSSO in compliance with the NISPOM and NISPOM Supplement, DoD 5105.21-M-1, current ICDs security program. The person selected for this position will also be required to exercise positive control over documents, media, and equipment in a professional and efficient manner, as well as taking a leading role in the day-to-day operations of the Classified Material Control Center (CMCC) for one of our government customers. This individual will also be required to provide access control support to include processing visitors; escorting emergency personnel; receiving and processing incoming packages; monitoring intrusion detection system; responding, assessing, and resetting alarms; and monitoring CCTV systems. As a member of the security operations team, this person will work closely with the projects and operations staff as well as senior managers and executives. This person must be comfortable providing short security presentations and answering questions about procedures and requirements. The person selected for this position must have strong data entry skills using Microsoft Office and SIMS applications, and should have a working knowledge of the Industrial Security Facility Database (ISFD) Scattered Castles and JPAS. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: • Receipt from and/or issue to hand receipt holders, maintain remote accountability and master inventory records, conduct transfers, and destruction of all COMSEC items. • Maintain accountability and inventory of Controlled Cryptographic Items and records. • Conduct COMSEC violation investigations; prepare reports and findings for appropriate authorities. • Maintain accountability and currency of keying material from time of receipt to time of transfer, suppression or destruction. • Maintain records and files, report incidents. • Provide required COMSEC briefings and training materials. • Remain up-to-date regarding NSA instructions and guidelines. • Working knowledge of the NISPOM (DoD 5220.22-M), NISPOM Supplement, DoD 5105.21, ICD 705, DCID 6/4, and other current government regulations pertaining to administrative, physical, and information security. • A working knowledge of TEMPEST and TSCM programs is a plus. • Knowledge of supporting security disciplines, including document control, visit certifications, personnel security processing, SCI and security processes and procedures. • Required experience with E-QIP/EPSQ/JPAS/ACAVS. • Working in joint environments with military and defense contractors. • Excellent written and oral communication, as well as excellent interpersonal skills. Highly experienced in interfacing with Government customers and executive management. • Experience with SCIF management a plus. • Facility experience with robust connectivity across multiple security domains. • Accurately enter all documents and media into the SIMs database. • Ensure full accountability requirements by logging, assigning ownership, tracking, and certifying destruction of all documents and media in SIMS. • Prepare for and conduct classified document inventories. • Properly mark, store/safeguard, and package material properly for transmission via various authorized methods. • Maintain accountability of all classified media entering, generated within, and leaving the facility. • Ability to change lock combinations on GSA-approved containers and properly record such changes. • Ensure the physical security integrity for CMCC and secure work areas. • Must be able to make independent decisions within security guidelines regarding the control of classified material. • Perform additional duties and responsibilities as directed to include opening and closing the facility. • Utilize ISFD and JPAS daily. • Complete and transmit visit requests. • Monitor security clearance processing activities. • Assist in updating and maintaining the overall clearance/access database JPAS, and ManTech&s personnel security database. • Ensure files are maintained and compliant with customer requirements. • Additional duties include maintaining classified document accountability for project teams. • Other security administrative duties as required such as but not limited to providing access control support. EDUCATION: High School Diploma with (6) years of experience in industrial, Government, or military security environment. Associate&s Degree in Business, Finance, Logistics or other related field with (5) years of experience in industrial, Government, or military security environment. Bachelor&s Degree Business, Finance, Logistics or other related field with (4+) years of experience in industrial, Government, or military security environment. EXPERIENCE: NSA qualified COMSEC Custodian with proof of attendance at NSA sponsored COMSEC Custodian training, such as IAEC-2112. Experience using the DIAS database and completing Standard Form-153 2-4 years experience in document/media control and personnel security. Experience in an industrial security setting. Well versed in E.O. 13526 and applicable marking directives for classified material. Confident, mature, and professional demeanor and appearance. Flexibility to do whatever task is required and willingness to learn new functions. Self-starter able to work well within a team environment. Experience with locking CDX-09s and setting alarms. Experience managing individual visitors and large groups of meeting attendees. Solid working knowledge of NISPOM/M-1 requirements and JPAS. Position requires an active TS clearance, and current DCID 6/4 eligibility. DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS: Defense Security Service Academy course work including Essentials of Industrial Security Management, Protecting Secret and Confidential Documents, Derivative Marking Requirements, Industrial Security Facilities Database, Personally Identifiable Information, JPAS/JCAVS, etc.

item.title: Information Technology Consultant - Site Lead
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Day Category: Information Technology This is the Site Lead for the Acropolis Program at the Warner Robins, GA facility. In this role, the successful candidate will be responsible for scheduling resources and executing required activities at the site. Additionally, the candidate will provide incident and event management. Experience with Arcsight is valuable. Typical actions that the site team must accomplish include: installing operating systems, installing software, uninstalling software, monitoring systems and processes, patching operating systems and applications, applying systems changes in compliance with STIG/IAVA guidelines, configuring and tuning system processes, helping to maintain data flow and ensuring Acropolis tool and capability delivery to the user Community. The successful candidate will oversee the administration of sensors within the Acropolis system. Typical actions that must be accomplished include: installing operating systems, installing software, uninstalling software, monitoring systems and processes, patching operating systems and applications, applying systems changes in compliance with STIG/IAVA guidelines, configuring and tuning system processes, and helping to maintain data flow from sensors to the Acropolis in a timely manner. Also essential to this sensor administration task is the ability to quickly deploy on-site when required by the Government to perform hardware and software maintenance and repair. The contractor must have a dedicated and trained maintenance and repair staff available to quickly deploy to a remote site at the Government&s request to fix an outage.This position is pending award of the Acropolis contract by the government. Basic Qualifications: Trained and knowledgeable in Lustre administration and be certified knowledgeable in the following areas: Microsoft Windows (i.e., MCSE or equivalent), Microsoft Applications (i.e., MCSA or equivalent), Red Hat Enterprise Linux (i.e., RHCE or equivalent), Citrix Systems (i.e., CCP or equivalent), Hadoop (i.e., Cloudera or equivalent) Experience using Arcsight Current Top Secret clearance, eligible for SCI ( Desired skills: Technical Background Sensor Grid Management CISSP System Security Prior experience with sensors is highly desirable, especially in the following areas: Bivio Sensors, Sourcefire Sensors, Netwitness Sensors, Noesis Sensors, ArcSight Systems, and other sensor systems as defined by the Government

item.title: Systems Administrator
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Day Category: Networks & Telecommunication Services Acropolis, formerly named the Community Data Center (CDC), using a capability called CENTAUR, is a DoD enterprise-wide capability implementing security best practices by collecting, storing, and analyzing summaries of DoD data on an out-of-band network that is separate from the network the data is originally gathered from. Acropolis currently collects, stores, and analyzes both enclave and backbone network traffic on the Non-secure Internet Protocol Router Network (NIPRNet) and Secret Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNet). Its mission is to build, maintain, and support a DoD enterprise capability to acquire a global situational awareness of the DoD Information Network (DODIN) from both an information assurance and a network operations perspective to improve defense and support of DoD Cyber Operations. The Acropolis collects terabytes of new CND alerts, logs and other critical net defense data on daily basis from hundreds of sensors and systems located throughout the DODIN and stores the information in suites of cloud based tools and capabilities. The contractor will operate and maintain all sensors, remote collections systems, and data feeds as defined by the Government to insure the accurate and timely delivery of all data to the Acropolis and the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of all associated systems. Sensor administrators are required 24x7x365 to ensure proper Operations and Management (O&M) over all required assets. Typical actions that sensor administrators must accomplish include: installing operating systems, installing software, uninstalling software, monitoring systems and processes, patching operating systems and applications, applying systems changes in compliance with STIG/IAVA guidelines, configuring and tuning system processes, and helping to maintain data flow from sensors to the Acropolis in a timely manner. Historically the number of sensors has been around 1000 with future anticipated growth of 5% per year.This position is pending award of the Acropolis contract by the government. Basic Qualifications: Sensor administrators must be highly trained and be certified knowledgeable in two or more of the following areas: Bivio Sensors, Sourcefire Sensors, Netwitness Sensors, Noesis Sensors, ArcSight Systems Sensor administrators must have experience in the use of Government systems to track operations and management of sensor systems including, or similar to, DISA VMS, CMRS, Zabbix, DSCAPE, and GTMS" 24x7x365 Shift Work Required TS Clearance Required w/ SCI Eligibility 8570 IAT Level II Security+ Certification required Desired skills: Familiarity with applicable DISA standards for a Government secured NOC - Experience working in on a DISA network using Remedy based GTMS ticket system - Experience with common DISA data formats and applicable Government guidelines PMP Cert or equivalent Project Management Experience.

item.title: Senior Systems Administrator
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: Top Secret Shift: Day Category: Networks & Telecommunication Services Acropolis, formerly named the Community Data Center (CDC), using a capability called CENTAUR, is a DoD enterprise-wide capability implementing security best practices by collecting, storing, and analyzing summaries of DoD data on an out-of-band network that is separate from the network the data is originally gathered from. Its mission is to build, maintain, and support a DoD enterprise capability to acquire a global situational awareness of the DoD Information Network (DODIN) from both an information assurance and a network operations perspective to improve defense and support of DoD Cyber Operations. The Acropolis plays host to a large number of tools and capabilities that assist analysts in defending and protecting the JIE and the DODIN. The contractor is responsible for the Operations and Maintenance of these hosted tools and capabilities within Acropolis to include installation, maintenance, upgrades, C&A support, etc. This position is pending award of the Acropolis contract by the government. Basic Qualifications Willingness to support after hours on an on-call basis Experience in three or more of the following tools: Centaur Netflow Warehouse (SiLK), Trickler DB, Noesis PCAP system, SIM (ArcSight), Analyst Pipeline, Sourcefire, Wiki, Netwitness, Assured File Transfer system (cross domain solution), Splunk, Continuous Monitoring and Risk Scoring systems, and Cyber Situational Awareness Analytic Cloud (Hadoop cloud). TS Clearance Required w/ SCI Eligibility 8570 IAT Level II Security+ Certification required Desired skills Familiarity with applicable DISA standards for a Government secured NOC - Experience working in on a DISA network using Remedy based GTMS ticket system - Experience with common DISA data formats and applicable Government guidelines PMP Cert or equivalent Project Management Experience

item.title: Logistics/Transportation Specialist
item.description: Details: Group: MCIS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Day Category: Logistics Support Services Become an integral part of a diverse team that leads the world in Mission, Cyber, and Intelligence Solutions. At ManTech International Corporation, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement. The Logistics/Transportation Specialist will perform all functions of the NRO Deployment Coordination Center (NDCC) in support of NRO personnel (government civilian, military, and contractor) travel for official government business (Harm&s Way, Non-Harm&s Way, OCONUS & CONUS). Responsibilities include: • Provide coordination with in-country representatives of expected travel; attain country clearances and assist travelers with fulfilling screening requirements, receiving travel advisories and receiving appropriate security briefings. Facilitate compliance with other regulations and ensure deployment readiness. • Act as the NRO&s resource for all official foreign travel deployments. Responsible for day-to-day coordination and administration of multiple tasks; ensure quality standards are maintained while satisfying timeline requirements. Support other duties as assigned. • Position requires ability to manage multiple tasks and competing timelines while tactfully interfacing with customers and team members. Strong oral and written communication skills are essential. • Ideal candidate will be detail-oriented, self-motivated, patient, organized and resourceful. Candidate will adapt well to change, utilize innovative solutions, apply sound judgment and remain poised under pressure. Position Requirements: • 5+ year&s logistics/senior customer support experience • Previous experience supporting the NRO highly preferred Security Requirements: U.S. Citizenship and an active DoD TS/SCI w/Poly based upon a SSBI completed within the last 5 years. Must be willing to submit to an initial and random polygraph.

item.title: Database Administrator
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: TS/SCI Shift: Day Category: Information Technology Acropolis, formerly named the Community Data Center (CDC), using a capability called CENTAUR, is a DoD enterprise-wide capability implementing security best practices by collecting, storing, and analyzing summaries of DoD data on an out-of-band network that is separate from the network the data is originally gathered from. The Acropolis plays host to a large number of tools and capabilities that assist analysts in defending and protecting the JIE and the DODIN. This position is pending award of the Acropolis contract by the government. The Database Administrator (DBA) performs many related database functions across one or more teams or clients, including designing, implementing and maintaining new databases, backup/recovery, and configuration management. Candidate will be responsible for providing input for modification of procedures and updating documentation used for problem resolution and day-to-day maintenance. Key responsibilities: - Focus on addressing day-to-day management, support, and troubleshooting activities of the team - Provide database administration support, oversee environment management, monitor database health (e.g. proactive and reactive responses), resource planning, perform database upgrades and patching, provide backup/recovery, and make recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements - Develop and manage daily operational procedures Basic Qualifications: Knowledgeable in database design, development, and management. Excellent communication skills to include technical writing. Willingness to support after hours on an on-call basis TS Clearance Required 8570 IAT Level II Security+ Certification required Desired skills: Familiarity with applicable DISA standards.

item.title: Technical Writer, Senior
item.description: Details: Group: MSS Clearance Level Needed: Secret Shift: Day Category: Publications & Graphic Arts ManTech, a well-respected industry leader, is actively seeking talented professionals eager to support mission critical programs and solve some of the toughest problems critical to our great Nation's security. ManTech's Mission Solutions and Services Group (MSS) is seeking an experienced Technical Writer. Duties and Responsibilities: Researches, organizes, writes, edits, and produces technical data for major publication projects. Involves graphic arts support. Organizes material and writes descriptive copy according to standards regarding order, clarity, conciseness, style, and terminology. Ensures technical documentation is accurate, complete, meets editorial and government specifications and adheres to standards for quality, graphics, coverage, format, and style. May participate in the establishment of style guidelines and standards for texts and illustrations. Has experience in the use of MS PowerPoint or other graphic arts applications. May provide work Leadership for lower level employees. The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in English, or other related discipline with a minimum of five (5) years of recent and relevant professional experience in the organization of material and complete writing assignments according to set standards regarding grammer, spelling, syntax, order, clarity, conciseness, style, and terminology. This individual must have demonstrated experience in the following areas: editing, standardizing, formatting or making changes to material, including technical documents, prepared by other writers or established personnel; conferring with customer representatives to establish technical specifications and to determine subject material to be developed for publication; and reviewing published materials and recommendning revisions or changes in scope, format and content. Provide graphics support using applications. Working knowledge and experience in working Defense Acquisition and JCIDS related documentation. Desired experience with preparing pre-acquisition, and acquisition documentation such as: 1) Acquisition Stragegy 2) Acquisitin Program Baselines (APB) 3) Analysis of Alternatives (AOA) 4) Initial Capability Document (ICD) 5) Capapbility Development Documents (CDD) 6) Capstone requirments documents (CRD) 7) Decision Analysis Support (DAS) 8) Information Support Plans (ISP) 9) Modeling & simulation Support Plan (MSSP) 10) Reliability, Availabiity, Maintainability and Cost Rationale Report (RAM-C) 11) Systems Engineering Plan (SEP) 12) System Threat Assessment Reports (STARs) 13) Technology Development strategy (TDS) 14) Test & Evaluation Strategy (TES)

item.title: Data Loss Prevention Engineer
item.description: Details: Group: MCIS Clearance Level Needed: Top Secret Shift: Day Category: Technical Analysis Become an integral part of a diverse team that leads the world in Mission, Cyber, and Intelligence Solutions. At ManTech International Corporation, you will help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement. The Cyber Defense Solution (CDS) Business Unit of ManTech MCTS is looking for highly motivated, qualified professionals to fill a Data Loss Prevention Engineer position in Washington, D.C. As a Data Loss Prevention Engineer you will provide daily administration, operation, and maintenance of all current and future secure/unsecure networks and stand alone Automated Information Systems (AIS). You will also support connectivity with other domains and the existing Windows-based system. You will analyze and repair system faults, troubleshoot, and run diagnostic test on operating system and hardware to detect problems. You will be responsible for reviewing and preparing documentation for systems and tests capable of installing and required software. You will also initiate preventive maintenance on the operational system as well as be capable of repairing system and environment problems. In this role you will develop the procedures and be capable of executing existing procedures in order to maintain compliance with customer mandates and/or vendor specific patches and upgrade; as well as troubleshoot of system performance and make system modifications to accommodate hardware upgrades. To be successful in this role, you should have the ability to adapt quickly to a fast paced and dynamic environment for high impact, mission-critical network security operations. You must also have strong skills in troubleshooting, fault isolation, and critical thinking skills that logically segment and narrow down problems in complex computing environments. In this position you will need to effective interpersonal and communication skills to interact with a variety of users having different levels of computer expertise. You will also be responsible for maintaining security awareness of the environment to ensure that the network is not subject to security breaches from internal and Internet communities. Ideal candidate will have experience with data loss prevention applications and written reporting of system results. For this role, you must be available for duty during customer core hours between 0800AM to 6:00PM depending on assigned shift. You may be assigned off-duty coverage (pager/cell phone) on a rotational basis due mission requirements. Position Requirements: -Bachelor&s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Business, or other related scientific or technical discipline plus a minimum of eight years of experience, of which at least six years must be specialized OR Master&s Degree (in the fields described above) plus four years general experience of which at least one year must be specialized experience is required OR with ten years of general experience of which at least four years must be specialized experience, a degree is not required. -Specialized experience, in information systems development, functional and data requirements analysis, systems analysis and design, programming, program design and documentation preparation. - Demonstrated experience in the implementation of information engineering projects; systems analysis, design and programming, systems planning, business information planning, and business analysis. -Basic skills in configuring Windows Server 2003/2005/2008 , Windows XP, and Windows Vista Operating Systems, specifically network communications and network management application installation and operations maintenance -Must demonstrate the ability to work independently or under only general direction. Security Requirements: Applicants must have an active TOP SECRET security clearance with eligibility to obtain SCI access and willing to take a CI Poly. Keywords: data loss prevention troubleshooting, windows, security, network

item.title: Registered Nurse (Wound Care)
item.description: Details: RN (Wound Care) ABOUT US Wound Care Specialists is one of the largest wound care organizations in the country with a significant presence in rural communities comprised of caring professionals working together to provide outcome driven comprehensive wound management. Our team of physicians, wound care nurses and technicians are extensively trained in advance wound care techniques. We focus on using the appropriate wound care modalities and customize each treatment plan to the patient's individual needs. Description Expanding wound care company is seeking a RN to be part of the growing team. This position will require travel to outpatient wound care clinics near Fairfield, IL, McLeansboro,IL, and Ste. Genevieive, MO. The Wound Care Nurse performs non-complex and specialized wound care to patients in accordance with physician’s orders and approved wound care protocols under the direction and supervision of the Lead Registered Nurse. Duties and Role Seeks and obtains sufficient information necessary to function effectively in the health care setting where assigned. Adheres to established policies/procedures and expectations of the facility. Delivers direct patient care in a competent and professional manner. Performs non-complex wound care per aseptic technique per MD order and as delegated by the Lead RN. Measures and photographs wound progress and provides updates to the physician on an ongoing basis as changes occur. Performs specialized wound care procedures as delegated by the Lead RN that include, but are not limited to, the application of topical wound products, topical anesthetics, Ankle Brachial Index (ABI) and application of compression wraps, and primary and secondary dressings. Assists physician with specialized wound care procedures that include debridement and removal of unhealthy tissue to the level of subcutaneous tissue, tendon, muscle, and bone, tissue or bone biopsy, electrocautery for hemostasis, incision and drainage, suturing or stapling of skin and grafts. Follows up with lab results (obtain results, call MD and patient to follow up) and documents accurately in the clinical record. Writes all telephone or verbal orders received immediately and obtains physician signatures as necessary. Completes accurate and relevant clinical notes regarding patient's condition and care given. Maintains the clinical record. Writes progress reports and summaries to physicians as appropriate.

item.title: Staff Engineer - Instrumentation
item.description: Details: Join Linde, the world's leading global gases and engineering organization. Linde manufactures, supplies, and distributes industrial, medical, and specialty gases. We are recognized as a leader in the development of new gas-related technologies and applications for the electronics alternative fuels and energy, glass, food, metals, and chemical industries. Linde North America is a member of The Linde Group. In the 2013 financial year, The Linde Group generated revenue of EUR 16.655 bn (USD 23.1 bn), making it the largest gases and engineering company in the world with approximately 63,500 employees working in more than 100 countries worldwide. The strategy of The Linde Group is geared towards long-term profitable growth and focuses on the expansion of its international business with forward-looking products and services. Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment - in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development. At Linde we believe that people create our success. Our primary goal is to hire and retain the best, most talented employees who are leaders in their own right, and provide them with a growth environment that is focused on adding value for the customer. We strongly believe that the diversity of our employees and their ongoing growth and development, combined with our global footprint and broad range of business activities, provide us with the ingredients required to maintain and grow our leading market positions around the world. Linde is currently seeking a Staff Engineer - Instrumentation to join the team in the Stewartsville, New Jersey area. Job Responsibilities: ▪ Support RAS plant instrumentation improvement programs ▪ Supports root cause analysis and ensures timely action item closure ▪ Ensures compliance with all safety, health, environmental and quality standards within the region ▪ Develop a deeper understanding of the various types of instrumentation found in Linde process plants ▪ As assigned by the Instrumentation Engineering Manager, perform engineering functions that could include: •Plant instrumentation repair, maintenance and modifications as learning experiences and assure the quality and effectiveness of these activities •Propose recommended solutions to plant instrumentation performance and reliability issues. •Evaluate the root causes of component and system failures that affect to plant instrumentation reliability and performance •Support, and eventually lead, RCFA's for incidents involving plant to plant instrumentation •Conduct Training sessions for plant and region employees on lessons learned to improve to plant instrumentation performance and reliability •Diagnose issues, identify trends, and provide engineering solutions to specific or chronic to plant instrumentation issues •Represent the plant and/or region for turnarounds, commissioning, projects and general business meetings and events •Identify critical spare parts needed for to plant instrumentation and use engineering and risk principals to set stock quantities Minimum Qualifications: ▪ ESD, ESD Graduate, or junior level engineer with a minimum of 2 years' experience ▪ BS Chemical, Electrical, or Systems Engineering ▪ Interpersonal skills: •Possesses strong oral and written communications skills •Demonstrated ability to work cohesively in a team environment or independently as required •Demonstrated ability to challenge the status quo and improve existing processes/programs ▪ Managerial skills: •Some knowledge in plant operations and equipment performance preferred •Self starter with the ability to manage multiple activities and achieve results with minimal supervision •Ability to gather data, evaluate trends, associate complex relationships, and determine cause and effect to solve complex technical issues •Ability to identify and understand human and non technical influence and constraints in solving equipment performance issues •Can effectively identify and evaluate technical and business process opportunities and translate to financial terms to support investment and business case development •Continuous improvement drive and ability to implement change. Linde offers excellent salaries, world-class benefits, and unparalleled opportunities for development - all to create an invigorating and satisfying environment. Join a World Leading Team Today! For IMMEDIATE consideration, APPLY NOW!

item.title: Store Associate
item.description: Details: If you are a customer service minded individual with a positive and energetic personality and you’re interested in working for one of the best-known grocery stores in the nation, join the ALDI family! We are looking for motivated and reliable individuals to serve as a Store Associate. You will serve as the face of ALDI, providing customers with friendly and efficient check-out services. But that’s just the beginning. You will also assist the store manager in a variety of roles, from stocking and merchandising our products to monitoring inventory and keeping the store looking clean and inviting. This is also an excellent ground-floor opportunity for you if you are interested in pursuing a management career, as we prefer to promote from within whenever possible. If you are a people person who likes to roll up your sleeves and put in a good day’s work, we want to talk with you! Store Associate - Retail Sales ( Customer Service ) Job Responsibilities As a Store Associate, you will be involved in all aspects of keeping the store looking and functioning at its best. First and foremost, of course, you will keep your checkout line moving as quickly and smoothly as possible while ensuring that customers have a pleasant and positive shopping experience. In addition, you will have a variety of other duties throughout the store, which you will perform on an as-needed basis. Your specific duties as a Store Associate will include: Providing friendly and informative customer service Ringing up customers quickly, efficiently, and with a smile Maintaining professional appearance and demeanor at all times Making a positive impression on customers to encourage word-of-mouth referrals Scanning products Conducting cash and inventory control Maintaining displays and ensuring that they are kept stocked and up to company standards Loading and unloading delivery trucks Rotating stock Keeping the store clean (floors, registers, bathrooms, etc.)

item.title: Communications Consultant
item.description: Details: As a Communications Consultant, you will be responsible for providing communication-consulting services to VALIC's strategic clients. You will work closely with members of the Relationship Management and Marketing Strategy to deliver best-in-class participant communication and education programs designed to meet our client's retirement plan goals and objectives. You will report the Vice President, Institutional Marketing. Primary Responsibilities: * Conceptualize and develop content for Communication and Education plans for VALIC Group Retirement clients. * Collaborate with Project Management team, internal strategy and other departments (Product, Compliance, etc.) to promote company initiatives and ensure an integrated communications approach. * Ability to work multiple projects with tight deadlines in a fast-paced, changing environment * Write creative briefs for campaigns or complex projects. * Provide strong project management include execute project plans, manage projects "end-to-end" by managing all resources to ensure the deadlines and client deliverables are met, prepare for engagement reviews and quality assurance procedures, and ensure documents are complete, current and stored appropriately. * Provide consultative direction on client deliverables as required for communications projects, including the customization of materials. * Coordinate team resources within Marketing Strategy and other internal and external partners to deliver on all aspects of an integrated communication and education plan for client relationships * Develop, execute, and monitor participant communication and education projects including print, web, and multi-media while ensuring an efficient process and overall effectiveness of communications * Analyze participant behavior and educational needs to propose best practice solutions and/or custom solutions * Analyze plan-specific materials to develop knowledge of each client's plan provisions and educate business partners as appropriate * Deliver engaging and effective presentations which demonstrate and differentiate VALIC's communication and education capabilities Ideal Candidate Profile * BA/BS required * 5+ years' experience in employee benefits communications and/or financial services strongly preferred * 5+ years' communications consulting experience preferred * Ability to manage long-term communications projects, as well as quick turn-around assignments * Ability to analyze business strategies and develop communications plans and programs to meet customer needs. * High-level verbal and written communications skills necessary to consult on communication planning with all management levels and to direct development of marketing materials with project team * Must have the ability to prepare and deliver verbal presentations * Demonstrated ability in financial services/retirement services marketing * Operate well in a team environment and independently with minimal supervision required * Ability to articulate complex situations simply and in an engaging style * Outstanding project management skills and ability to deliver projects on schedule * Advanced interpersonal skills, including conflict resolution, relationship building and negotiation Travel: Yes, up to 25% About AIG American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading international insurance organization serving customers in more than 130 countries and jurisdictions. AIG companies serve commercial, institutional, and individual customers through one of the most extensive worldwide property-casualty networks of any insurer. In addition, AIG companies are leading providers of life insurance and retirement services in the United States. AIG Property Casualty is a global market leader, one of the few truly global property casualty franchises. AIG Life and Retirement is one of the largest life insurance organizations in the U.S., and provides protection, investment and income solutions needed for financial and retirement security. United Guaranty Corporation is the marketplace leader in mortgage insurance in the U.S. Additional information about AIG can be found at www.aig.com | YouTube : www.youtube.com/aig | Twitter : @AIG_LatestNews | LinkedIn : www.linkedin.com/company/aig

RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE CONTROLLER Inventory/Manufacturing 1. Coordinate physical inventory counts and cycle counts 2. Investigate cycle counting variances and resolve issues 3. item.title: Systems Engineer
item.description: Details: Overview: The main function of a systems engineer is to apply the principles of computer science and mathematical analysis to the design, development, testing, and evaluation of the software and systems that make computers work. A typical systems engineer analyzes user needs, and then designs, tests, and develops software to meet those needs. What you will do: • Modify existing databases and database management systems or direct programmers and analysts to make changes.• Write and code logical and physical database descriptions and specify identifiers of database to management system or direct others in coding descriptions.• Work as part of a project team to coordinate database development and determine project scope and limitations.• Review project requests describing database user needs to estimate time and cost required to accomplish project.
