item.title: Therapist/ Discharge Planner- Full Time
item.description: Details: Job Description Therapist/ Discharge Planner- Full Time(Job Number:00056-5144) Work Location: United States-Florida-Plantation-Plantation General Hospital - Fort Lauderdale Area Schedule: Full-time Description Therapist/ Discharge Planner– Part Time Plantation General Hospital Plantation, FL Facility Description: Plantation General Hospital is a full-service facility that is fully accredited by The Joint Commission and has been providing a range of healthcare services to residents of Plantation and Central Broward County for 45 years. Our nationally recognized centers of excellence specialize in maternity, high risk maternity, pediatrics, pediatric intensive care and Level III neonatal intensive care have earned us a distinguished reputation for quality. Plantation General Hospital is recognized by The Joint Commission as a Primary Stroke Center and as a Center of Excellence in Neonatal services, one of the only three in the nation. We deliver the very best care to our communities and the patients we serve. Plantation General Hospital is a member of the nation’s leading provider of healthcare services, Hospital Corporation of America. HCA Ranks on Fortune’s list of Most Admired Companies for three consecutive years. In addition, HCA has also been named one of Ethisphere’s World’s Most Ethical Companies for four consecutive years. Join our tradition of excellence! Benefits: We offer a generous compensation package for Full-time and Part-time including: vacation, 401k, and Medical Insurance. Job Description: The Therapist/Discharge Planner determines the medical necessity of all admissions and addresses specific behavioral health disorders and treatment modalities for the patient. The Therapist/Discharge Planner assesses the need for continued stay and identifies the provision of inappropriate and untimely services, assesses discharge planning needs for all patients and coordinates the delivery of services to meet those needs, facilitates timely and appropriate discharges from the hospital, identifies opportunities for improvement in patient care, and provides documentation of all functions as required by regulatory agencies. The Therapist/Discharge Planner has the responsibility for clinical review, documentation of abstracted data and communication with third party payors of all selected patients. Qualifications 1-3 years of experience in an inpatient psychiatry setting is preferred. Licensed Mental Health Counselor or Licensed Clinical Social Worker is required. BLS issued by the American Heart Association required Master’s degree in the mental health field is required. PI87018593

item.title: Oracle PL/SQL Developer
item.description: Details: Overview: The candidate will augment and the existing development team allowing us to expand our delivery capability into 2014. The Derivatives Results Database (DRD) collects valuations and trade details from multiple risk and trade capture systems, providing a consolidated source of OTC valuations for downstream departments including Product Control, Collateral, Client Statements, Risk and Prime Services. As one of the world's leading banks, Credit Suisse provides its clients with investment banking, private banking and asset management services worldwide. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has a long tradition of meeting the complex financial needs of a wide range of clients, offering advisory services, comprehensive solutions and innovative products to companies, institutional clients and high-net-worth private clients globally, as well as retail clients in Switzerland. Credit Suisse is active in over 50 countries and employs approximately 45,000 people. Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com. Cultural diversity is essential to our success. As such, we employ people from more than 100 countries. Credit Suisse empowers employees to work openly and respectfully with each other and with clients, ultimately striving to deliver superior results while offering initiatives and programs to assist employees achieve a healthy work-life balance

item.title: Buyer
item.description: Details: F&M MAFCO, Inc., the Powerful Solutions People, a leader in the equipment rental and construction supply distribution industry is seeking an experienced Commodity Buyer . Key responsibilities include negotiating the best price, quality and delivery terms, while sourcing/procuring a wide variety of industrial commodities. Additional challenges include inventory management, establishing vendor relationships and ongoing research of alternative product offerings and vendors. A proven track record in identifying cost reduction measures and development of effective supplier programs is required. This role will support the buying requirements for primarily our Canadian Branch. Qualified candidate will have a minimum of three years purchasing experience in a distribution or resale environment, with emphasis on high volume and fast pace buying. Exposure to the welding, construction and industrial supply distribution industry would be a definite plus. International purchasing experience, including Canada experience, is a definite advantage. We are looking for a team player who displays initiative, along with exceptional negotiation and analytical abilities. A Bachelor's Degree in Materials Management, Procurement or related field; or a combination of commensurate experience training or job related experience. CPSM or APICS certification is preferred but not required. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package with solid potential to excel. If you are interested in joining our team credentials can be: E-mail: Apply online: http://ch.tbe.taleo.net/CH05/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=MAFCO&cws=1&rid=132 EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disability - F&M MAFCO is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or religion or other legally protected status.

item.title: Entry Level Sales Consultant - Hendrick Cary Auto Mall
item.description: Details: JOIN THE WINNING TEAM AT HENDRICK CARY AUTO MALL SCHEDULING INTERVIEWS NOW! Due to tremendous growth, Hendrick Cary Auto Mall located in Cary, NC is seeking talented Sales Consultants to join the team! Hendrick Buick - Cadillac - Fiat - Chevrolet -GMC - Dodge - Kia are members of the Hendrick Automotive Group and all provide a rare blend of outstanding leadership and a culture that is distinctively people-oriented. We offer you a professional working environment with continuous training and performance excellence as a team member of the second largest privately owned dealership groups and the seventh largest automotive group. Hendrick Automotive's mission is to be the premier quality vehicle retailer in the world, providing the best opportunities for our team members, customers, communities, and the manufactures we represent. Hendrick Automotive Group has achieved its mission and remains the industry's leader by following the Hendrick Advantage a set of core values which the company stands by. Summary: The Sales Consultant is responsible for working with customers to identify their vehicle needs, finding the appropriate vehicle to meet their needs while ensuring each customer has a satisfactory dealership experience . Essential Duties and Responsibilities ( including yet not limited to ): Meets dealership sales goals. Maintains Customer Satisfaction scores at or above company standards. Greets customer and determines make, type, and quality of vehicle desired. Explains features and demonstrates operation of vehicle in showroom or on road. Suggests optional equipment for customer to purchase. Computes and quotes sales price, including tax, trade-in allowance, and discount. Completes paperwork accompanying vehicle sales, including but not limited to, preparing sales slip or sales contract. Arranges for delivery and registration of vehicle. Researches availability of models and optional equipment. Engages in business development. Addresses customer concerns. Follows Safeguards rules and regulations.

item.title: Certified Medication Aide - CMA
item.description: Details: Senior Care Centers is the largest and growing long term care and rehabilitation organization in the state of Texas. We focus on delivery of clinical care, while recognizing our customers' right to decide and participate in their overall plan of care. We strive to treat our residents with dignity, respect and empathy. Ultimately our goal is to make their stay worthwhile and enjoyable while they are within our care. JOB TITLE: MEDICATION AIDE REPORTS TO: Charge Nurse/Shift Supervisor RESPONSIBILITIES: Accurately prepare, administer, and observe resident for reaction or side effects and document medications as prescribed. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: · Accurately prepare, administer and document medications as prescribed. Immediately report any errors to Charge Nurse or Director of Nursing. · Accurately take and record vital signs. · Accurately count and sign medication administration record for controlled drugs. · Safely lift, move and transfer residents as required. This involves the ability to safely transfer residents who cannot bear their own weight. It also involves the ability to safely perform movements such as pushing, pulling, lifting, bending, kneeling, reaching and lifting in excess of 150 pounds with or without reasonable accommodations. Manual dexterity required performing tasks in assisting residents with their personal needs. · Observe all residents and report anything unusual or abnormal to Charge Nurse. Ability to safely care for residents with patience and respect despite some resident’s lack of cooperation and/or combativeness. · Follow safety guidelines. Promptly remove and clean up urine or bowel excretions and other spills or safety hazards. · Safely utilize equipment. Report any equipment needing service or repair immediately. · Participate in emergency fire or disaster drills and other in-service training as scheduled. Must be able to safely ascend and descend stairwells and assist in an evacuation. · Follow Universal Safety Precautions in order to protect one self, residents and other staff members. Must have the capability to withstand strong foul odors. Willingness and ability to wear and tolerate protective clothing and equipment needed in the carrying out of duties, i.e. latex gloves. · Must be capable of maintaining regular attendance in accordance with facility absence policies. · Perform Nurse Aide duties, as directed. This requires the ability to perform the essential functions of a Certified Nurse Assistant with or without accommodations. · Promotes positive public relations with patients, residents, family members and guests. · Uses tactful, appropriate communications in sensitive and emotional situations. · Use appropriate work place behavior and adhere to dress code at all times. · Perform other duties as assigned by the Charge Nurse. · Observe for and immediately report to Charge Nurse or Shift Supervisor any noted reactions or side effects of medications. WORK SCHEDULE: As assigned. May require some weekends, holidays or evenings as approved. Non-Exempt position. Physical Requirements: Able to lift 100 pounds, if necessary, to assist fallen resident. Able to lift 50 pounds for routine performance of essential functions. AA/EEO/M/F/D/V

item.title: Truck Driver
item.description: Details: Praxair Distribution, Inc., a subsidiary of Praxair, Inc., a Fortune 250 company that supplies atmospheric, process, specialty gases, high-performance coatings, and related services & technologies is seeking a Truck Driver (CDL A) to join our team located in Muskegon, MI. Praxair Truck Drivers are responsible for safely and efficiently operating a local route delivery vehicle to deliver hard goods, cylinder gas and associated products to customer locations. This Truck Driver opportunity is 1st shift and Truck Drivers are home nights and weekends. The Truck Driver role at Praxair Distribution, Inc. is physically demanding (will be responsible for loading/unloading at client sites) and requires attention to detail and a strong commitment to safety. Praxair Truck Drivers also must be willing to communicate and cooperate with customers, respond to their needs, and safely operate delivery vehicle in compliance with company and DOT Guidelines. Truck Driver •The Truck Driver provides a high standard of Customer Service while delivering hard goods, various size and packages of compressed gas cylinders to customers, this includes unloading of products and movement to customer use point, followed by reloading the returned empty cylinders to the vehicle •Driving represents approximately 30 % of the Truck Driver's day, remaining portion of the day is taken up by other activities including; delivery, cylinder handling, shipping orders/ paperwork, customer contact, vehicle AM and PM inspections •Route Truck Driver responsible for delivery to all types of Industrial, Service, Educational and Medical customers •Responsible for counting and recording quantities and styles of product delivered and picked up to ensure accurate paperwork for customer transactions •Completes Hazardous Material shipping orders papers in accordance with DOT/TC Regulations •Placard vehicle according to required hazardous material regulations and PDI standards •Handheld computers are used for conducting customer transaction paperwork as well as compliance needs such as Hazmat preparation, vehicle inspection reports, load report, trip reports etc. Truck Drivers follow a computer generated Route and Sequence delivery plan. •Conducts and reports pre-trip and post-trip inspections noting and explaining defects or deficiencies to supervision •Identifies need for repairs and/or maintenance to vehicles and is accountable for ensuring the maintenance or repairs are accomplished with a minimum of disruption to the operation •Operates a variety of equipment and regularly interfaces with both internal and external customers

item.description: Details: SCOPE: Under supervision of the physician, provides primary care in collaborative joint practice with the physicians to patients and/or family members. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES : -Assesses, plans, implements and evaluates care for individual patients. -Initiates and documents appropriate interventions; evaluates and records patient/family response within practice protocol; prescribes drug therapies per protocol/physician consultation. -Assists physicians and performs procedures as needed; conducts patient assessments and provides physician with information prior to seeing the patient. -Assesses patient/family needs and provides education. -Promotes wellness and recommends community resources to meet patient and family needs. -Promotes/provides staff education. -Incorporates evidence-based research into clinical practice. -Knowledgeable of reimbursement procedures and documentation requirements. -Completes patient charge tickets. -May mentor new mid-level providers.

item.title: Advanced Practice Nurse
item.description: Details: We are seeking an Advanced Practice Nurse to join our team! This position is part time, 20 hours per week, day shift. This would be rotating days. This position is not benefits eligible. The Advanced Practice Nurse will provide primary and specialty level Palliative Medicine to Midwest CareCenter patients/families dealing with a life-limiting diseases in collaboration with Midwest CareCenter interdisciplinary teams across settings of care. •Work in a collaborative agreement with a designated Palliative medicine specialist •Integrate and collaborate with the Palliative Care Services interdisciplinary team •Provide initial consultation for referring physicians in patient homes, LTC, ALF, and hospitals. •Provide advance practice nursing services to palliative care patients including •Patient assessment – comprehensive or focused as necessary for the patient/family needs •Initial and follow-up clinical care in the patient’s home, including LTC and ALFs •Initial and follow-up clinical care in the hospital(s) •Provide counseling and education to patients and their families to facilitate patient-focused and value-driven healthcare. Facilitate the coordination of care and the discussion of goals of care. •Initiate and monitor symptom management interventions in active collaboration with Palliative MD •Rotate in the call schedule with APNs and Physicians •Serve as the Attending physician for homebound PC and Hospice patients as necessary (ARNP only) •Foster professional relationships with physicians, nursing leadership and staff in all settings of care •Develop and carry out patient management plans within the context of interdisciplinary palliative care team KEY JOB BEHAVIORS Patient Care: Medical care provided to patients in the context of their family that is timely, effective, beneficial, compassionate, and appropriate for the treatment of health problems and the promotion of wellbeing. Within the field of HPM, patients served have advanced illness where patient care is predominantly focused on symptom management and quality of life. The physician gathers accurate essential information from all available sources and integrates the information to formulate an effective medical plan of care that is fully integrated into the intradisciplinary plan of care. Communication Skills: Able to conduct an effective information exchange with patients, their families, and colleagues of all disciplines. Uses appropriate language, communicates respect, particularly for cultural, ethnic, gender, and age-related differences, and demonstrates patience. The Provider uses an interpreter for information sharing when language barriers exist. Uses verbal and nonverbal communication techniques to facilitate patient/family comfort and trust and foster a therapeutic relationship. Written communication (documentation) is timely, thorough, and effective in communicating within the medical record. The Provider is effective to negotiate and resolve conflict and can function effectively as a team member and leader. The Provider demonstrates effectiveness in soliciting and implementing feedback. Professionalism: Punctual and prepared for work demonstrating respectful interactions with patients, families, and colleagues. The Provider uses appropriate dress and language style to communicate such respect. The Provider demonstrates sensitivity to the emotional and spiritual needs of patients/families. The Provider uses appropriate language and humor, maintaining composure under stress. The Provider is conscientious and timely with medical records and overall demonstrates accountability, responsibility and integrity. Clinical Judgment: The Provider uses medical knowledge, scientific evidence and best practice to scrutinize medical information and critically interpret this to formulate a plan of care and action that benefits the patient/family. The Provider applies medical knowledge effectively for clinical problem solving and decision-making. The Provider demonstrates the ability to integrate a holistic approach as well as information from the interdisciplinary team in medical decision-making. Decision-making is timely, effective and respectful of the patient/family integrity. Systems-Based Practice requires residents/fellows to demonstrate an awareness of and responsiveness to the larger context and system of health care, as well as the ability to call effectively on other resources in the system to provide optimal health care. Residents/fellows are expected to: •Work effectively in various health care delivery settings and systems relevant to their clinical specialty; •Coordinate patient care within the health care system relevant to their clinical specialty; •Incorporate considerations of cost awareness and risk benefit analysis in patient care; •Advocate for quality patient care and optimal patient care systems; •Work in interdisciplinary teams to enhance patient safety and improve patient care quality; and •Participate in identifying system errors and in implementing potential systems solutions.

item.title: Clinical Director Home Healthcare
item.description: Details: The Clinical Director is responsible for the overalldirection of home health clinical services. The Clinical Director establishes, implements and evaluates goals andobjectives for home health services that meet and promote the standards ofquality and contribute to the total organization and philosophy. Essential Job Functions/Responsibilities Coordinatesand oversees all direct and indirect patient services provided by clinical organization personnel. Providesguidance and counseling to coordinators and Clinical Supervisors to assist themin continually improving all aspects of home health care services, providedthrough organization personnel. AssistsClinical Supervisors in managing clinical teams and planning. Provideshelp in assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation of patient andfamily/caregiver care to all clinical personnel as indicated. Assiststhe Executive Director/Administrator in the preparation and administration ofthe organization's budget. Interpretsoperational indicators to detect census changes and increases or decreases involume, which could impact staffing levels, revenues or expenses. Evaluatesperformance of Clinical Supervisors. AssistsClinical Supervisors to develop skills and techniques in evaluating theperformance of clinicians. Hires,evaluates, and terminates organization personnel. Conductsclinical performance evaluations annually, or more frequently if indicated. Overseesthe maintenance of patient clinical records, statistics, reports and recordsfor purposes of evaluation and reporting of organization activities. Assuresproper mainte­nance of clinical records in compliance with local, state andfederal laws. Responsiblefor the maintenance of adequate and appropriate inventory supplies andequipment for the provision of patient services. Develops,implements and evaluates the orientation program for new organizationpersonnel. Responsible for orientationof new organization personnel, either directly or by delegating to anotherstaff member. Plansand implements inservice and continuing education programs to meet educationand training needs of organization personnel. Assistswith the evaluation of organization performance via performance improvementprogram, productivity, quarterly and annual reviews. Assures for the quality and safe delivery ofhome health services provided through the Organization. Assistsin the development of organization goals. Develops, recommends, and administers Organization policies andprocedures. Assurescompliance with all local, state and federal laws regarding licensure andcertification of organization personnel and, maintains compliance to the CHAPHome Care standards. Staysinformed about changes in the field of nursing and home health care; sharesinformation with appropriate organization personnel. Promoteshome health referrals in the health care community. Inthe absence of the Executive Director/Administrator, the Clinical Director willbecome the acting Executive Director/Administrator and will be vested withauthority to act in behalf of the Executive Director/Administrator.

item.title: Sr. MVC/WCF Software Engineer
item.description: Details: Job Description JHA Internet Solutions is a leading provider of online and mobile banking products and solutions. These solutions and product are used by over 1200 institutions across the United States. We are currently expanding our software engineering staff levels in support of growing product activities and a transformation of our architecture. The candidate for this position has the opportunity to play a significant role in the development of a banking platform delivered to millions of users across the US through mobile and desktop channels. The ideal candidate will bring energy and strong software engineering skills to the role. Additionally, we operate with a team driven approach and an intense focus on customer service. Being able to be a positive part of the team and keeping the customer central to our products and solutions is critical. In this role the Software Engineer will work on an agile team that can deliver high quality and secure products as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. The Senior Software Engineer will be working with the Jack Henry online applications to deliver new features and functions into the application suite. A focus on internet security development standards and best practices is a plus as we continue to add security features into the online banking experience. The development responsibilities will include creating ASP.NET views in MVC/Razor utilizing CSS and jQuery/javascript, and developing business layer logic in a WCF service. Associates at Jack Henry enjoy excellent benefits and work life balance. We have excellent interstate access in Lenexa KS. JHA is a successful, stable and growing company, with a strong belief in our core values anchored by a passion for customer service. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 5 years experience working in an I.T. environment 3 years experience working with C# .NET development in Framework 4 or newer PREFERRED SKILLS: Experience with WCF web services. Familiarity with Microsoft Unit Testing tools, including MS Test and MS Fakes. Experience with source-control management systems, particularly Microsoft TFS. Experience creating ASP.NET views in MVC/Razor utilizing CSS and jQuery/javascript. A strong desire to transform and modernize a large scale and widely used online banking product portfolio Fluency in best practices for web-based software architecture and design, and major software design patterns. A strong ability to conceptualize user needs and translate these needs into optimum design Exceptional communicator Experience in business process design and improvement. Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college and/or university with a focus on (Computer Science, Information Technology or Software Engineering Demonstrated ability to make informed decisions quickly and leverage communication abilities to implement them. Passionate self-starter who can be innovative, detailed-oriented and an enthusiastic team player Capability to think strategically, research new trends, and apply them to the Jack Henry environment Equal Employment Opportunity Applicants for U.S. based positions with Jack Henry & Associates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Jack Henry & Associates, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and maintains a Drug-Free Workplace. EOE-M/F/Vet/Disability

item.title: Progressive Maintenance Planner
item.description: Details: Progressive Maintenance Planner Fair Lawn, NJ Plant Last revised: October 1st, 2014 Mondelēz International is a whole new company that has been reimagined with a single focus in mind: create delicious moments of joy by sharing the world’s favorite brands. Launched on Oct. 1, 2012, and employing around 100,000 people around the world, Mondelēz International comprises the global snacking and food brands of the former Kraft Foods Inc. While Mondelēz International is new, our brands are as diverse and rich with heritage as the 170 countries in which our products are marketed. As the world’s pre-eminent maker of snacks, Mondelēz International has leading shares in every category and every region of the world in which it competes. The company holds the No. 1 position globally in Biscuits, Chocolate, Candy and Powdered Beverages as well as the No. 2 position in Gum and Coffee. Mondelēz International portfolio includes several billion-dollar brands such as Nabisco, Oreo and LU biscuits, Cadbury and Milka chocolate, Jacobs coffee, Tang powdered beverages and Trident gums. Mondelēz International has annual revenue of approximately $35 billion and operations in more than 80 countries. For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational Leadership Requirements: The Maintenance Planner is responsible for accurately and effectively scheduling preventative and predictive maintenance activities for multiple skilled trade craftspeople in an assigned area. The Planner will align to the plant Safety, Quality, Cost, Delivery, Sanitation and Morale metrics. This position will partner with the Operations FLL and BUL to ensure proper asset care and reliability. The Maintenance Planner is also responsible for maintaining, updating and improving the SAP plant maintenance system, creating PM tasks, entering new assets and maintaining accurate equipment BOMs.The Maintenance Planner will also purchase non-MRO parts and manage assigned contract service purchase orders. This position will lead special / capital projects in conjunction with engineering and operations. The Planner will advise and mentor the Maintenance FLL. The following bullets summarize the key responsibilities: • Prioritize and Drive Safety Work Order Completion with Upmost Urgency • Responsible for planning and scheduling preventative and predictive maintenance activities • Schedules PM activities to align with 8 week planning cycle • Ensure no Safety Work Orders are Open longer than 14 Days and Emergency Orders are Addressed Immediately • Ensure CBM Work Orders are not open longer than 14 days • Ensure Work Notifications are scheduled in 5 days or less • Maintains controlled backlog hours to a goal of 2 weeks per tradesperson • Accurately maintains and updates manufacturing equipment bill of materials • Ensures proper workload is scheduled for skilled trade personnel • Responsible for kitting all parts / tools for scheduled maintenance activities* • Partners with Operations FLL and BUL to provide comprehensive asset care program • Accurately forecast Purchased Maintenance spending • Support Quality department in Audit processes • Develop strategies for improving department & plant KPIs • Work with Vendors to resolve or improve spare parts deficiencies • Coordinate plant annual shutdown activities • Partners with the Business Unit Leader and is the Plant Liaison for OEM service visits, training and programs. • Train FLL and Hourly associates on SAP plant maintenance software • Weekends and OT as needed • Other duties as assigned Core Mondelez Lominger Competencies: • Drive for results - delivers results consistently, tasks completed in a timely fashion, enthusiasm to accomplish tasks. • Confronting direct reports - comfortable delivering negative messages; deals with problems quickly, sets high standards, challenges employees. • Customer Focus - supports business needs and behaves like an owner to support BULs and other FLL, acts with a sense of urgency. • Directing Others - delegates well, clear in communications to direct reports, sets goals, objectives, or targets. • Informing - consistent communications, realizes the data needs of others, good follow through Problem Solving – uses logic and methods to solve problems, honest analysis of data, utilizes others for best solution. Motivating Others – employees like working for the MSL, makes individuals feel their work is important, empowers others. Process Management – figures out process to get things done, can organize people and activities, knows what to measure and how to measure it. Priority Setting – creates focus, eliminates roadblocks, and uses time on what’s important. Dealing with Ambiguity – can cope with change, can decide and act without having the total picture. Planning and organizing – able to scope out length and difficulty of tasks, develops schedules and assignments, measures performance against goals, can marshal resources to get things done Organizational Agility – gets things done through formal and informal channels, Interpersonal savvy – builds appropriate rapport with all kinds of people to establish constructive and effective relationships

item.title: Tax Manager

item.title: Community Relationship Loan Officer
item.description: Details: American Founders Bank is seeking an experienced lender to fill the role of Community Relationship Officer in the Louisville Market. This loan officer will work closely with businesses and individuals in the community to help them acquire credit for personal or professional needs. This position will promote growth through the development of small business and consumer loans, deposits and fee-based services, and the development and retention of new and existing customers. The CRO will be responsible and accountable for leading all activities within a financial center and provide clients and the public with “above and beyond" banking services. This individual will also manage delinquencies, collections, and net income of the center. AFB offers a competitive compensation package. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES • Oversee complete commercial or consumer loan process by establishing relationships, identifying needs, making recommendations and closing the deal. • Consistently meet and exceed growth and net income targets as set by senior management. • Create a strong sales environment by setting the example in regards to identifying leads and solicitation strategy. • Promote the bank and its products/services in the community by making regular outside calls, acting as leaders of organizations and being a good citizen. • Provide leadership to Financial Center associates by ensuring that active solicitation of current clients and new clients are taking place in the center. • Develop and maintain close relationships with other departments of the Bank, such as Marketing, Secondary Market, Credit Administration, and Operations to ensure that Financial Center goals are met. • Set priorities, direct and delegate sales, marketing responsibilities to Personal Banker and other staff, and ensure follow through on the completion/implementation of the designated sales activities. • Hold team responsible for the ability to interchange duties as necessary. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES • Directly supervise Personal Banker(s). Ultimately responsible for all Financial Center associates service levels, production and development. • Responsible for giving associates timely, candid and constructive feedback, including preparation of performance evaluations. • Develop associates to their full potential giving them the opportunity to for career growth within the bank. • Recognize and reward associates for accomplishments. MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED • Must be able to establish productive business interpersonal relationships with others inside and outside the organization and to work with little direct supervision in carrying out the responsibilities assigned. • Must have working knowledge of Microsoft Office products and Internet Explorer. • Must have excellent written and oral communication skills. Must have ability to develop conversation with the public confidently and initiate sales dialogue. • Must have flexibility in working schedule; may be required to work weekends and/or extended hours. Reliable attendance is critical. • Ability to operate standard business equipment: fax, copiers, printers, calculators, computers, etc. • Ability to present professional image. • Ability to handle sensitive documents or other confidential information. • Ability to work well under pressure. • Ability to perform multiple job functions and tasks with minimum supervision. • Ability to communicate and work well with all levels of employees, officers, and directors. • Must have attention to detail, and ability to meet deadlines and deal tactfully with customers. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE • Bachelor degree in Business Management, Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field. Degree may be substituted for equivalent combination of education and experience. • Five or more years experience in a sales environment preferred. • Five or more years experience in small business and/or consumer lending preferred. • Demonstrated ability to supervise and provide guidance within the banking industry. • Comprehensive understanding of Bank policies and procedures, lending procedures and credit policies, and governing bodies’ regulatory rules and regulations. WORKING CONDITIONS / PHYSICAL DEMANDS • Normal office environment with little exposure to dust, noise, temperature and the like. • Sitting for long periods. • Standing, bending, and lifting up to 20 pounds. • Operation of standard business equipment such as calculators, fax machines, computer printer, and photocopiers. • Extended viewing of CRT screen. • Occasional travel to branch offices, seminars, and various training courses may be required. All of the above duties and responsibilities are essential job functions for which reasonable accommodation will be made. All job requirements listed indicate the minimum level of knowledge, skills and/or ability deemed necessary to perform the job proficiently. This position description is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Employees may be required to perform any other job-related instructions as requested by their supervisor, subject to reasonable accommodation. Federal law requires that we hire U.S. citizens or aliens authorized to work in the United States. If you are selected for hire, you will be required to provide documentary evidence of your identity and eligibility to work in the United States. EOE F/M/Vet/Disabled, EEO Employer/Vet/Disabled This Employer Participates in E-Verify Benefits: Medical Insurance, Life Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Paid Vacation, Paid Sick Days, Paid Holidays, Short Term Disability, Long Term Disability, 401K/403b Plan, Educational Assistance

item.description: Details: Ref ID: 03930-124719 Classification: Systems Administrator Compensation: $57,273.99 to $70,000.00 per year The duties of the Systems Administrator include, but are not limited to the following: 1. Build and configure web portals, integrate business applications and manage deployment of collaborative solutions. 2. Responsible for developing and distributing reports and information. 3. Interfacing with data users, from multiple departments to determine data needs, develop custom reports, and produce routine reports. Provides technical support and guidance to users. 4. Upgrade to SQL and SharePoint systems by conferring with Chief Information Officer and IT team members. Installs new software releases, system upgrades, evaluates and installs patches and resolves software related problems. Recommends upgrades, patches and new applications and equipment 5. Identify, research, correct, and resolve data/report problems along with data mining. Troubleshoots network performance issues. 6. Actively reviews processes to ensure efficiency, automate tasks, and make recommendations to increase efficiency levels. Performs system backups and recovery. 7. Write complex SQL queries, construct relational tables, perform design and output testing, create stored procedures, and produce involved SSRS reports. 8. Adhering to Network Security along with IT Department procedures and guidelines for network integrity. 9. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations. 10. Protects organizations value by keeping information confidential. 11. Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments. 12. Sets up, configures, and supports internal and/or external networks. 13. Develops and maintains all systems, applications, security and network configuration. 14. Maintains data files and monitors system configuration to ensure data integrity. 15. Perform other duties as assigned by management. EDUCATION AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Bachelors degree or commensurate work experience in Information Technology. Microsoft MCP, MCDBA, MCIT, or SharePoint certifications preferable. System Administration, Developing Standards, Training, Multi-tasking experience required. Security + Certification highly desired. Microsoft Exchange Certification highly desired. Microsoft Server Administration Certification highly desired. EXPERIENCE: 4+ years experience as part of an IT Operations team. Direct experience in dealing with vendors, carriers, vendors, call centers, and remote operations. Experience with data center technologies, including servers, network, voice, data, and wireless. Microsoft technologies experience. Cisco technologies experience. Server technology experience is highly desired! Proven experience in IT operations. Must have a strong dedication to customer service WORKING CONDITIONS: This is a full time position. Most duties will be performed at the company's Troy address. A flexible schedule based on demand for services is required but daily-extended hours or weekend work may be required. May have to travel to satellite location to perform service calls. EQUIPMENT USE: Must be able to use computers, computer network, basic hand tools for laying cable, user and technical manuals, etc. This job description is not an employment agreement or contract. Management has the exclusive right to alter this job description at any time without notice.

item.title: Certified Medication Aide - CMA
item.description: Details: Senior Care Centers is the largest and growing long term care and rehabilitation organization in the state of Texas. We focus on delivery of clinical care, while recognizing our customers' right to decide and participate in their overall plan of care. We strive to treat our residents with dignity, respect and empathy. Ultimately our goal is to make their stay worthwhile and enjoyable while they are within our care. JOB TITLE: MEDICATION AIDE REPORTS TO: Charge Nurse/Shift Supervisor RESPONSIBILITIES: Accurately prepare, administer, and observe resident for reaction or side effects and document medications as prescribed. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: · Accurately prepare, administer and document medications as prescribed. Immediately report any errors to Charge Nurse or Director of Nursing. · Accurately take and record vital signs. · Accurately count and sign medication administration record for controlled drugs. · Safely lift, move and transfer residents as required. This involves the ability to safely transfer residents who cannot bear their own weight. It also involves the ability to safely perform movements such as pushing, pulling, lifting, bending, kneeling, reaching and lifting in excess of 150 pounds with or without reasonable accommodations. Manual dexterity required performing tasks in assisting residents with their personal needs. · Observe all residents and report anything unusual or abnormal to Charge Nurse. Ability to safely care for residents with patience and respect despite some resident’s lack of cooperation and/or combativeness. · Follow safety guidelines. Promptly remove and clean up urine or bowel excretions and other spills or safety hazards. · Safely utilize equipment. Report any equipment needing service or repair immediately. · Participate in emergency fire or disaster drills and other in-service training as scheduled. Must be able to safely ascend and descend stairwells and assist in an evacuation. · Follow Universal Safety Precautions in order to protect one self, residents and other staff members. Must have the capability to withstand strong foul odors. Willingness and ability to wear and tolerate protective clothing and equipment needed in the carrying out of duties, i.e. latex gloves. · Must be capable of maintaining regular attendance in accordance with facility absence policies. · Perform Nurse Aide duties, as directed. This requires the ability to perform the essential functions of a Certified Nurse Assistant with or without accommodations. · Promotes positive public relations with patients, residents, family members and guests. · Uses tactful, appropriate communications in sensitive and emotional situations. · Use appropriate work place behavior and adhere to dress code at all times. · Perform other duties as assigned by the Charge Nurse. · Observe for and immediately report to Charge Nurse or Shift Supervisor any noted reactions or side effects of medications. WORK SCHEDULE: As assigned. May require some weekends, holidays or evenings as approved. Non-Exempt position. Physical Requirements: Able to lift 100 pounds, if necessary, to assist fallen resident. Able to lift 50 pounds for routine performance of essential functions. AA/EEO/M/F/D/V

item.title: Internal Medicine Physician
item.description: Details: Internal Medicine Physician POSITION SUMMARY Provides comprehensive medical services for adult members of family. Services include: primary care and treatment, Preventative care, Immunizations, health education, prescribing of medications, ordering or interpreting lab testing, physical examinations, STD screenings, Vision/hearing, family planning, and nutrition. The mission of SJWCFC is to provide medical, dental and mental health services to underserved and uninsured persons in South Los Angeles. Provider may be used in a variety of locations depending upon the need of the organization. Occasional evening and Saturday shifts. No hospital calls or rounds. Available to travel to clinics upon short notice on urgent situations to serve our patients. Providers work some evenings and at least two Saturdays a month as scheduled (unless designated on-call provider at a clinic). Duties and Responsibilities: Reviews patient file/record, including allergies, problems, medications and immunization status. Elicits and records information about patient’s medical history. Examines patients for symptoms or physical information. Orders or executes various tests, analyses and diagnostic images to provide information on patient’s condition. Analyzes reports and findings of tests and examination and diagnoses condition of patient. Administers or prescribes treatments. Determines and prescribes medication, dosage and schedule given the patient’s condition and allergies. Discusses any possible side effects to medication or immunization with patient. Prescribes vaccinations to immunize patient from communicable diseases. Promotes health by advising patients about diet, hygiene and methods for prevention of disease. Performs surgical procedures commensurate with surgical competency. Refers patients to medical specialist for consultant services when necessary for patient’s well-being. Documents the patient’s visit including medical history, physical exam, diagnoses and plan of action. Follows up with patient regarding progress in high risk or emergency cases. Conducts physical examinations to provide information needed for admission to school, consideration for jobs, or eligibility for insurance coverage. Administer Family Planning services in compliance with title X Rules and Regulations/Protocols. Reviews and audits health charts of patients who receive Family Planning services. Commitment to mission of St. John’s with clinic involvement and engaging in healthcare community events Provider goals: sees minimum of twenty-five patients per day subject to clinic goals Providers schedule: works twenty-six Saturday’s per year to provide coverage and subject to clinic goals and some evenings

item.title: Business Analyst
item.description: Details: Our client is a leading global consulting firm in McLean, VA. They're looking for an experienced Business Analyst (BA) to conduct an information gathering exercise to document the capabilities of a legacy ColdFusion application and its associated business processes. The system was originally implemented in 2006, and various factors have made maintenance of this legacy application increasingly difficult. The ultimate goal is to either rewrite or replace this system with a COTS solution, and we are beginning with a full requirements capture effort. The BA will formally document the business process and system requirements by interviewing subject matter experts and studying how the MWA system functions today. The scope is not limited to the existing capabilities of the legacy system, and the BA is expected to leverage his or her expertise to identify areas for possible improvements and record them as enhancement requests. The final deliverable needs to be highly detailed, including but not limited to wireframes, process flow diagrams, pseudo-code for complex business logic, data models, data validation rules, values for drop-downs, field widths, etc. There should be sufficient detail that an application developer can consume the information and begin immediately to design and code the application.

item.title: Sybase Applications Analyst
item.description: Details: Job Description If you are an experienced Sybase Applications Analyst looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some of the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for a Sybase Applications Analyst. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you! Sybase Applications Analyst Job Responsibilities Your specific duties as a Sybase Applications Analyst will include: Design storage strategies around backup and recovery for complex Sybase database environments, physical structures, and specialized database applications. Analyze performance of existing databases, recommend and follow implementation of tuning to enhance this performance. Monitor and correct all database maintenance jobs/activities. Assist in the design of new databases for project needs Partner with project teams and interact with customers to find solutions for projects and operational issues for existing and proposed databases Act as business liaison serving as primary point of contact between application business segments and physical database administrators Administration of Sybase Distributed implementations, including database definition, structure, documentation, and long-range requirements Demonstrate the knowledge and ability to perform in all of the basic database management skills of database administration, Web connectivity, physical structure, overall architecture, and database analysis Provide standardization and consistency across environments Ensure a stable, optimized and secure database environment Apply database management consulting skills and gathers user requirements Implement and monitor database functionality to ensure stable environments Utilize expertise in Sybase database within a team environment

item.title: Customer Service / Telemarketing Representative
item.description: Details: Announcing a great opportunity to work in a positive, team-oriented, and fun environment! Kelly Services is currently recruiting for customer service positions in an office environment in Jamestown, NC. In this role, you will: - Interact with customers via outbound phone calls using scripts - If customer is interested in more information, then you will transfer the call - Make notes regarding phone conversations (ie. left message, not interested, etc.) - Hand write note (script will be provided) on a postcard if customer is not available We are looking for people who are very detail-oriented and are able to multitask effectively in a working environment. Other requirements include:- Previous customer service/telemarketing experience - Excellent verbal and writing skills - Ability to communicate clearly with customer base - Shift will be scheduled in the afternoons/evenings and will be about 10-12 hours/week- This position is temporary

item.title: User Experience Developer
item.description: Details: What Drives You? Career paths with opportunities to learn vital roles and skills? Meaningful work in a stable, promote-from-within organization? Professional satisfaction and helping others A workspace that is dynamic, fast, fun, and challenging? Along with early adoption, developers are given everything they need to be successful with these emerging technologies, including access to online training videos as well as in-person training. DriveTime is an agile organization with several teams that have recently migrated from Scrum (which was in place for 5 years) to Kanban in an effort to reduce overhead and bring the development side of the organization closer to the business side. Because of this relationship, our product owners have complete buy-in to producing quality software and understand how software and the development processes allow them to create competitive advantages and improve their business processes and capabilities. Job Description and Responsibilities Develop scenarios, task flows, wireframes, and mockups to effectively conceptualize and communicate detailed interaction behaviors and high-level design strategies for all devices. Presents recommendations to business stakeholders and technical teams to influence decisions that create the best user experience. Own the user interface design including concepts, wireframes, visual design, and interaction design Design web and mobile comps which will translate cross-browser and cross-device while ensuring a cohesive modern aesthetic and clean look/feel in all design elements. Design web and mobile experiences from initial concept, storyboarding and layout to design and hand-off to development, guiding through production deployment Work closely with Product Managers, other Designers and Engineers to create world-class UX Participate in ongoing customer research, interviews and on-site visits in order to fully grasp the needs of our users first hand. Demonstrate the ability to execute Design work with a high standard for quality within time and technical constraints.

item.title: Sales Associate in Training
item.description: Details: Amazing Sales Career Opportunity!! Are you an extremely motivated/high intense individual? Are you looking to make a career change? Are you a recent college graduate looking to start your career endeavor? Are you looking for an extraordinary career opportunity which puts you in control of driving your personal income potential to six figures plus? If you have said "YES" to any of the above, then we have an opportunity that you must check out!! Our opportunity includes the following:  Within the first 30 days of employment, the company will provide you with the chance to obtain your real estate license which includes PAYING FOR and supporting you through the process!  A comprehensive national sales training program which will provide you with the tools and resources to be successful in this profession!  The chance to be a member of a top notch sales organization, a growing division, and a profitable company!  High income earning potential and a competitive benefits program including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k)! DON’T MISS OUT!! We are currently interviewing candidates today to get started in our training program. Please email your resume to Please also visit www.richmondamerican.com to learn more about the company.

item.title: Wind Turbine Travel Technician
item.description: Details: The Job: Perform mechanical, electrical and hydraulic component maintenance and repair Perform component retrofits and upgrades Perform preventive maintenance Perform daily operations Perform large component replacement Provide a quality service to customers Follow all safety procedures and site rules Pay attention to detail Act responsibly and professionally whether on or off site Complete daily job tasks in a safe and timely manner Work with a diverse group of individuals and be a team player Properly use and care for company property

item.title: Inside Sales/Account Manager
item.description: Details: Who are we? Regus is the world's largest provider of flexible workplaces, with products and services ranging from fully equipped offices to professional meeting rooms, business lounges and the world's largest network of video communication studios. Regus enables people to work their way, whether it's from home, on the road or from an office. Customers such as Google, GlaxoSmithKline and Nokia join hundreds of thousands of growing small and medium businesses that benefit from outsourcing their office and workplace needs to Regus, allowing them to focus on their core activities. Over 900,000+ customers a day benefit from Regus facilities spread across a global footprint of 2,000 locations in 600 cities and 100 countries, which allow individuals and companies to work wherever, however and whenever they want to. Regus was founded in Brussels, Belgium in 1989, is headquartered in Luxembourg and listed on the London Stock Exchange. For more information please visit: www.regus.com As a company committed to growth our long term success depends on the skill, determination and ingenuity of our team members. We highly value productivity and we encourage and reward imitative. Helping our people fulfill their potential is core and it is why we offer comprehensive training and development programs. As a company we're passionate about providing our customers with the very best service, making their success our success. As such we look for people who share our drive, our ambition and our vision. Regus is looking for self-motivated and experienced inside sales professionals. Our team desires professionals who want a long term sales career, not just a job. Regus offers a competitive base pay, uncapped commissions, 401K, and a comprehensive health benefit package. The Regus Inside Sales/Account Manager is responsible for the qualification of incoming inquiries and ongoing prospect management and to support the overall growth of all Regus product lines for Regus North America. The Regus Account Manager manages the sales process and supports the field sales team from when the inquiry is generated to when it closes. Essential Duties Manage sales process from lead/enquiry development, schedule sales tours, marketing and selling of all product lines, negotiating and closing deals with prospective customers. Make outbound calls to existing and prospective customers including follow-up calls to qualify and close business. Collect, generate, and track customer enquiries from prospect through to close. Accurately and efficiently deal with all sales inquiries in a timely manner and record in the relevant CRM system. Collaborate with field-based center teams to provide customer service, accuracy, and quality in setting sales, marketing and profitability for the Center. Cooperate effectively with other sales functions, GM, OM, CAM and product sales. Manage time efficiently to achieve goals related to phone system usage. Recommend improvements that will positively impact sales and efficiency. Perform other duties as assigned. Preferred Experience College degree preferred but not required. A minimum of 3-4 years of business to business sales experience, selling on the telephone or in a call center environment with demonstrated success. Excellent telephone selling skills including clear communication, fast responses, quick thinking and an outgoing personality that translates over the phone. Highly competent in objection handling Self starter who can work with direction but little supervision. Familiarity with computer and applications such as MS Office, email and CRM systems. Willingness to go beyond the job description to meet business goals.

item.title: Staff Accountant
item.description: Details: At GAF, putting a roof over your head is the foundation of our business. As we continue to pursue the excellence that has led us to the top, one thing is constant- it’s all the best in the industry, and it’s made by the best people in the industry. GAF products have been designed and made for more than 125 years by talent and innovation emanating from the minds of its employees. All 3,200 of us are champions of our values, some of which include innovation, safety, quality, and integrity, and we work for a company that rewards us for it. That’s why we’ve grown into a $3 billion leader in the building materials industry. Come build your future as we build the American dream - one roof at a time. SUMMARY This position will be responsible for assisting in the coordination of the monthly close of the general ledger system and the year-end audits, oversee the general ledger system- including chart of accounts maintenance, preparation of various journal entries, analysis, and reconciliations. This position will work on various projects as required as well as participate in the design, planning, and implementation of process improvements. This position will provide support to the accountants in the field and various other departments within the company. The candidate should be proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word. Knowledge of intercompany accounting, consolidations, foreign currency, and People Soft is a plus. Previous experience in general or corporate accounting is required. CPA or candidate preferred. The successful candidate should be able to work independantly or as part of the team, be well organized, have the ability to recognize an issue and dig into the details of the transactions to identify the cause, and have the ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment. Must be detail oriented. ESSENTIAL DUTIES Monthly closing, journal entries, ad-hoc analysis Account analysis and reconciliations Year-end audit Special projects, process improvements, system maintenance, other duties as required Please note: This position will be locating to our new headquarters in Parsippany, NJ in January 2015

item.title: TECHNICAL WRITER – SUPPORT COMMUNICATIONS
item.description: Details: ALLDATA – The Company of Choice ALLDATA® is an AutoZone® company and is the leading provider ofautomotive repair information and solutions to the professional automotiveservice industry. Thousands of professional repair and collision shops acrossNorth America depend on ALLDATA’s software products for service & repairinformation, shop management and customer relations solutions. ALLDATA® is building a team that will develop a complete suite ofmobile enabled products and services for all of our products. Be part of a talented team working with thelatest technology to create world class software products. We recognize that our success directly depends on the success ofour employees. If you enjoy working in a team-oriented, cooperative,challenging and rewarding environment, ALLDATA® may be the place for you. We are one of the largest employers in theCity of Elk Grove, CA with 300 plus employees in our Elk Grove facility andover 100 employees in the field. We alsohave employees in Germany, Canada and Mexico. We are looking for individuals committed to maintaining ourposition as the leader in our market. ALLDATA® is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are presently hiring for multipletechnology, sales, content production and operations positions. We offer: Competitive Pay & flexible work schedules Full Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, STD, LTD, Adoption assistance, Tuition reimbursement, Life Insurance) Stock Grants (for eligible positions) & Employee Stock Purchase Plan Full work-out facility on the premises for use by our employees and their families Free Coffee and Tea supplied by company AutoZone store discounts & other discount programs including new vehicle purchases Employee Incentives (i.e. professional sporting events tickets, movie tickets etc.) Special Recognition programs & annual employee fun / community events Access to ALLDATA Online Well-Being Program developed to promote whole-being wellness awareness, including but not limited to: Mental Health/Stress Management, Physical Health/Fitness, Conflict Resolution, Financial Management and Personal Development PositionSummary: The Technical Writer - Support Communications position is responsible forcreating clear and accurate support materials that present technicalinformation in a user-friendly format for non-technical users. TechnicalWriters are responsible for creating and maintaining positive, on-goingrelationships with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) throughout the company inorder to research and create thorough and timely support materials. The most important duty of this job is writing support materials thatenable the busy automotive professional to get the necessary information andget back to work, minimizing the time that they are unable to use their ALLDATAproduct(s). Our customers want support information that is straightforward,easy-to-read and requires little to no computer technical skills to follow.Providing this type of information is imperative to our ability to provide thehigh level of customer support that ALLDATA is known for. PrimaryAccountabilities: · Explainingand/or describing processes in a concise and professional written formatappropriate for non-technical customers. Impeccable proofreading andcopyediting skills are a must. · InterviewingSMEs and cross-functional teams to gather, author and publish information onnew and existing products and services. · UsingMS Office, Windows OS, WYSIWYG editors and screen capture tools to publishsupport materials. Learning and using new systems as needed in a time-efficientmanner. · Incorporatinga focus on formatting and graphics into the creation of a useful, user-friendlyUI/UX (User Interface/User Experience). · Managingthe workload between multiple projects at any given time and reprioritizingtasks quickly and proactively as needed.

item.title: B2B Sales Representative (Outbound Sales)
item.description: Details: B2B Sales Representative (Outbound Sales) Represent Facebook and other top brand name companies. Apply today and start as soon as December 1st! Walk-ins encouraged Monday - Friday from 9am to 3pm at 16404 N Black Canyon Hwy Suite 100 Phoenix, AZ 85053 **This opportunity will require you to work in Phoenix, AZ** Dynamic, verbally gifted, aggressive Business to Business Sales Professionals, here is your opportunity to reap the rewards of your customer service driven, results oriented approach! Warm Leads Provided! We are looking for fantastic people like you for our North Phoenix, AZ location! item.title: Sr. Project Managers and Business Analysts
item.description: Details: SmartIT is actively seeking a Sr. Project Managers and Business Analysts for an organization experiencing massive growth. These are full-time, W2 positions, so please, no third parties. As a Project Manager, this individual is responsibleto simultaneously manage and deliver one or more medium to large projectsaccording to the project’s agreed upon scope, schedule, budget, and qualityobjectives. The Project Manager willparticipate in the establishment of those parameters in order to assure theviability of the commitments being made. The Project Manager will accomplishthis by correctly tailoring and applying the principles and processes that composestandard project management methodology and by applying strongleadership and communications skills to enable each project team member tosuccessfully execute their assigned individual and team tasks. As a Business Analyst, this individual isresponsible for identifying, analyzing, and understanding business needs andpain points, identifying solutions to meet those needs, and translating thoseinto specific deliverable requirements. The BA will be the primary owner of project scope, requirements, andbusiness design, and will serve as the liaison between business and technicalstakeholders. The Retail Banking line of business is anoutsourced-delivery model, so vendor management experience is required. The ideal candidate will have a proven trackrecord of managing vendor-delivery of application development projects. Overtime may be required, on a limited basis andwith prior approval. Some travel(10-20%) will be required. PROJECT MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITIES: Project Initiation Plan and facilitate the project kickoff with internal and external teams. Champion the project through internal demand management and prioritization processes. Project Planning Lead the creation of overall project plan, including cost and schedule, across multiple teams and vendors Collaborate with resource managers to perform resource planning and assignments. Develop additional necessary management plans including all appropriate artifacts (e.g. Charter, Communication Plan, Change Management Plan, Risk Management Plan). Communicate plans and commitments to all impacted parties. Manage project tracking and documentation in Clarity in accordance with PMO guidelines. Project Execution/Control Manage project execution against plan, including cost and schedule. Update plan as needed. Manage project scope, issues, risks, and changes. Prioritize and promptly address new or unresolved issues, risks, and proposed changes. Escalate and delegate as appropriate. Communicate project status and action information formally to a wide audience including, business, IT, and vendors per the communication plan. Facilitate correct recording of project effort and any other required metrics. Assure consistent application of the approved project management methodology. Project Closeout Complete detailed post-project review & identify changes to improve overall project delivery. Communicate the results to all impacted parties. Facilitate administrative closure of all component projects in the system of record. Properly archive project documentation. Communicate closure to impacted parties. People/Resource Management Promote effective team interaction and collaboration. Provide feedback for staff development activities as requested. Facilitate project team interaction across multiple, global sites. Facilitate all applicable stakeholder interests while effectively and efficiently managing the overall project. Mentor less skilled Project Managers Process Improvement Apply lessons learned through post-project reviews. Cultivate an awareness of current industry trends in order to identify potential improvements to the project management process. Analyze existing PM processes for improvement opportunities. Submit the most promising ones to the PMO for evaluation and potential implementation. BUSINESS ANALYSIS RESPONSIBILITIES: Plan and facilitate sessions to identify and document business current state, future needs, and pain points Conduct analysis activities as necessary to develop specific requirements to support business objectives Translate requirements into detailed specifications Create and secure acceptance of requirements documents Actively participate in identifying solutions to satisfy the objectives of the project Participate in project planning activities Ensure continued understanding of requirements and scope throughout project lifecycle Maintain documentation and project artifacts Assist with test planning and execution Help drive resolution to all project issues, risks, and changes Assure consistent application of all Sallie Mae processes and methodology MINIMUM EDUCATION: Bachelor’s Degree(or higher) in Project Management, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, orother Technology field. Equivalent workexperience may substitute for minimum education level. EXPERIENCE: 5-10 yearsexperience as a project manager in an enterprise technology environment for aFortune 500 financial services company. 7years experience working as a business analyst in a similar environment. Experience can overlap. Minimum 5 years experience managing multiplelarge-scale projects that encompass diverse business and technology areas. Must Have: Experience working with cross-functional teams Experience managing projects in a vendor-outsourced environment Experience managing application development projects Proven project planning skills. Demonstrated ability to drive cross-functional teams to meet aggressive deadlines, utilizing sound project management methodology (processes, best practices, tools, and templates). Successful history managing and influencing project teams who do not directly report to you and/or are simultaneously working on multiple unrelated projects. Demonstrated ability to develop strong, collaborative relationships in a highly-matrixed organization (business and technology departments) to drive business results. Proven experience managing scope and internal/external expectations through effective negotiation and partnering. Preferred: PMP Certification IIBA Certification KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS,and ABILITIES: Must Have: Knowledge of SDLC and Business Analysis methodologies Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Interviewing and meeting facilitation skills. Strong leadership skills to lead and motivate teams to execute under aggressive timelines. Ability to understand and integrate technical and business visions and communicate the appropriate level of detail to both technical and non-technical parties. Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to provide clear recommendations based on results Strong competency with one or more project management methodologies Excellent interpersonal, written and oral communication skills. Outstanding time management and organization skills. Outstanding problem solving and conflict resolution skills. Competent to use the MS Office Suite in a business environment. Competency in one or more project scheduling tools Demonstrated ability to build constructive relationships with team members and customers. Strong business acumen, strategic insight and confidence required to anticipate, mitigate, negotiate and resolve conflicts within the project team. Persuasive/engaging communication skills, including the ability to present business and technical issues, ideas, and recommendations clearly in verbal, written and presentation formats Preferred: Data Diagramming Use Cases Requirements Traceability Competency in the use of Open Workbench project scheduler Experience with Microsoft SharePoint

item.title: B2B Sales Representative (Outbound Sales)
item.description: Details: B2B Sales Representative (Outbound Sales) Represent Facebook and other top brand name companies. Apply today and start as soon as December 1st! Walk-ins encouraged Monday - Friday from 9am to 3pm at 16404 N Black Canyon Hwy Suite 100 Phoenix, AZ 85053 **This opportunity will require you to work in Phoenix, AZ** Dynamic, verbally gifted, aggressive Business to Business Sales Professionals, here is your opportunity to reap the rewards of your customer service driven, results oriented approach! Warm Leads Provided! We are looking for fantastic people like you for our North Phoenix, AZ location! We are Revana, a leader in outsourced sales and marketing solutions serving some of the world’s most prestigious brand names. We are seeking Outbound B2B Sales Representatives. This is an exciting and rewarding opportunity to help our Fortune 500 clients build their business. You will be supporting clients for our partners in many industries, such as telecommunications, media, retail, credit and financial services, technology, automotive, and shipping. Positions are available immediately. Walk-ins are welcome Monday to Friday, 9am-3pm and members of our Revana team will be available to administer candidate assessments and onsite interviews. We offer the following to successful candidates: • Competitive salary + lucrative commission structure • Advancement and Career Opportunities • Award-winning Recognition and Incentive Program • Medical and Dental Insurance Programs • Tuition Reimbursement & Retirement Planning • Paid Time Off • Ongoing Training and Development • Discounts at many major retailers & restaurants • Casual dress code We are a company filled with high energy people with a willingness to put the client’s needs first. Our ideal candidate loves sales and marketing and is ready for the exciting, fast-paced career where you can go as far as your ambitions will take you. This is your opportunity to be rewarded for your motivation, passion, integrity and results. Job Responsibilities The B2B Sales Representative will be engaging in outbound sales, business development and marketing as you succeed in prospecting and developing accounts. Additional responsibilities include: • Contacting new leads and nurturing existing customers • Introducing clients to the best technology products and services provided by industry leaders • Building long-term customer relationships

item.title: Marketing Representative Part-Time
item.description: Details: Tower Fasteners founded in 1967 and headquartered in Holtsville, NY, has become a leader in the field of fastener distribution and inventory management systems. Tower is committed to supplying products from only the highest quality fastener manufacturers in the world. Each of our five stocking distribution centers is equipped with state of the art quality control equipment to ensure that our customers receive products that exceed their expectations for quality. We are currently seeking a Part-Time Marketing Representative to join our Tower Team. Office hours: This position is Part-Time and hours are flexible, approximately 16-20 hours / week. Duties Include but are not limited to: Website management including company press releases, building new product / industry pages, updating Social Media pages. Design Company presentations for sales presentations and meetings. Update and stock media kits and promotional items
