item.title: Warehouse Associate - Immediate Openings
item.description: Details: Warehouse Associate - Immediate Openings Staffmark currently has immediate openings for talented individuals to fill the role of Warehouse Associate in the Gwinnett County Area - Norcross and Suwanee. As a Warehouse Associate, you will be responsible for supporting operations through receiving of products, inventory, scanning, staging products, order pulling and preparing orders, packing, shipping, etc. Warehouse Associates are also responsible for maintaining a safe and clean work environment. 1st, 2nd and 3rd shifts available - Pay $9.00 - $10.00 per hour. Positions starting ASAP! Please fill out an application on-line at https://www.mystaffmark.com/ and call 770-963-8032 to schedule an in person interview.

item.title: Executive Assistant ll
item.description: Details: Our unique culture of independence gives Raymond James financial advisors the freedom to meticulously tailor a long-term plan based solely on the financial well-being of each client and their specific goals. Job Summary: Under limited supervision, uses specialized knowledge and skills obtained through experience and/or specialized training to provide advanced, diversified and confidential secretarial and administrative support to an assigned executive at the vice president or equivalent level with responsibility for a major organizational function. Guidance is provided to perform varied work that is somewhat difficult in character requiring evaluation, originality and ingenuity to make moderately complex decisions. Resolves or recommends solutions to complex problems. Extensive contact with internal and external customers is required to identify, research, and resolve problems. May communicate information to internal or external customers to sell or service products. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Maintains confidentiality. Serves as a liaison with other functional areas and external customers in the resolution of routine administrative and operational issues. Provides executive support including answering telephones; assisting visitors; and resolving and/or referring a range of administrative problems and inquiries. Composes and edits correspondence and/or memoranda from dictation, verbal direction or from knowledge of established policies. May prepare, transcribe, compose, type, edit and distribute agendas and minutes of meetings. Schedules and coordinates meetings, events, interviews, appointments and/or other similar activities, which may include coordinating travel and lodging arrangements. Prepares or assists in preparing statistical and narrative reports by performing information gathering and analysis, as specifically directed. Establishes, maintains and updates files, databases, records and other documents. Develops and maintains data and performs routine analyses and calculations involved in preparing recurring internal reports. Sorts, screens, reviews and distributes incoming and outgoing mail. Composes and prepares timely responses to a variety of routine written inquiries. Maintains currency in modern office management methods and techniques. Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

item.title: Regional Process Safety and Training Manager
item.description: Details: Join Linde, the world’s leading global gases and engineering organization. Linde manufactures, supplies, and distributes industrial, medical, and specialty gases. We are recognized as a leader in the development of new gas–related technologies and applications for the electronics alternative fuels and energy, glass, food, metals, and chemical industries. Linde North America is a member of The Linde Group. In the 2013 financial year, The Linde Group generated revenue of EUR 16.655 bn (USD 23.1 bn), making it the largest gases and engineering company in the world with approximately 63,500 employees working in more than 100 countries worldwide. The strategy of The Linde Group is geared towards long-term profitable growth and focuses on the expansion of its international business with forward-looking products and services. Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment – in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development. At Linde we believe that people create our success. Our primary goal is to hire and retain the best, most talented employees who are leaders in their own right, and provide them with a growth environment that is focused on adding value for the customer. We strongly believe that the diversity of our employees and their ongoing growth and development, combined with our global footprint and broad range of business activities, provide us with the ingredients required to maintain and grow our leading market positions around the world. Linde is currently seeking a Regional Process Safety and Training Manager to join the team in the Midwest area. Job Responsibilities: ▪ Supports the Head of Supply and Head of HyCO SMR operations in achieving key outcomes in safety, process safety, reliability, efficiency, cost and customer service ▪ Supports the Regional Supply and HyCO teams within the region by championing a culture of process safety in working and in the execution of all aspects of the role requirements ▪ Ensures compliance with all safety, health, environmental and quality standards within the region ▪ Identifies and progresses the technical development and training needs for the Regional Supply and HyCO teams within the region •Working with the Regional Head of Supply and Regional Support Manager to maintain a robust OCTM (Organization Capability and Talent Management) process for the Regional Supply Team •Develops and leads technical and compliance cross training (flexible and trained workforce) to optimize the use of all Linde area resources ▪ Plans and leads or participates in regional Process Safety, O&E, IMSS audits ▪ Provides auditing expertise to support collaborative auditing with SHEQ resources as needed to meet audit plans ▪ Supports the safe operation of all plants within the region by: •Promoting awareness of updates to LiMSS throughout the region for critical safety standards •Coordinating regional Corrective Action Request (CAR) management for tracking and completion and for identify systemic CAR issues •Coordinating regional compliance with alerts and directives •Identifying, leading or facilitating structured risk assessments, including but not limited to, Hydrocarbon Risk and Remote Operations Risk assessments •Supporting plant projects and regional Engineering Management of Change process to ensure site compliance •Assisting with key customer or regulatory audit preparation, risk assessment, actions, and follow up •Leading and monitoring regional training and practical testing as a resource and coordinator. Serves as a trainer for behavioural and process safety, IMSS library, Traccess and Audit Manager. •Providing direct support to Supply areas in the development of work instructions and procedures necessary to comply with the LIMSS quality system •Serving as the regional Supply subject matter expert (SME) for local and global LIMSS library standards content; responsible for ensuring that library updates meet quality model standards and for proposing improvements to relevant standards to enhance global best operating practice •Serving as the regional SME for Management Review. Responsible for identifying relevant and systemic issues affecting the management system for feedback into Platform and Leadership Management Review. ▪ Serves as the regional lead responsible for ensuring location compliance with accident / incident / near miss / mock recall processes, including investigation, training and facilitation in the use of causal tree analysis. Ensures that the root cause is determined, action items are completed and that best practice is implemented to mitigate the risks to the business. Coordinates with regional and/or global SHEQ as required. ▪ Serve as the HAZOP authority within the region for all assigned HAZOP activities, supporting the Regional Support Manager to ensure timely close out of all identified actions. ▪ Provides PSM support throughout all stages of a projects life cycle and supports Pre-Startup Safety Reviews ▪ Demonstrates HPO continuous improvement by sharing best practices employed or developed in RBU NA and adopt best practices identified by global peers ▪ Supports monthly data and reporting to People Capability on regional Process Safety and Training KPI's ▪ Supports the Responsible Care Program within the Supply Organization Minimum Qualifications: ▪ Demonstrated exceptional operational safety leadership with sustainable results ▪ Must possess a thorough understanding of air separation process operations (or similar) and related equipment and technology ▪ Minimum 10 years experience in an operational and process engineering environment ▪ Strong understanding of cause and effect relationships in both proactive engineering safeguarding as well as incident root cause analysis ▪ Demonstrated ability to develop, lead and deliver technical training courses for a broad spectrum of employees, ranging from junior to senior operations and engineering staff ▪ Demonstrated ability to mentor and impart knowledge to less experienced staff or those with different areas of expertise ▪ Thorough understanding of best operating practices and technical standards for Linde and OSHA ▪ Must have the depth of experience and impact/influence to effectively represent Supply Chain to outside agencies, industry bodies, and regulators ▪ Engineering degree required, Chemical preferred ▪ Air Separation experience and knowledge preferred ▪ Certified HAZOP leader, with experience leading and completing ▪ LOPA, SIS and PHA experience ▪ Operations and Engineering audit experience ▪ Six Sigma qualification a plus ▪ Interpersonal skills: •Excellent leadership skills •Possesses strong communications skills at all levels •Demonstrated ability to work cohesively in a team environment •Demonstrated ability to challenge the status quo and improve existing processes/programs ▪ Managerial skills: •People training and development - experience and demonstrated effectiveness in training and developing personnel in technical topics •Project management - experience handling multiple projects simultaneously •Continuous improvement drive and ability to implement change in a geographically diverse organization. Relentless drive to challenge the status quo. •Management by influence - experience delivering results in a highly matrixed organization and the ability to influence others to deliver results. ▪ Excellent oral and written communication skills Linde offers excellent salaries, world-class benefits, and unparalleled opportunities for development - all to create an invigorating and satisfying environment. Join a World Leading Team Today! For IMMEDIATE consideration, APPLY NOW!

item.title: Community Support Specialist
item.description: Details: Community Support Specialist Crider Health Center has an opportunity available for a Community Support Specialist in Wentzville, MO Job Summary: QMHP Adult Community Support Specialists provide the following community support services to adults and child/family. A few specific job responsibilities for the Community Support Specialist include: Assessment and monitoring of a person’s adjustment to community living and providing guidance and support in the development of adaptive community living skills. Ongoing assessment of a person’s status, including personal strengths, progress, problems, and needs. 40% Monitoring persons served participation and progress in organized treatment programs to assure the planned provision of service according to a person’s individual treatment plan. Providing individual assistance to people in gaining access to needed services. Maintaining contact with persons who are hospitalized; and participating with discharge planning and arranging collateral contacts. Provide training to people, according to their individual need, in daily living skills such as housekeeping, cooking, personal grooming, etc. Provide crisis intervention services, when indicated, during and after “normal" working hours. Providing individualized assistance in creating personal support systems that include work with family members, legal guardians, or other community members. 10% Participating as a member of a multi-disciplinary team in all treatment plan reviews of clients. 10% - Treatment plan reviews of clients. - Team meetings. - Physician staffing. - PSR staffing. - Other training. - Attend all supervisory sessions of staff meetings as scheduled by supervisor or program director, including daily team meetings. Maintain agreed upon level of productivity. 30% Complete all mandatory documentation to monitor persons served progress towards achievement of individual treatment plan goals. 10% - Efficient and effective record management. - Preparation and/or revision of a specific individualized treatment plan for each individual. Perform clinical interviews and evaluations for initial and annual psychosocial assessments. Will seek culturally competent services and service providers to meet the unique cultural needs of each agency consumer and family member. Transportation of clients as needed. Compensation & Benefits for the Community Support Specialist include: Benefits Package About Us: Crider Health Center is a Community Health Center serving the mental, physical, and dental health needs of citizens of Franklin, Lincoln, St. Charles, and Warren Counties. Join Our Team We welcome inquiries from qualified individuals who want to be part of a team of hardworking, dedicated and compassionate employees whose work helps us aspire to our vision of full, healthy, productive lives for everyone. Crider Health Center welcomes all people regardless of race, age, gender, religion, education, nationality, ethnicity, family circumstance, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, and physical or mental ability. Crider Health Center is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and an E-Verify participant..

item.title: District Sales Manager
item.description: Details: The career growth and job satisfaction that comes from high quality products and a top ranked company are just a couple of the many great perks you will get as a District Sales Manager with our client. This is an exciting career where you will represent products that are so good they are called the ‘BMW" of their industry and are so high in demand that the company has experienced record sales year after year. The person fortunate to land this opportunity will be selling road construction equipment product lines that dealers throughout the state of New York see as extremely valuable which will lead to great financial reward. Imagine the pride you will take in a career with one of the best companies to work for in Tennessee according to employee job surveys. This is a family run business that has very little turnover which means that you will have the potential to build a long, stable career with a company that cares about your future. You will be provided a very competitive compensation package that includes medical plan options where our client covers most of the cost and a 401(k) with very generous matching. Not only will you be saving money on the cost of your health plans now but you will be building financial security for yourself and your family with a top retirement plan. Our client will provide you with top notch training to ensure that you are seen as the expert in the road construction equipment field and a valuable asset to all of your clients. Don’t let this opportunity pass you by. This is a great opportunity to use your equipment knowledge in an environment that recognizes and rewards top performers. About our client: They are the U.S. affiliate for a world-wide leader in road construction equipment. Their complete portfolio includes milling machines, compaction equipment, mining equipment, asphalt and concrete pavers, plus crushing and screening equipment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to the individual's race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, disability, genetic information, status as a military veteran or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

item.title: Consumer Marketing and Sales Specialist
item.description: Details: CONSUMER MARKETING & SALES SPECIALIST Times Media is seeking an experienced Consumer Marketing & Sales Specialist to join our team. Working with the Local Sales Manager and senior management, this position is responsible for coordinating the consumer marketing messaging and assisting with the development of acquisition and retention campaigns. The best candidate will be a dynamic, creative thinker with a background in developing and implementing strategic sales initiatives across numerous sales channels. The candidate should have demonstrated experience in the areas of idea generation, creative collaboration, and execution of a marketing and sales plan. Responsibilities: Assist in the development of standard and non-traditional consumer marketing and sales programs. Effectively execute sales initiatives as directed by the Local Sales Manager. Work closely with Market Development to utilize consumer profiles and readership data to increase subscriptions. Develop create and execute consumer sales promotions with a special emphasis on digital channels: SEM, Facebook, Twitter, others. Build relationships with top store locations to allow for kiosk sales. Coordinate and support marketing and sales events; work closely with Newsroom to enhance our consumer engagement at events. Manage scheduling of all marketing campaigns via various platforms: print, TMC, web, mobile. Work closely with news and marketing to ensure promotional presence via social media. Manage and administer creative for external media. Communicate programs, results and accomplishments to Local Consumer Marketing and Sales Manager. Job Requirements Bachelor's degree preferred. Two years College required. Business, sales or marketing background desirable. Two years sales and/or experience required. Prior experience coordinating and implementing sales programs preferred. An understanding of developing sales relationships, and project coordination, required. Local market knowledge is a must. Must be able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment. Good with detail, and proven ability to follow-through on deadline. Strong interpersonal and customer service skills required. Individual must be highly proactive, able to lead projects, bringing them to successful implementation and completion. Excellent written communication and grammar skills. Must have a valid driver’s license, acceptable driving record and appropriate insurance. Must meet the company driving policy requirements This position offers aggressive pay plus bonus and a competitive benefits package, including 401(k). Times Media offers advancement opportunities at the newspaper as well as with Gannett Co., Inc. Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Warehouser - Cedar Park, TX
item.description: Details: Receive, identify, store, distribute, inventory, pick, pack, and ship materials, supplies, components and equipment in the most efficient manner. Responsibilities: Duties require the use of forklifts, hand trucks, cranes, hoists, floor dollies, various packaging devices, scales, and various other power and hand tools related to the warehouse operations. Package finished product for shipping (shrink wrapping, boxing, labeling). Stage finished product for loading. Load/Unload finished product onto truck or other carrier vehicle Move materials to warehouse storage. Check parts for identification numbers Assist in conducting physical inventories and cycle counts Assist with maintaining inventory records by posting materials received and disbursed, writing shortage lists and distributing them as required Select parts as directed from bins and shelves and accurately record these activities on proper picking lists, which includes distributing original and copies of picking lists along with material to the appropriate department's staging area Verify, identify and store in their assigned locations any and all materials received from Manufacturing and Receiving inspection as directed Maintain the warehouse in a clean, orderly and safe manner Responsible for operating the warehouse machinery in a safe manner and reporting any equipment maintenance or problems to your immediate supervisor Other duties as assigned.

item.title: Entry Manufacturing Engineer
item.description: Details: Aerotek is hiring an entry level Manufacturing Engineer for a large manufacturing facility in Chattanooga. This engineer will be responsible for working on the floor troubleshooting process/manufacturing issues. They will identify areas of process improvement and design solutions to make improvements. Prefer 1 year of experience and must be proficient with Solidworks. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Sales Outside B2B - State of Virginia
item.description: Details: OUTSIDE B2B SALES Protected and Personal Territory of the State of Virginia Our Company: We successfully market a unique and dignified PR service and believe in our product. We are 75+ years strong! Travel to small to medium towns 3 to 4 days per week. Our business clientele are professionals in banking, finance, funeral homes, estate planners, insurance agencies, real estate, hospitals, doctors, etc. We enhance images in communities—and change the future! A little more about us The Culture and Program We value the individual and support the employee and family. High ethical standards drive our systems and decisions. Our professionals enjoy their freedom and are competitive by nature. High moral overtone program We do not sacrifice our values for personal gain. Opportunity and Benefits $55,000+ Management opportunities with higher income potential available to those with demonstrated leadership qualities Expense allowance Employee benefit package, including insurance & 401K On-the-job training Telephone sales support provided Protected territory with existing business and growth potential Contests, sales conventions, trips and award programs NO Weekend Travel! Do you possess . . . A high moral character and ethical conduct? A history of success in outside B2B sales? Experience working small to medium size towns? The ability and means to travel an average of 3 nights most weeks? A VALID driver’s license, insured vehicle Criminal background check required. If you are professional in appearance and not willing to sacrifice your values for personal gain, send your resume today. Do you meet the above qualifications? If so, we would like to hear from you today ! WE INTERVIEW & HIRE FAST = IMMEDIATE INCOME FOR YOU! Submit your resume for job consideration to: Mr. Lee DuBois Via fax (704-868-7148) or email to: We are An Equal Opportunity Employer AD experience (newspaper, Val-Pak, Yellow Pages, directory, radio) is a PLUS!

item.title: CNC Machinist
item.description: Details: Aerotek is proactively seeking CNC Mills and CNC Lathe Machinists around the San Diego area. Qualified candidates will possess the following qualifications: CNC Mill/Lathe Machinist: - Setting up, operating, and doing adjustments on 4 and 5 axis Mill and Lathe machines - Experience with Fadal and Mazak; both vertical and horizontal - Entering instructions, including zero and reference points, setting tool registers, and offsets - Preferred experience with CAD/CAM software and "G" codes - Interpreting geometric dimensions and tolerances - Knowledge of reading blue prints - Minimum of 5 years experience Qualified candidates should contact Ryan Fehr at (619) 278-3007 for further information. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: REO Title Closer
item.description: Details: SetPoint Consultants is a national recruitment firm specializing in the Title, Mortgage, Legal, Banking, Information Technology and Customer Service industry. We are currently looking for an experienced REO Title Closer/Processor for a growing Tampa, FL title company. Candidate must have 3 plus years of current title closing experience and some experience with REO. This is a permanent position upon hire and is available immediately. Our client is very open to salary so now is the time for you to get top dollar for your experience!! We are searching for an energetic, customer service driven title professional that will help the office focus on delivering top notch service to their clients. Candidates must thrive working in a fast paced, deadline driven environment. Our client is currently interviewing so please submit your resume today for immediate consideration. All qualified candidates will be contacted. If this position does not interest you, we have several other full time opportunities available: Title Examiner, Foreclosure Paralegal, Foreclosure Clerks, Legal Assistants, REO/Title Processor and much more. Submit your resume today for review. We look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: Marketing Communications Specialist
item.description: Details: We have an immediate opening for a Marketing Communications Specialist to join our elite consulting firm. CPSG Partners Awarded #1 in IT Services in Inc. Magazine’s List of Fastest-Growing Private Companies for 2014, #24 overall out of the top 5000. We have created a truly special place by recruiting the top talent around. F ast paced and fun work environment with a great story to tell. In this role you will manage the Print, Social Media, and Blogs. Contact media outlets such as newspapers and magazines. Write press releases. Work with internal team and clients on writing white papers and doing case studies. Work with production companies to produce testimonial videos. Coordinate webinars, trade shows/conference and events. Create PowerPoint presentations, email marketing and other marketing activities as needed.

item.title: District Manager
item.description: Details: TMX Finance LLC and Affiliates District Manager State of Missouri The TMX Finance family of companies ('TMX Finance') is one of the largest and fastest growing consumer specialty finance organizations in the United States. With brands that include TitleMax, TitleBucks, InstaLoan, EquityAuto Loan, TMX Credit, and AutoCash, TMX Finance provides a diversified product offering. These brands are represented nationwide and TMX Finance has aggressive plans to double in size over the next three years. The rapid growth of TMX Finance has created a wealth of career opportunities in both our stores and at our corporate offices. If you are looking for a dynamic career with significant earning potential and tremendous advancement opportunities, you've come to the right place. TMX Finance is currently seeking a highly competitive and results driven District Manager to oversee a market within the state of Missouri, one of the newest hubs in our growing national footprint. TMX District Managers are vital members of our innovative executive team and are instrumental in driving the company's key performance indicators. This role requires individuals that demonstrate exceptional leadership in their ability to coach, develop, and motivate their teams to unparalleled financial success. Our District Managers have the opportunity to interact at every level of business in an engaging work environment by taking a hands-on approach to customer service and employee training. This role serves to lead by example, advocating proper operational execution to drive results. Additionally, this position works to collaborate with Regional and Divisional Managers and is critical in setting new precedents for determining the direction of our rapidly expanding organization. Each District Manager at TMX Finance is prepared for individual success with our field training program, incorporating firsthand management experience for six months in an existing market. Essential Functions of District Managers: Work strategically with executive management to drive revenue of assigned market Strategize and collaborate with department heads to develop and maintain annual budgets Analyze audit findings and provide training opportunities for field employees Establish and execute strategies for driving Key Performance Indicator (KPI) results Maximize team performance to achieve sales plans and goals Perform on-site visits of all stores in district to provide ongoing coaching and development Maximize the potential of each store by providing support in areas for improvement Collaborate on recruitment efforts to build a qualified team and maintain a succession plan Participate in a six month training opportunity in an established market Qualifications: Minimum of three years experience at a District Manager level or above Management of at least 8 locations with at least 10 direct reports Employee coaching and development experience required Successful financial management experience including full P & L and budgets required Proven track record of successfully growing new and existing store locations Innovative and strategic approach to increased brand awareness Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus but not required All TMX Finance entities are Equal Opportunity Employers. PI87437497

item.description: Details: Hospital Administrator Shriners Hospitals For Children Philadelphia, PA 10/26/2014 Job Description We have a great opportunity for a Hospital Administrator at Shriners Hospitals for Children® Los Angeles, CA, a 39 licensed bed pediatric specialty hospital dedicated to delivering the highest quality of care to children with a host of orthopaedic and neuro-musculo-skeletal disorders and diseases. item.title: CNC Programmer / Commissioning Tech
item.description: Details: Direct Hire opportunity with growing east-side firm. Commissioning Technician tests,troubleshoots, repairs and/or modifies developmental and productionelectronic components, equipment and systems by performing the followingduties: Adjusts switches, pressures, flows, parameters, machine positions, etc. as needed for controls debug. Conducts software system tests for functionality, diagnostics and machine recovery procedures. Documents conditions under which tests are conducted, sequences and phases of test operations in simulation programs and/or at actual machine. Directs and exercises control over operational, functional, and performance phases of tests. Analyzes and interprets test data and prepares technical reports for use by engineering and management personnel. Develops an evaluation of system performance under actual operating conditions. Writes technical reports and develops charts, graphs, and schematics to describe and illustrate system's operating characteristics, malfunctions, deviations from design specifications, and functional limitations. Can be required to assist in the engineering phase of the project including evaluating the interface between hardware and software, and the operational and performance requirements of the overall system; developing simulation programs to pretest software functionality; resolving testing such as product or system malfunctions and data interpretation; supporting engineering in design and verification of all software aspects including Ladder Logic, CNC programming, high level programming and data administration. Can be required to assist in the service phase of the project including supporting the tryout and runoff of the project in the field and/or following the project into the field for final debug and runoff with automation, ancillary equipment, etc. May be required to work split or alternate shifts. Must be able to travel for extended periods as required for customer installations.

item.title: Operations Manager - Modernization
item.description: Details: ThyssenKrupp AG (TK) is a leading global diversified technology and materials group based in Essen, Germany. It has 150,000 employees in over 80 countries developing ideas and innovations into solutions for sustainable progress. In fiscal year 2012/2013, the Group generated sales of over $50 billion. The company comprises five business areas (BA): Steel Europe, Materials Services, Elevator Technologies, Components Technologies, and Industrial Solutions, which serve clients across the automotive, aerospace, industrial and chemical sectors. In North America, ThyssenKrupp Group companies offer a range of products and services, including premium carbon steel; high-performance alloys; automotive components and systems; elevators, escalators, moving walks and passenger boarding bridges; and material trading, logistical and industrial services. In fiscal year 2012/2013, ThyssenKrupp companies in Canada, the United States and Mexico employed approximately 20,000 employees and recorded sales of over $10 billion. ThyssenKrupp has 150,000 employees in over 80 countries working with passion and expertise to develop solutions for sustainable progress. Their skills and commitment are the basis of our success. In fiscal year 2011/2012 ThyssenKrupp generated sales of €40 billion. ThyssenKrupp Elevator Americas is the largest producer of elevators in the Americas, with more than 15,500 employees and more than 230 branch and service locations. ThyssenKrupp Elevator Americas oversees all business for the operations in the United States, Canada, Central and South America. Innovations and technical progress are key factors in managing global growth and using finite resources in a sustainable way. With our engineering expertise in the areas of “Material”, “Mechanical” and “Plant”, we enable our customers to gain an edge in the global market and manufacture innovative products in a cost and resource efficient way. ThyssenKrupp companies in North America offer a range of products and services, including premium carbon steel; high-performance alloys; automotive components and systems; elevators, escalators, moving walkways and passenger boarding bridges; and plant construction material trading, logistical and industrial services. In fiscal year 2010/2011, ThyssenKrupp companies in Canada, the United States and Mexico employed more than 24,000 and recorded sales of over $10 billion. The Elevator Technology business area brings together the ThyssenKrupp Group's global activities in passenger transportation systems. With sales of 5.7 billion euros in fiscal 2011/2012 and customers in 150 countries, ThyssenKrupp Elevator is one of the world's leading elevator companies. With more than 47,000 skilled employees, the company offers innovative and energy-efficient products designed to meet customers’ individual requirements. The portfolio includes passenger and freight elevators, escalators and moving walks, passenger boarding bridges, stair and platform lifts as well as tailored service solutions for all products. 900 locations around the world provide an extensive sales and service network to guarantee closeness to customers. Operations Manager - Modernization Job Description The Kansas City, KC branch (located in Lenexa) is currently seeking an experienced, motivated, goal oriented Operations Manager to cover the Kanasa areas: including Kansas City, Witchita and Springfield. The Modernization Manager is responsible for surveying and preparing job sites, scheduling crews, oversight of work and schedules, employee supervision and ensuring that all assigned construction projects are completed on time. Duties include supervising mechanics, mechanic’s helpers, and other construction employees; coordinating turnover of jobs with the service department; assisting crews when necessary at the job sites, communicating with general contractors and monitoring supplies and equipment. Job Responsibilities: • Provides technical input to sales staff on the scope of the work and materials needed • Orders parts and materials for jobs. • Review contracts for terms and conditions • Receives, reviews, and signs off on booking packages for new jobs and completes additional job-related forms. • Enters information on new job costs into the database and completes financial information on uncompleted jobs. • Supervises the loading and unloading of equipment at job sites. • Monitors status of jobs and makes occasional visits to job sites to check on job progress, perform quality control, and answer customers’ questions. • Assists mechanics with jobs when necessary by providing on-the-job site instructions. • Closes out jobs, ensuring all costs have been applied to closed jobs. • Reviews new and existing jobs for profitability. • Investigates accidents and completes appropriate forms. • Assists with equipment inventory. • Completes weekly, monthly, and yearly reports. • Performs other duties as assigned. Supervisory Responsibilities • Recruits, hires, trains, evaluates, and disciplines mechanics, mechanics helpers, and other service staff Specific Job Duties • A Bachelor’s degree with 3 years of relevant work experience, OR an Associate’s degree with 5 years of relevant work experience OR 5+ years of elevator industry work experience. • Strong mechanical reasoning and comprehension skills. • This position requires the demonstration of excellent customer service, project management and conflict resolution skills • Ability to inspire trust & commitment from employees, peers & customers • Strong written & oral communication skills • Good computer skills including MS Office. Experience working with a large ERP system is preferred (Oracle, SAP, etc) ThyssenKrupp Elevator Corp. is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other protected characteristic required by applicable law. Applicants with disabilities who require reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process are encouraged to contact us directly.

item.title: Physician Practice Manager Clinic Administration
item.description: Details: Reporting to the Vice President of Ambulatory Care, the Physician Practice Manager will have responsibility for the overall operations, growth, development and success of designated Lucile Packard Children’s Hospital (LPCH) Physician Practice(s), including service experience, scheduling, operations, finance, billing, EMR(Electronic Medical Records), human resources, physician organization and communication, efficiency and profitability improvements, strategic planning, practice management, and development/marketing. The Practice Manager will work closely with physicians, VP of Ambulatory Care, COO for Packard Children’s Health Alliance (PCHA), Faculty Practice Organization (FPO), Stanford School of Medicine (SOM) Departments and divisions, Site Managers, and ancillary and administrative services at LPCH (where applicable), to implement all practice goals. This is a high visibility position, with frequent interactions with the general public, patients and their families, physicians, and staff, and as such, serves as a general information resource and ambassador to all. Essential Functions: The essential functions listed are typical examples of work performed by positions in this job classification. They are not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, tasks, and responsibilities. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned.Must perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with the Service Standards of the Hospital(s). Working with LPCH and PCHA staff, provides operational oversight for all assigned physician practices at all designated clinical locations. Partners with LPCH Administration to develop strategic, financial and tactical plans and objectives for the practices; meets agreed upon results, and retains the organizations required to meet outlined objectives and provides regular and ad hoc reporting related to clinical locations’ performance. Ensures that all LPCH, PCHA, regulatory agency, quality policies and requirements are met. Plans and integrates clinical locations in support of Packard goals and provides effective, thoughtful leadership in the successful growth of the practice and network. Spearhead onboarding of new physicians and allied health professionals into the practice. Collaborates with Site Manager(s) to ensure the effective recruitment, hiring and management of staff for all Practice locations; monitors annual workforce staffing plans, delegates and coordinates tasks in order to maintain a system which assures effective, quality patient service, including coverage in service gaps. Actively and constructively participates in Physician Network and FPO Leadership Teams and other intra- and interdepartmental meetings to assure smooth workflow across departments. Develops and monitors budget for controlling operational and capital expenses. Assesses access for patient flow and analyzes needs for the practice to assure quality patient care. Works with Physician Practice leadership, the FPO and Marketing team on business development for Physician Practices(s), including but not limited to outreach efforts/networking with community providers, public relations, marketing strategy development, website enhancements and advertising. Partners with the physicians and allied health professionals to deliver on Practice goals, including efficient communication to develop protocol and assure practice needs are being met. Responds and analyzes patient complaints, identify trends, and spearhead resolutions across LPCH or PCHA locations. Coordinates and implements space planning and construction or other large scale special projects. In coordination with Site Manager and SOM departments, orders clinical, office and stationary supplies, arranges for maintenance, repair, smooth functioning, purchase of new equipment for physicians and staff, including workstations, business and medical equipment at the office, including, copiers, fax, phones, ultrasound, EKG machines, etc. Implements and adheres fully to LPCH or PCHA policies governing voicemail, HIPAA and network access as well as those protecting the privacy of patients. Employees may also perform other duties as assigned and/or operationally may be required to cover other sites as requested by the VP of Ambulatory Care and other Practice or Site Managers.

item.title: Mass Production Quality Engineer
item.description: Details: Responsibilities: Analyzes parts to the drawing and specifications to assure conformance. Approves suppliers’ countermeasures for problems found by Honda or the supplier. Authorizes approval for part or process change prior to installation on saleable product. Reviews suppliers’ process to assure conformity to specification (reviews PQCT, FMEA, operations standards, and process control sheets). Negotiates quality activity with Supplier Quality Control, Purchasing and plant management. Daily Tasks: Investigates suspect part issues. Dispositions nonconforming parts. Approves part or process changes. Approves and verifies supplier countermeasures. Issues trouble reports. Experience: Zero to six months co-op/internship experience related to quality engineering. Knowledge: Strong understanding of manufacturing processes (injection molding, extrusions, stamping, roll forming, color expertise, etc.). General understanding of process quality assurance, control charts, audits, Cp, etc. Knowledge of vehicle systems (interior/exterior trim parts) preferred. Required Skills: Ability to lead meetings and/or present technical reports. Ability to work in teams and achieve a common goal. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks. Ability to read drawings (blueprint reading). Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Desired Skills: Internal auditor experience. Strong leadership skills. CATIA/Enovia experience. Ability to conduct complex problem solving. Ability to use QC tools (SPC, Pareto, X-R charts, etc.). item.title: MACY'S IS HIRING: Seasonal Retail Selling Floor Recovery, As Early As 11AM - Newport Beach, CA - Fashion Island
item.description: Details: Job Overview: As a Seasonal Floor Recovery Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. You will be required to move between selling areas as directed to maintain high customer readiness standards. You will deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment, while building quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and other operational tasks as assigned. This position is only in our Extreme Hard Shop Locations. Performs other duties as assigned. In order to present our customers with the best holiday shopping experience, many of our Holiday Selling Floor Recovery Associates arrive prior to store opening and remain after closing to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Holiday associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule on a temporary basis, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas. And don't forget - just in time for holiday shopping, you will receive an employee discount of up to 20% starting your first day! Any schedule hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All holiday associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends, or on key holiday events such as the Friday after Thanksgiving. Essential Functions:- Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration - Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills - Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority - Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice - Adhere to all safety and security policies and procedures - Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality Qualifications: Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management. Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Other skills: Ability to work as part of a team, or independently with minimal direct supervision. Strong customer selling orientation. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and open to learning new procedures. Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including evenings and weekends. Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

You will control access and egress, monitor CCTV and alarm systems, compose reports, deter criminal activity and misconduct, and perform other duties as specified in post orders. G4S is a security provider for the United States government, fortune 500 companies, nuclear power plants, oil and gas companies, airport, ports, banks, hospitals, factories, warehouses, commercial facilities, residential communities and much more. G4S offers job security, excellent pay and benefits, and career opportunities. We offer entry level careers, management careers, sales careers and executive careers across the United States and internationally. Main responsibilities Perform security patrols of designated areas on foot or in vehicle Watch for irregular or unusual conditions that may create security concerns or safety hazards Sound alarms or call police or fire department in case of fire or presence of unauthorized persons Warn violators of rule infractions, such as loitering, smoking or carrying forbidden articles Permit authorized persons to enter property and monitors entrances and exits Observe departing personnel to protect against theft of company property and ensure that authorized removal of property is conducted within appropriate client requirements Investigate and prepare reports on accidents, incidents, and suspicious activities Provide assistance to customers, employees and visitors in a courteous and professional manner Ideal candidate Education, Licenses and Certifications Required Pass a State licensing test if driving a company-owned or client-provided vehicle Must possess a current and valid Bureau of Security and Investigative Services (BSIS) Security Officer License issued by the State of California Must possess one of the following: Current and valid Bureau of Security and (BSIS) .9mm Firearms Permit issued by the State of California Current and valid Bureau of Security and Investigative Services (BSIS) .45 Firearms Permit issued by the State of California Type and item.title: Quality Professionals & Engineers - Medical Device
item.description: Details: Quality Professionals & Engineers – Medical Device Kelly Services constantly connects professionals with opportunities to advance their careers. We currently have an exciting Temporary opportunity with long term possibilities for a global leader within the Medical Device arena. The position is based in Menlo Park, CA. Quality Professionals & Engineers We are seeking Quality Professionals and Engineers with a background in medical device for a long-term project with possibility for more. Those interested should have expertise and experience in one or more of the following areas. Corrections/Removals • Experience with 21 CFR 806.20 to update the design of our Corrections/Removals process and procedures. • They will be documenting this work in the CAPA process. Change Controls • Experience with change controls in an FDA regulated industry. • Post commercialization Design and Process Changes. • They will be helping to update the design of our Change Controls process and procedures and remediation required based on the new systems. Supplier Quality • Extensive experience with Supplier Quality including Purchasing Controls, Supplier Lifecycle Management, Component Qualification, Supplier Change Management. • Updating of our Supplier Quality processes and procedures and remediation of documents as required. • This work will be managed through the CAPA process. Stop Ship/Product Hold • Extensive experience with Quality Operations experience to update the design of our Stop Ship / Product Hold processes and procedures. Complaints • Experience managing complaints in the medical device industry. • They will be updating the design of our Complaints process and procedures and remediating complaints based on the new systems. NCR Process Design and Implementation • Extensive experience with Nonconformance Process to update the design of our Nonconformance processes and Procedures Escalations • Experience in Quality systems and CAPA. • They will be helping to update the design of our Escalation processes and procedures. Policies/Procedures • Make assessments of our compliance against corporate standards. • Update our procedures to ensure alignment to the standards. Product Development Quality Engineer • Professional experience in a medical device manufacturing and product development environment is required. • Working knowledge of the FDA Quality System Regulation, ISO 13485, ISO 14971 and the EU Medical Device Directive is required. • Create protocols and reports, test vendor qualification, and testing management. • Skilled in the application of statistical methods, including ANOVA, statistical process control, sampling plans, and design of experiments. Education / Experience Requirements • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field, Engineering preferred. • 5+ years’ experience within the Medical Device industry and Quality Systems. • 10 years’ experience preferred. • Strong written and verbal communication. item.title: Production Manager
item.description: Details: Client is a co-packer for companies like Kroge and Wal-Mart that provide the labeling for the products that are made and packaged at the facility in Saline, MI. They produce over 200 different products. The candidate will be supervising the processing line staff and procedures to ensure product safety, quality, productivity, and achieving daily production goals. This person willl be responsible for developing and implementing improvements for the systems, equipment, and procedures to provide quality and efficiency. This candidate will be involved in training new employees, hiring, firing, scheduling, assigning tasks, time-card approval, maintain SOP's, accident investigations, maintaining compliance (GMP, HACCP, FDA, MDA, USDA, and SQF) and daily coaching. 90% of the position is going to be managing in the above description 10% may be on the line doing hands-on work to fix problems in the process 1st Shift - Flexible schedule from 5:00am to 6:00pm where they can get their 8 hours in throughout. The candidate will be responsible for overseeing employees on all three shifts, therefore the flexible schedule. Saturdays are typically optional for managers, but they must have thier department staffed. They will NOT work on Sundays. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. item.title: Administrative Therapy Assistant (Full-Time)
item.description: Details: GRACE MANAGEMENT SERVICES, INC. Administrative Therapy Assistant About Sprenger Health Care Systems Since 1959 Sprenger Health Care Systems continues to be family owned and operated. Sprenger offers the full continuum of aging services including: short term rehabilitation, skilled nursing, memory care, assisted living, independent living, hospice and home health. Our innovative care, excellent customer service, and compassionate dedicated employees have made Sprenger Health Care Systems a leader in providing exceptional health care. Sprenger communities have a history of excellent Resident and Family Satisfaction Surveys, 5 Star Ratings, Deficiency Free Surveys, and US News & World Report Rankings. Sprenger Health Care Systems is committed to maintaining a fair and unbiased work environment and we welcome all qualified candidates to apply to any of our 11 Communities throughout Ohio and Indiana. We understand that quality of care starts right here with our employees. For those team members who rise to the challenge and exceed the standard of care, the career possibilities can be endless. Join us today to experience the Sprenger difference! The Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate is ambitious, organized, and positive. Candidates must be able to easily learn new computer programs. Candidates must be dedicated to learning the details of the building, company functions and all policies and procedures. Administrative Therapy Assistants must be able to work with a variety of personalities and should feel comfortable talking to residents, family members and facility staff. Candidates should be able to make high volumes of calls as needed and must be able to adapt easily to change. Candidates must be able to answer emails, phones and inquiries in a timely manner. This position will report to the Director of Rehabilitation and by applying for the position you recognize that nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties or responsibilities to this job at any time. You may be asked to help in other areas of the building as needed for the optimal performance of your building/department and the well-being of our residents. Essential Job Functions As an Administrative Therapy Assistant in a Grace Management Services facility you must be able to perform the following essential functions as demonstrated by the ability to: Assist with organizing therapy services, programs and activities. Prepare resident for treatment by dress/position and administer physical therapy in accordance with established policies and procedures. Assist with supervision of resident during therapy treatment. Ensure a safe environment and utilizes tools and equipment in a safe manner complying with all infection control, universal precautions and OSHA standards for healthcare professionals. Maintain a current knowledge of the law and regulations regarding rehabilitative services and consults with supervisor to ensure that all employment actions are in compliance with applicable regulations. Create, maintain and assist in filling schedule as requested by the Director of Rehabilitation. Operate the therapy computerized business programs. Report all hazardous conditions including incidents, injuries and equipment to Supervisor/appropriate personnel immediately. Adhere to all policies of company, including job description, certification requirements, mission statement, HIPPA, confidentiality standards and resident's rights. Assist and completes patient scheduling for therapy services in coordination with nursing. Responsible for contacting PRN staff to get appropriate staff coverage based on DOR's direction. Pull all reports, including MD orders, delegated by DOR on a daily basis for morning meeting/DOR review. Clean off ROX "hotlist" areas delegated by DOR on a daily basis. Organize and tracks all anniversary dates/TB tests/therapy licenses and department compliance. Enter all appropriate UR data from prior day and gives to DOR prior to MDS meeting. Ensure that all correct/complete documents are in place at time of patient discharge and placed in medical chart per SRHC protocol. Complete technical portion of monthly therapy audit forms on timely basis for DOR review.

item.description: Details: Electronics Repair Technician 1 : Seattle , WA THALES We are an Irvine, California-based manufacturer of In-Flight Entertainment systems. The company has nearly 60 world airlines and as customers as well as Boeing and Airbus, the airframe manufacturers. Our products and service offerings is an end-to-end solution that supports our customers before, during and after each flight. For 2013, the future looks bright. “Make it Brilliant” is our mantra, which reflects our passion to be the BEST. We are a bunch of hardworking people that care about customer partnerships and continually introduce new innovation that inspires. We always push the envelope! Our parent company, Thales Group, is a global leader in aerospace. Our products and systems are everywhere on aircraft and in airports. Visit our website at http://www.thales-ifs.com and www.thalesgroup.com Duties and Responsibilities: Follow company processes and ensures that maintenance is properly documented in the company database (real time). • Maintain a quality standard of personal workmanship consistent with company objectives. • Utilize time efficiently to produce repair services in a time frame consistent with company objectives. Provide consistent updates to assigned workload status. • Assists in the repair of electronic equipment to component level in accordance with FAA regulations and company RSM (Repair Station Manual). • Assists in modifying equipment according to service bulletin and/or manufacturer documentation. • Maintains accurate and current maintenance documentation in accordance with current quality assurance requirements. • Communicates with Service Department Supervisor as required to support the repair process. • Participates in cross training programs and may be assigned to other teams for short or long term assignments. • Complete assigned tasks in accordance with company procedures and within company objectives. • Maintain a clean, organized work area. Actively participates in improving the processes of the Service Department and the repair station utilizing Lean and 6S principles. Thales Avionics Inc. – IFS offers an excellent benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, 401K, PTO, Basic Life and AD&D, Short and Long Term Disability, Business Travel Accident Insurance, International Medical Benefits, Flexible Spending Accounts and an Educational Assistance Program, just to name a few of the offerings. Thales Avionics is a diverse workplace and is an equal opportunity employer. We conduct pre-employment drug testing. No unsolicited or mailed in resumes will be accepted.

item.title: Leader, Shop Floor
item.description: Details: The Shop Floor Leader is accountable to help facilitate the successful management of the company shop. All actions will be in support of increasing line of business satisfaction, lowering the cost of repairs, and increasing equipment availability. This includes effectively working with the Shop Manager, managing the shop in his/her absence, and training to become a Shop Manager. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Reinforce and demonstrate Schneider’s core values and in so doing, support Schneider’s Union Free philosophy. This includes supporting and leading Schneider’s core value of safety first and always. Addressing any unsafe behaviors, auditing for safety compliance, and ensuring all visitors in the shop are safe. May include taking the lead on the safety team. 2. Accountable for equipment availability and repair decisions for fleet units. This includes communication with the Line of Business to understand the business needs in order to maximize the equipment availability and prioritize the work. 3. On the job (live) work order audits and performance audits of associates. This includes giving performance feedback during the audit on the floor, ensuring the associates are using the checklists, and reinforcing the Schneider established work processes. 4. Assign work to associates, matching the skill needed to complete the task to the associate who appropriately has that skill. 5. Develop associates’ skills. Ensure that everyone has completed their training on-time including vendor based training. 6. Audit the work of the shop champions. Ensure that they are being effective in their roles and leading those efforts in the shop. 7. Support the Shop Manager in enforcing parts processes. This includes inventory controls, meeting parts key factors, maintaining appropriate inventory, ensuring accuracy of cycle counts, and reinforcing the use of Schneider parts processes with associates. 8. Support the Shop Manager in controlling the level of tire spend in the shop. This includes ensuring that proper tire stances are being followed in the shop, supporting the tire champion, and reinforcing Schneider tire processes with associates. 9. Appropriately maintain vendor relationships. This includes managing what work gets vended, ensuring quality of the vended work, performing follow up when needed, and managing the costs associated with vended work. 10. Responsible for regular communication with associates to include sharing the team’s performance metrics, and corporate updates. 11. Help to set performance goals both for the shop as a whole and for individuals. Help create and execute action plans associated with those goals. 12. Complete performance assessments of associates that include Performance Assessments (PA), Business Partnerships (BP), and Individual Development Plans (IDP). 13. Responsible for quickly addressing performance related problems. This could include disciplinary action, administering Performance Improvement Plans (PIP), or termination. 14. Resolve associate issues appropriately and timely. 15. Responsible for the accuracy of payroll submissions. 16. Manage associate schedules (vacations, time off, hours) 17. Give goal –oriented recognition to the associates. 18. Ensure shop tooling is working and that associates have the tools they need to perform their job 19. Annually, assist Shop Manager with completing focal merit review for associates. 20. Support the shop staffing plan by working with recruiters, conducting interviews, coming to consensus, making offers, giving start dates, and on-boarding new associates. Attend college career fairs when appropriate. 21. When appropriate, prepare for and participate in Fair and Equitable boards. 22. Use Manager Self Service as a tool to make associate changes (pay, shift, hire, term) 23. Required to work a minimum of one weekend day (Sat or Sun) shift per month

item.title: RN Weekend Supervisor - Registered Nurse
item.description: Details: JOB TITLE: TREATMENT NURSE REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR OF NURSING RESPONSIBILITIES: To provide nursing care to residents as prescribed by the physician and in accordance with standards of nursing practices, regulations and directed by the Director of Nursing. To lead or direct licensed and non-professional staff in the delivery of direct Resident care and support functions. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 1. Must have working knowledge of the basic principles of infection control and wound care. 2. Must have demonstrated competence in providing wound care that is sterile and/or aseptic. 3. Must have knowledge and understanding of the special needs of the geriatric client and the geriatric client’s skin. 4. Must be free of any communicable disease and must maintain hands with clean, non-jagged nails which are of appropriate length to assure residents are cared for in a risk free manner. 5. Provides wound care (bandages, cleaning, applying medication) and assessing for appropriateness of bandage integrity during time between dressing changes. Assuring availability of treatment supplies and topical medications (as prescribed by the physician) and procuring supplies to assure adequate inventory or Treatment Cart is readily available at all times. 7. Providing gastrostomy tube feeding care, including needed bandage changes. 8. Providing colostomy and urostomy care and dressings as directed by the physician. 9. Provide weekly documentation. 10. Complies with facility guidelines for documentation and physician’s orders. 11. Relates well to patients, families and other team members. 12. Interacts well with therapists and implements individual programs as developed. 13. Maintains equipment and supplies for treatment. 14. Maintains consistent patient care schedule and is efficient in use of time. Coordinates restorative treatments with other facility departments. 15. Able to perform duties with a minimum of supervision. 16. Identifies potential problems/issues and reports to supervisor in a timely manner. 17. Maintains a professional approach with confidentiality. 18. Is supportive of facility goals and objectives. 19. Is able to use AccuNurse system to convey/receive resident information. 20. Cooperates and maintains good rapport with nursing staff, medical staff, other departments, and visitors. 21. Obtains and documents nursing history from the patient and/or significant other that is comprehensive of present condition and prior problems. 22. Performs basic assessment of the patient, indicating adequate knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathology. 23. Records vital signs, notes changes, and pursues more-specific investigation as needed. 24. Assesses for and notifies physician and other appropriate parties of changes in condition. 25. Uses assessment information to develop a care plan before the end of duty time that communicates enough information for incoming personnel to adequately care for the patient. 26. Uses care plans as a basis for providing safe and therapeutic care to patients. 27. Consistently follows established standards, policies, and procedures in providing nursing care. 28. Accepts accountability for clinical care of assigned patients, including supervision of nonprofessional personnel. 29. Communicates with the patient and his or her family and other members of the health care team in carrying out the goals of the care plan. 30. Performs competently those technical skills considered basic to the type of care given on that unit. 31. Responds appropriately in urgent and/or emergency situations. 32. Supports standards of nursing care through adherence to existing policies and procedures. 33. Seeks guidance when encountering nursing procedures and responsibilities that have not been mastered. 34. Promotes positive public relations with patients, residents, family members and guests 35. Uses tactful, appropriate communications in sensitive and emotional Situations. 36. Use appropriate work place behavior and adhere to dress code at all times. 37. Other duties as assigned. WORK CONDITIONS: As assigned; including some weekends, evenings and holidays. Non - Exempt Position. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Have the ability to safely perform movements such as pushing, pulling, lifting, bending, kneeling, reaching and lifting up to 50 pounds with or without reasonable accommodations.

item.title: Joliet - Retail Banker - Teller
item.description: Details: The Retail Banker is responsible for providing frontline support and service to current and potential customers to meet their everyday banking needs. This includes marketing and cross-selling products and services, as well as performing customer service, branch operations and teller functions in a non-traditional retail environment. Key Responsibilities: Processes a variety of customer transactions accurately and efficiently in adherence to bank policies and regulations such as cashing checks, processing deposits and withdrawals, loan payments, cash advances, transfers, and issuing monetary instruments. Performs opening, closing, and other branch servicing duties such as cash and vault balancing; ordering cash, cards, checks and other supplies; completing logs, reports, audits and control checks; maintaining and servicing automated teller machines; and cleaning work areas. Opens and performs account maintenance on certificate of deposit, consumer and business accounts; assists with courtesy and collection calls as needed; seeks assistance from more knowledgeable branch staff when necessary. Addresses customer questions and concerns by phone and in person; files disputes or refers to appropriate internal resources for resolution as appropriate. Proactively seeks ways to develop and expand customer relationships through marketing displays, call programs, and other prospecting techniques. Achieves personal sales and referral goals by identifying, marketing, and cross-selling banking products and services beneficial to customer needs. Enhances customer satisfaction and the professional reputation of the Bank by warmly greeting, engaging, and developing good professional relationships with customers and host retail partners. Practices branch security procedures and protects customer confidentiality and privacy. Performs other job related duties or special projects as assigned.

item.title: Windows Capabilities Server Engineer
item.description: Details: Allstate Technology Operations organization is seeking a highly qualified Windows Service Engineer (SE) to join our Infrastructure Services team. The primary responsibility of this role is collaborating in researching, designing, certifying and implantation of Windows server technology components, solutions and capabilities; provide technology component support and problem resolution. The Service Engineer contributes to the efforts of research, design, plan and maintain new or existing hardware and software technology components. The role utilizes advanced systems and scripting skills to develop methodologies to implement, integrate, and maintain new and emerging enterprise-wide systems hardware/ software technology components. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with Lead Windows Engineers, IT Architects, vendors, and business clients to ensure that the hardware and software technology components interact appropriately, data conversion impacts are considered, and other areas of impact are addressed and meet performance requirements. Participate in the research, review, analysis, selection, planning and engineering of Windows Server hardware and software components or enhancements. Utilize developed methods to test, debug, support, and analyze performance, and document hardware and software technology components. Work with highly complex hardware and software technology analysis, evaluation of resource requirements necessary to maintain and/or expand service levels or tune hardware and software components for optimum performance. Maintain the implementation of technical strategies and solutions to maintain and/or expand service levels or tune hardware and software components for optimum performance. Assist in resolution of production incidents involving multiple enterprise services and components. Provide 2 nd level support to the Operations Technology staff Contribute on project based efforts to work with various business units on ensuring integration with current infrastructure standards and offerings. Qualifications 5+ years of Windows Server technology related experience (required) Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: PowerShell scripting required (Ruby or Chef scripting a plus) Commodity x86 server hardware Blade Chassis hardware Knowledge of interoperability of server, storage and network components Clustering technology DNS/DHCP/WINS IIS/IIS Farms Experience managing projects in the windows server space, a plus Strong problem solving/ troubleshooting skills Technology industry knowledge High adaptability to change Strong communication skills; both verbal and written Education: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience Certifications: MCSE – Windows Server 2008 / 2012 a plus Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component. For jobs in San Francisco, please see the notice regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance . It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.
