item.title: Mechanic, Service Truck
item.description: Details: The Schneider maintenance team is a highly-skilled group of mechanics who work hard to deliver safe, dependable equipment to our drivers. As our business continues to grow, so does our need for qualified mechanic associates. From a single truck over 75 years ago to our fleet of over 10,000 tractors and 40,000 trailers today, we employ 650 mechanics across our network of shop facilities nationwide. In this role, you will work in a safe, clean and organized workspace. We will provide the training, parts and shop tooling needed to complete high-quality repairs effectively. We utilize the latest maintenance software where you?ll be expected to track the work performed. In addition, our shop leadership team ranks among the best in the industry and many are former master mechanics with years of Schneider shop experience. We have an immediate need for an energetic, safety minded mechanic to drive our service truck and perform on-site truck, container and trailer repairs. As a member of our maintenance team, you will complete routine repair work in the areas of tire changing, minor/moderate engine work along with electrical, hydraulic and accident repairs. Our Service Truck Mechanics will be expected to make good value, decisions following our established guidelines. Begin your journey today with Schneider. Complete the online application and we'll help you on your way to a great new career. By choosing a career with Schneider, we improve your life by offering: Annual profit sharing bonuses available Strong work/life balance that includes paid holidays and generous personal time off Medical, dental and vision insurance plus company-paid life insurance 401(k) savings plan with company match plus a company-paid retirement plan Tuition reimbursement and free financial service assistance Health Care Spending Account Resilient, values-based culture that drives safety, integrity in every action, respect and excellence in all we do Individual development opportunities through company-paid training, active leadership involvement and more than 170 online personal development courses

item.title: Client Support Specialist
item.description: Details: The National Charter Schools Institute is seeking an experienced, high functioning, results-oriented Client Support Specialist to join our team. This person will help us develop and grow a dynamic array of tools and services strategically designed to strengthen performance and productivity in the education sector and across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a track record of success, a passion for quality and excellence, and a steadfast commitment to the “customer first" philosophy. Position Title: Client Support Specialist General Statement of Responsibility : The Client Support Specialist will be responsible for becoming extensively knowledgeable about custom software products developed by our organization and utilized nationally within the education industry. With this extensive knowledge, our new team member will be able to provide a variety of value-added services throughout the entire client experience. Responsibilities : Provide customer support by telephone, web-ex, in-person and/or via email in a manner that reflects and promotes our organization’s values, expectations, and key performance indicators Maintain records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, opportunities, and comments, as well as actions taken Assist with the setup and implementation of software packages for new clients Provide accepting services of files/data submitted via software Work closely with the technology and development teams to address client inquiries, implement new software features, develop user stories and test new releases/updates Job Type : Full-time Salary and benefits will be competitive and commensurate with qualifications. The position will be located in Mount Pleasant, Michigan. Send cover letter and resume to: Jill K. St. Onge Chief of Staff National Charter Schools Institute 711 West Pickard Street, Suite M Mount Pleasant, MI 48858

item.title: Sales Representative - Sales Career
item.description: Details: Insurance Sales Representative Increasingly individuals are making decisions about insurance in the comfort of their own homes. HealthMarkets Insurance Agency continues to flourish by successfully supporting the growth of our partner agents, implementing new technologies to ensure their success. Our expanding portfolio of supplemental and life products help you pass by the barriers of time-specific sales seasons, allowing you to do what you do best – meet with clients and sell year round. Exceptional Career Opportunities National strength and local focus Competitive Compensation Package Build an independent business with our support Extended client opportunities through cross selling Pre-set appointments and first-class leads Access to a broad portfolio you can sell year round Determine your own pace and schedule Industry-leading technology tools includes our impressive Smartphone App As a HealthMarkets Insurance Agency Sales Representative, you’ll provide a consultative approach to create a personalized solution that best fits the needs of each individual client. A multi-line product portfolio provides an increased ability to cross-sell. We believe HealthMarkets offers the capability to grow your income faster than you may have ever thought possible. HealthMarkets also invest in your success by providing office marketing and lead-generation support as well as ongoing training and career development.

item.title: Accountant
item.description: Details: An award winning Architecture Firm is looking to add an accountant to their small team. This individual will be solely responsible for the finances and some of the accounting within the firm. If you have a genuine interest in architecture and are looking to apply your accounting and finance knowledge to help a firm grow this could be the perfect opportunity for you. This firm has a diverse business strategy which includes architecture services, fabrication, cultural programming, a sole proprietorship, LLCs, a development project, and a 501(c)3 startup, and they are looking for someone who can assist with financial strategy as well as handle the day-to-day accounting operations. This role will evolve based not only on the needs of the office, but on your strengths, skills, and interests. They see this role as an incubator for a smart, ambitious, motivated person to grow into an invaluable part of our firm. Responsibilities include managing cash flow, analyzing the profitability of projects and business lines, advising on pricing new projects, working with staff to manage their project time, invoicing clients, running payroll, creating annual expense budget, reporting on budget-to-actuals, administering time tracking system and ensuring user compliance, creating ad hoc analyses and financial modeling as needed, and handling all miscellaneous financial inquiries from within and from outside the firm. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate financial concepts to those without a finance background. An interest in working in a fast-paced, collaborative, energetic environment. Advanced Microsoft Excel user, proficiency with other Microsoft Office and/or iWork (Pages, Numbers), experience with financial systems (Quickbooks preferred). Experience in the architecture field is not required, but experience with managing a diverse business strategy is preferred. About Stephen James Associates: Stephen James Associates specializes in the recruitment of staff through managerial level talent in the areas of accounting and finance. When working with Stephen James Associates, you can be assured that you are working with industry-focused recruiters who will take the time to understand your skills, goals and interests and present you with relevant job opportunities. By continuously engaging with top companies, we have developed a network of top accounting and finance hiring managers in each local market. Stephen James Associates is an Aerotek company. Aerotek® Inc. is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group® Inc., the largest staffing company in the U.S. and the fourth largest worldwide. Visit StephenJames.com today for specific information about its offerings.

item.title: Automotive Service Technician
item.description: Details: Crossroads Infiniti is now accepting resumes for Automotive Technicians to join their team. If you have the experience and drive to work for one of the most respected Auto Groups in the Carolinas & Virginia this may be the right opportunity for you. Job Definition Technicians inspect, maintain and repair vehicles. Technicians use diagnostic tools to identify the source of problems and then make adjustments or repairs. As with all positions within dealerships, service technicians are expected to uphold the highest ethical standards. We provide: Competitive wages above industry average An industry leading training and development program Medical, dental, vision, disability, life, and 401k Top selling volume stores by manufacturer Professional work environment Aggressive marketing strategy coupled with state of the art internet marketing Number 1 brand awareness along with an unmatched reputation for doing good business Commitment to family lifestyle, always closed on Sunday Job Duties The duties of a service technician vary depending on specialties; however, general duties include: Diagnosing the cause of malfunctions and performing work specified on the repair order with efficiency and in accordance with dealership and/or factory standards to include preventative maintenance and computer diagnostic test. Repairing or replacing all parts of a vehicle including wheels, axles, frames, defective ball joint suspensions and brake shoes; installing and repairing air conditioners and servicing components such as compressors, condensers, and controls; and testing electronic computer components in automobiles to ensure that they are working properly. Communicating directly with the service advisor so that customers can be informed if any additional service is needed. Providing an estimate of time needed for additional repairs.

item.title: NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP - Nurse Home Visitor
item.description: Details: NURSE FAMILY PARTNERSHIP - Nurse Home Visitor The Nurse-Family Partnership Program (NFP) is a nationallyrecognized model of nurse home visiting that improves health,development, and life outcomes for young mothers and theirchildren over the long term. The NFP nurse establishes a trusting, therapeutic one on one relationship with low income, first time mothers, who voluntarily consent to bi-weekly visits throughout pregnancy and the child's second year of life. The nurse assesses the physical, emotional, social and environmental needs of the family and provides counseling, health education, referral and case management in such areas as prenatal and postpartum care, nutrition, parenting, child health and development, family planning and life course development. The partnership between the nurse and the client is the basis for change, as the nurse helps the woman to clarify her goals for herself and her child and obtain the skills she needs to accomplish her goals. Job Qualifications: • BSN required. • Current RN license (in good standing) required. • One year experience is highly desireable in any of the following: childbearing women and children, pediatrics, maternal / child mental health or community health. • Ability to establish interpersonal relationships with women and families from diverse socioeconomic and cultural backgrounds. • Ability to speak Spanish is highly desirable . VNS offers an excellent compensation and benefit package including generous vacation/sick days/personal days and education reimbursements. Apply today at www.vnsnet.com and join a team dedicated to patient and family centered care at home. S. Pugsley, Human Resurces 2180 Empire Blvd., Webster, NY 14580 Fax: 585-787-8369 email: VNS values diversity and encourages minorities to apply. E.O.E.

item.title: Licensed Therapist - Autism/Mental Health
item.description: Details: Wesley Spectrum is seeking a Licensed Therapist for the position of Mental Health Professional/Family Liaison. The position is located at the Bridgeville office and requires some evening hours. This position is in the Autism Wellness & Enrichment Services which is a new model for serving children with ASD in a site-based and community setting. It is a full continuum of care in one program, offering individual and family therapy, parent training and advocacy, social skills groups, and community integration. Responsible for the provision of therapy to meet the mental health needs of the child and family. Individual Therapy and Family Therapy will be offered. Responsible for coordination, collaboration, and communication with all members of each child’s team, ensuring family engagement, and identifying and connecting the family with natural supports within the community. May provide training for staff and families. Scheduling and coordinating monthly clinic meetings with family and all team members. Participates in all intake meetings, clinical team meetings, and weekly staff meetings. . Wesley Spectrum offers a very competitive salary and an extensive benefits package.

item.title: Warehouse Attendant - Wellhead Systems
item.description: Details: One of the largest oilfield services companies, Weatherford operates in more than 100 countries and employs more than 70,000 people worldwide. With a product and service portfolio that spans the life cycle of a well- well construction, formation evaluation, completion and production- and a robust research and development effort, we are well positioned to meet the ever-evolving needs of the oil and gas industry. JOB SCOPE Coordinates with purchasing / planners, maintains inventory control on incoming and outgoing parts for repairs, dispense parts, and shipping. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Keep warehouse / product storage areas in order. Store unused raw materials in proper area when processes are complete. Unload incoming deliveries per quality work instructions. Report shortages and damaged material per quality work instructions. Parts room inventory maintenance. Dispense parts to shop personnel. Post incoming and outgoing part movement within inventory management system. Receipt of incoming parts and disperse accordingly. Maintain consistent communication with Purchasing Department regarding new items, change of brand names, change of location, count, incoming shipments, etc. Properly operate auxiliary equipment. Load products for shipment. Maintain clean and safe working environment. Performs weekly / monthly cycle counts of inventory and enters results in inventory management system. Maintain inventory management system by continually updating pertinent information with regard to cost changes, stocking levels, on hand quantities, and consumption (usage). Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job. SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS Good verbal communication skills. Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos. Ability to follow oral instructions Ability to read and comprehend critical production documents. Ability to work closely with others. Preferred Experience in SAP / JDE systems 1 to 3 years' experience as Material Handler C or equivalent.

item.title: Business Management and Administration
item.description: Details: Entry Level Administrative Assistant -- Event Marketing Assistant -- Immediate Hire IMMEDIATE HIRE AND PAID TRAINING! Accelerated Marketing is now hiring for a self-motivated, energetic individual to fill our front desk administrative assistant position! We are one of the leading full service promotional event marketing firms in the Blue Bell area and we specialize in marketing for a variety of clients through targeted retail campaigns. We have recently expanded our firm and our client portfolio and we are looking for the next great addition to our team. Accelerated Marketing is a company dedicated to providing opportunities for personal and professional growth to our team members. Given the success of our event marketing campaigns this year, we are looking for an individual who will be excited to learn the basics of office administration, human resources and recruiting strategies in order to become a valued addition to our team! We provide a comprehensive training program for this position and the positions if for IMMEDIATE HIRE! **We need a candidate with a great attitude, strong work ethic and a desire to succeed. ** **We are looking for someone who can contribute and grow with our team.** The following qualities in our candidate is a must: - Ability to recruit candidates for our sales team - Ability to handle and answer multiple phone lines - Must possess a student mentality, people skills and work ethics - Ability to accomplish multiple tasks in a fast paced environment - Ability to drive projects from inception to completion with little guidance - Superb attention to detail - VERY computer literate

item.title: Production Engineer "Assembly"
item.description: Details: DENSO Overview: DENSO is a leading global automotive supplier, developer and manufacturer of advanced technology, systems and components. DENSO operates in more than 30 countries and regions, and has more than 130,000 employees worldwide. Its customers include all the world's major carmakers. Global consolidated sales totaled US$38.1 billion for fiscal year ended March 31, 2013. DENSO’s North American consolidated sales totaled US$6.8 billion during the same period. At DENSO, our focus with all of our products is on quality, safety, comfort, convenience and consideration for the environment. DENSO Wireless Systems America, Inc. (DWAM), located in Vista, CA, is a manufacturer of automotive electronics, focusing on in-vehicle infotainment, data communication modules, navigation systems and was first in the world to launch a wireless charger as a standard feature. Job Purpose : New production process design with focus on quality target achievement, schedule attainment, cost reduction and capacity improvement through interaction with manufacturing and design personnel. Provide sustaining support for assembly production area, to develop and implement operational documentation and procedures. New line jig design and qualification. Responsibilities: • Plans, directs, and coordinates manufacturing processes in manufacturing facility; develops, evaluates, and improves manufacturing methods • Analyzes and plans workforce utilization, space requirements, and workflow, and designs layout of equipment and workspace for maximum efficiency and safety, while staying within budget • Assures product and process quality by designing testing methods • Creates and evaluates tool, jig and process capabilities • Conducts job ergonomics evaluations and equipment cycle time analysis • Confers with suppliers to confirm product specifications and arrange for purchase of equipment, materials and parts • Evaluates products according to specifications and quality standards. • Creates and updates engineering documentation (PFMEA, Control Plans, Job Instructions, Factory Layouts, etc.)

item.title: Safety Manager
item.description: Details: Position Summary The Safety Manager provides strategic support in the development and implementation of loss prevention programs and safety objectives, policies, procedures and training programs. Essential Job Functions Provides technical expertise and consultation to management to promote and implement safety-related training programs that drive sustainable, proactive safety conscience behaviors. Ensures that loss prevention programs are in place to maintain compliance with applicable federal, state and local safety regulations that govern the solid waste industry. Assesses loss control program activities efforts to communicate, train and develop critical skills. Monitors implementation of safety and loss prevention programs; takes action to redirect activity where performance falls short of targets. Ensures continued compliance with applicable OSHA safety regulations are maintained. Ensures continued compliance is maintained with Federal and State Department of Transportation regulations and ensure recordkeeping requirements are met. Provides technical expertise and acts as a resource in the preparation of training materials. Supports monthly employee safety meetings by ensuring that leadership promotes and consistently relays the organization’s values and beliefs regarding a safe working environment. Participates in investigation of serious accidents / injuries and monitors supervisor investigations of all minor accidents and injuries. Provides leadership with timely accident / injury trending and other compliance reports. Interprets data and makes recommendations where appropriate to address negative trends. Participates in division OSHA or DOT compliance inspections as well as audits that may occur. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.

item.title: Wound Care Nurse, RN
item.description: Details: RestorixHealth strives to provide the best-in-class comprehensive wound management care while leading the industry with clinical excellence, superior patient outcomes and value based partnerships. RestorixHealth develops and manages hospital-based wound care centers that provide traditional wound care and Hyperbaric ("HBOt") treatments to outpatients on an outsourced basis. If you are a candidate who is passionate about working within health care and who wants to join a wonderful organization, apply now! RestorixHealth is currently looking for a per diem, Wound Care / RN to work at our center located in Kalamazoo, MI. Summary: The Wound Care Nurse uses the nursing process to plan, implement, direct, and evaluate patient care to achieve optimal patient outcomes; works collaboratively with all other disciplines on assigned unit. Detailed Responsibilities: Conduct initial and ongoing age-specific assessments in designated time frames. Contribute to interdisciplinary plan of care using assessment data. Evaluate effectiveness of plan/of care and modifies, as appropriate. Involve patient/family/significant other in developing plan of care. Collaborate with other clinical disciplines in developing plan of care. Provide care based on scientific principles/nursing theory and evidence based practice. Recognize change in the patient’s condition and intervene appropriately. Prioritize nursing actions, reflecting patient needs, acuity, and desired outcomes. Implement physician orders accurately within appropriate time frames. Demonstrate competency in core & unit-specific clinical skills. Identify continuing care needs of the patient for the discharge plan. In the absence of a front desk coordinator, scheduling patients for HBO therapy or wound care visit, utilizing hospital software/ systems as well as the RestorixHealth EMR system may be required. Provide patient/family education to include: Provision of appropriate educational materials, as available prior to discharge. Document all care provided accurately & completely according to Hospital and Department Policy. HIPPA Compliance – complies with all of the Privacy and Confidentiality Policy and Procedures outlined in the “Privacy, Security and Confidentiality Agreement". Adheres to all Patient Safety Initiatives and Infection Control Procedures as outlined in the hospitals safety manual. Appropriate use of Hospital resources - supplies and equipment. Process and utilize all computerized patient care functions, e.g. ADT, diagnostic test results, etc. Assessment of learning needs, abilities and readiness to learn, Documentation of teaching activities, Provision of instruction as appropriate, e.g. pain management, medication, diet, equipment, activities after discharge.

item.title: Delivery Service Representative (2nd Shift)
item.description: Details: Make your move. Achieve more. XPO Logistics, Inc. (NYSE: XPO) is a company that thinks big and acts fast. We're a passionate provider of transportation logistics services, and one of the fastest-growing companies of our kind in North America. We're bringing a lot of qualified people on board to share in our growth. XPO people are in the middle of the action every day, making the connections that keep the economy moving. Our teams in freight brokerage, intermodal, last-mile logistics, expedited transportation, managed transportation and freight forwarding use their relationships with more than 27,000 carriers to serve over 14,000 shipper customers in the manufacturing, industrial, retail, commercial, life sciences and governmental sectors. It's fast-paced, competitive work. We want people on our team who are confident and driven to win - people who are excited to help build our growth. We've created inspiring workspaces that are charged with adrenaline, where a big effort can pay off in a big way. And you'll do it with our support: we'll give you training and technology and a strong team to work with. This is your chance to achieve more with a company that's a multi-billion dollar transportation logistics leader. XPO Logistics is built to deliver. Make your move. Responsibilities: Make 100+ calls nightly, to transportation companies / drivers and update shipments in the XPO TMS portal (Transportation Management System) Receive inbound calls from various transportation companies / drivers and update shipments in the XPO TMS Monitor daily pick-ups and deliveries Provide detailed instructions to properly insure on-time pickup and delivery Communicate with 1 st shift Procurement Managers, Team Leads, Sales Managers and Sales Reps, on problem loads and what actions are being taken to solve the issue Investigate product overage, shortage, damage, and complete appropriate documentation Work with external branches corresponding via email and telephone Ability to handle high volume calls, and multi-task when more than one issue may arise at a time Work independently and have the ability to make sound judgment calls without supervision Work closely with Sales Reps concerning 24hr shippers and 24hr receivers Document any discrepancies, with Carrier Information, such as incorrect driver information or incorrect contact information Document "Hot Shipment" lists that have to be passed from 2 nd to 3 rd shift, which includes shipments in jeopardy of missing pick up or delivery Maintain composure in a fast paced transportation environment Meet established KPIs, goals and departmental standards Cross function with all aspects of XPO Departments and Branches

item.title: Manager of Quality Assurance
item.description: Details: Manager of Quality Assurance Dayton, OH Direct Hire Salary $118- $136K- DOE Our client is looking for a Manager of Quality Assurance. The ideal candidate will direct product assurance program to prevent or eliminate defects in new or existing products. The ideal candidate will ensures the promotion of awareness of regulatory and customer requirements throughout the organization. They will direct all aspects for the company quality systems, regulatory/ISO compliance and document controls. Directs QA processes and is responsible for inspection of manufactured parts and continuous improvement of business processes. Required Skills: BA in related field M.A. or equivalent; or four to ten years' related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience Directly supervises members of the Quality Department Medical Device Experience Supervisory responsibilities Interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems Desired Skills: Excellent communication skills Excellent verbal and written skills Advanced mathematical concepts Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions

item.title: RN / Registered Nurse - Multiple shifts available - Skilled nursing Facility
item.description: Details: RN Full-Time and Part-Time Positions Available Long Term Care / Skilled Nursing Facility About us: Regents Park of Winter Park has been serving Orange and Seminole Counties, including Winter Park, Casselberry, Maitland Orlando, Altamonte Springs, Oviedo, Longwood and Winter Springs for over 20 years. Our facility is located close to local hospitals. We provide post-acute services, rehabilitative services, skilled nursing, short and long term care through Physical, Occupational, and Speech Therapists; Registered and Licensed Practical Nurses; and Certified Nursing Assistants. This is complemented by Social Services, Activities, Nutritional Services, Housekeeping and Laundry Services. With over 195 years of combined experience, our staff of professionals is here to meet the needs of each and every patient and resident. About the positions: We are looking for RN's for our facility! We have both Full-Time and Part-Time positions in each area. RN / Registered Nurse: Maintain accurate, detailed reports and records. Administer medications to patients and monitor patients for reactions or side effects. Record patients' medical information and vital signs. Monitor, record, and report symptoms or changes in patients' conditions. Consult and coordinate with healthcare team members to assess, plan, implement, or evaluate patient care plans. Modify patient treatment plans as indicated by patients' responses and conditions. Monitor all aspects of patient care, including diet and physical activity. Supervise Certified Nursing Assistants and other healthcare personnel. Prepare patients for and assist with examinations or treatments. Instruct individuals, families, or other groups on topics such as health education, disease prevention, and develop health improvement programs.

item.title: Allied Healthcare Professional (Non-Clinical) - Customer Support Representative
item.description: Details: Few outsourced services providers — if any — have the depth of pharmaceutical experience that Telerx offers. We are recognized for our comprehensive management of complex and sensitive interactions in the healthcare marketplace. Over our 30 year history, we have partnered with every leading healthcare company in the country. With strict adherence to regulatory requirements and SOPs, we have supported programs for prescription medications and OTC products, biotech products, medical devices, home diagnostics, managed healthcare, nutritional supplements and nutraceuticals. Telerx is committed to our pharmaceutical heritage and the culture of quality we developed while serving this industry. We continuously infuse our organization with new ideas and methodologies and have helped our pharmaceutical clients transition from a physician-oriented to a consumer-driven market. As a member of our team of Medical Professionals you will be responsible for providing premier customer service on inquiries, processing orders, explaining client products, recognizing adverse events and handling complaints in a prompt, courteous, clear and concise manner. The Account Representative: • Confers with internal and/or external customers in order to provide information about products and/or services such as processing customer requests, orders, cancel accounts or obtain details of complaints over the phone, by email, live chat, social media or other method of communication. • Resolves customer questions and concerns effectively and efficiently by actively listening, communicating clearly and concisely, and assuring customer understanding. • Ensures customer satisfaction and loyalty by consulting with customers, assisting customers, and resolving a wide variety of customer requests, inquiries, and complaints. • Assists with product or service related tasks and activities, which may include order processing, invoicing, researching accounts, order history, handling returns, client program policies and opening new accounts. • Keeps records of customer interactions and transactions, recording details of inquiries, complaints, comments and actions taken. • Builds and maintain business relationship with clients by providing prompt and accurate service so as to promote customer loyalty for the client. • Documents Adverse Events and Quality Complaints. • Obtains and examines all relevant information to assess validity of complaints and to determine possible causes. May make outbound calls related to the product or service, and/or in follow-up to a customer inquiry. This position requires a current license. Previous pharmaceutical call center experience preferred. Previous product quality and/or drug safety experience is a plus. Must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Office products. Key Terms: RN, Registered Nurse, Non-Clinical, Call Center, Nurse, Pharmaceutical Call Center, Health Care Communicator, Customer Support, Call Center Nurse, LPN, EMT, Dentist, Chiropractor, Medical Assistant, Paramedic, Physical Therapist

item.title: Learning & Development Manager
item.description: Details: Learning andDevelopment Manager Reporting to ExecutiveDirector of Strategy, Programs, and Planning, the Learning and DevelopmentManager is responsible for the organization’s training and development needs focusedon improving the performance, knowledge, and skills of internal stakeholdersand employees. Specifically, the position will focus ondeveloping training program and content related to corporate messaging,processes, best practices, service offerings, and IT systems. Learning and Development Strategic andSystem Management (15%) Create and manage a LMS system for effective information distribution and learning measurement Proactively assess the needs of the training organization working with internal stakeholders to continuously expand on the curriculum Identify innovative ways to deliver learning and development Design and deliver an evaluation strategy for learning Monitor training costs to ensure budget is not exceeded, and prepare budget reports to justify expenditures. Employee Development (15%) Create and manage learning opportunities beginning with New Hire orientation and training to ongoing professional development opportunities for existing employees Manage the development planning process Provide managers best practices on how to develop their employees. CurriculumDevelopment (35%) Create a balanced curriculum that helps foster internal employee’s confidence and comfort level with representing and performing within DISYS. This includes training courses related to corporate messages, DISYS solutions, and systems used in DISYS’ day-to-day operations. Develop and maintain training materials and improves existing materials Create multi-media training materials including, but not limited to, videos, self-training modules, quick guides, knowledge-base, handouts, and other visual materials Review, extract, and organize partner provided content and training tools that can be leveraged by the internal team TrainingDelivery (35%) Develop, maintain, update, and conduct key training programs via various media: in-person; web or video conference technology; self-training materials. Coordinate, schedule and conduct business and technical training for new hires and current employees. Track status of staff training needs: classes completed and classes to be scheduled. Identify and assess training needs of staff by conferring with managers and supervisors or conducting surveys. Periodically, evaluate training effectiveness. Maintain all training course participant feedback for tracking and reporting. Assist in the scheduling of in-person training logistics to include, participants, lodging, transportation, etc. Schedule monthly WebEx ATS/ALL DISYS Technology training sessions. Conduct monthly ATS/ALL DISYS Technology training sessions for both new and existing employees. Maintain and update the Intranet with proper training videos and content.

item.title: Statistical Programmer/Analyst 1 Year Contract Opportunity!
item.description: Details: Statistical Programmer/Analyst Job Description This is a statistical programmer/analyst position, programming in SAS every day. Tasks may include production and validation programming for clinical reports (e.g., tables, listings, and graphs), creating SAS datasets and SAS analysis datasets (can merge from multiple sources and create derived variables), ad-hoc listing (e.g., to help with data cleaning), and creating study management reports (e.g., data quality report). Work will be done according to Healthcare standard operating procedures for development and documentation of work. Industry experience is a must. (Pharma, research institutes, clinical, medical facilities) This is not a data management role. It is more analysis and reporting centered. Responsibilities Plans and coordinates programming, testing, and documentation of statistical programs for use in creating statistical tables, graphics, and listing summaries. Programs analysis database manipulations and transfers of data for internal and external clients. May integrate databases from multiple studies or sources. Develops listing and table specifications with study Biostatistician. Interact with Data Management and Biostatistics staff and SP team members to negotiate timelines, responsibilities, and deliverables. Understands and complies with Standard Operating Procedures and Work Instructions. Programs, tests, and documents statistical programs and tools in accordance with SP standards and validation procedures. Meets milestones as assigned. Performs other duties as directed by Statistical Programming management. Will be working on CRDM trials. Requirements Experience using SAS for more than 2 years and using SAS on clinical trial data analysis. Industrial experience is preferred Regulatory submission experience is a plus Prefer the candidate has industry experience and had experience with PMA submission etc. Absolute skill is SAS programming skills inlcuding SAS BASE/STAT/MACRO/SQL etc. Candidates must possess leadership abilities, work within a team environment and be open to other duties as they are assigned. Since 1995, iTech Solutions Inc., has been providing IT Consulting and Direct Hire Services to the Insurance, Financial, Communications, Manufacturing and Government sectors with local offices in Connecticut, Minnesota, Colorado, Massachusetts, Tennessee, and New Jersey / Pennsylvania area. Our recruiting strategy is simple, if you want to find qualified IT professionals then use IT professionals to find them. So at iTech Solutions, our personnel are all career IT professionals with a wide range of IT experience. We can honestly say our staff understands the technologies, the complexities of finding and selecting the appropriate personnel and the pressures of running successful IT projects. For more information please call Shannon Mahaffey at 952-513-2130 ext 254 or at (Other Job Titles Include: Jr. Developer, Junior Developer, Jr. Programmer, Junior Programmer, Jr. Programmer / Analyst, Junior Programmer / Analyst, Guru, Consultant, Software Engineer and Engineer)

item.title: Creative Engagement Specialist
item.description: Details: This is a fulltime exempt level position reporting to the Manager of Communication Programs & can be based in any of the following 3 Altegra Health locations: Minneapolis,MN, Miami, FL or Alpharetta, GA. The Creative Engagement Specialist will participate in all roles and responsibilities within the Creative Engagement team, collaborating with internal stakeholders and helping drive projects through execution. The Creative Engagement team is responsible for creating and managing all member communications. The team will strategize, write, design and manage the multi-lingual materials for all communication channels: Interactive Voice Recordings (IVR), web, text, print, email, and live agent for the Medicare, Medicaid and Commercial member audience. Responsibilities: Writes creative, engaging, and accurate copy that increases member participation and includes a call to action – print, email, web, live, and app Works collaboratively with all stakeholders to obtain up-to-date information as it relates to government standards and client requirements Ensures that messaging aligns with corporate brand standards Edits and reviews copy developed by outside clients and internal teams Has a critical eye and feels comfortable critiquing design Strategic thinking, solution driven Manage high-volume content library Work with internal teams on product outreach strategy Program Flows, Project Briefs, Project Specifications Document and maintain processes and procedures Qualifications: Education – Bachelor of Arts with at least 5 years experience: journalism, communications, copywriting, editing. Knowledge of the health care industry is a plus. Highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications in particular Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Experience in Visio, InDesign, Photoshop, and similar programs are a plus. Can work effectively on multiple projects at the same time: fast-track as well as long-term Effective Communicator – written and oral Ability to receive and reciprocate constructive criticism Demonstrate initiative and creativity Spanish as a second language is a plus Writing for a consumer audience Communicating at all levels within an organization, building consensus Problem solving with the ability to imagine creative solutions Excellent editorial skills including: grammar, spelling, punctuation

item.title: MACY'S IS HIRING: Seasonal Retail Selling Floor Recovery, Evenings Until Close - Mission Viejo, CA - The Shops at Mission Viejo
item.description: Details: Job Overview: As a Seasonal Floor Recovery Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. You will be required to move between selling areas as directed to maintain high customer readiness standards. You will deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment, while building quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and other operational tasks as assigned. This position is only in our Extreme Hard Shop Locations. Performs other duties as assigned. In order to present our customers with the best holiday shopping experience, many of our Holiday Selling Floor Recovery Associates arrive prior to store opening and remain after closing to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Holiday associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule on a temporary basis, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas. And don't forget - just in time for holiday shopping, you will receive an employee discount of up to 20% starting your first day! Any schedule hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All holiday associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends, or on key holiday events such as the Friday after Thanksgiving. Essential Functions:- Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration - Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills - Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority - Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice - Adhere to all safety and security policies and procedures - Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality Qualifications: Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management. Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Other skills: Ability to work as part of a team, or independently with minimal direct supervision. Strong customer selling orientation. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and open to learning new procedures. Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including evenings and weekends. Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: Sales for Largest Social Media Company
item.description: Details: Business Sales Representative (Outbound Sales for Largest Social Media Company) Represent Facebook and other top brand name companies. Apply today and start as soon as December 1st! Walk-ins encouraged Monday - Friday from 9am to 3pm at 16404 N Black Canyon Hwy Suite 100 Phoenix, AZ 85053 **This opportunity will require you to work in Phoenix, AZ** Success oriented individuals; we are looking for fantastic people like you! Warm Leads Provided! We are Revana, a leader in outsourced sales and marketing solutions serving some of the world’s most prestigious brand names. We are seeking Business Sales Representatives. This is an exciting and rewarding opportunity to help our Fortune 500 clients build their business. This position is for an outbound program supporting the largest social media company in the world. You will be contacting new leads and existing customers for the purpose of developing a buying relationship with them. Positions are available immediately. Walk-ins are welcome Monday to Friday, 9am-3pm and members of our Revana team will be available to administer candidate assessments and onsite interviews. We offer the following to successful candidates: • Competitive salary + commission • Advancement and Career Opportunities • Award-winning Recognition and Incentive Program • Medical and Dental Insurance Programs • Tuition Reimbursement & Retirement Planning • Paid Time Off • Ongoing Training and Development • Discounts at many major retailers & restaurants • Casual dress code We are a company filled with high energy people with a willingness to put the client’s needs first. Our ideal candidate loves sales and marketing and is ready for the exciting, fast-paced career where you can go as far as your ambitions will take you. Job Responsibilities The Business Sales Representative will be engaging in outbound sales, business development and marketing as you succeed in prospecting and developing accounts. Additional responsibilities include: • Contacting new leads and nurturing existing customers • Introducing clients to the best technology products and services provided by industry leaders • Building long-term customer relationships

item.title: Human Resources Manager
item.description: Details: SUMMARY: The Human Resources Manager will report to the Vice President of Human Resources and will work with the HR Department staff as well as Operations leaders to achieve and maintain the organization’s goals and objectives. The Human Resources Manager will provide direct field support in a fast-paced service environment. The Human Resources Manager will be responsible for both strategic and tactical HR and Employee Relations management. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Support organizational change through direct participation in communication, planning and project management in partnership with management. Actively scan the environment (audit) to insure a positive workplace for all employees. Investigate and resolve employee concerns and complaints in partnership and collaboration with local management team. Identify and resolve all at-risk conditions in partnership with HR staff and management. Provide specific advisement to managers in order to improve leadership effectiveness. Ensures compliance with federal and state laws governing various aspects of human resources including staffing, employee relations, leaves of absence, FMLA, ADA/ADAAA, workers compensation and enforcement of policies and procedures. Manages EEOC/DFEH and DLSE cases, conducts investigations and responds to agencies. Attends DLSE hearings on behalf of the company. Develop & deliver human resources programs, processes & procedures at assigned location. Acts as a consultant/advisor for managers and employees regarding employee relations and performance issues through one on one, small group and/or department meetings. Manages the corrective action process. Responsible for developing and implementing employee communication strategies to create and maintain an environment that delivers desired business results and supports employee engagement. Involved in the development, planning, implementation and administration of employee relations policies and procedures.

item.title: Service Manager
item.description: Details: Are You Built This Way? We are people taking care of people... and their cars. That’s what it means to be Pep Boys. Are you built this way? Since Manny, Moe & Jack founded Pep Boys in 1921, we’ve aimed to be the best place to shop and care for your car. A career at Pep Boys is an opportunity to become part of a trusted team with a cherished brand, a proud history and an exciting future. If you’re looking for a company that will be there for you on the road ahead, make Pep Boys your destination. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ We are hiring a Service Manager to lead our service department in our store in Bellflower, CA! Our Service Managers lead service departments in a fast-paced environment, motivate and develop teams of selling and technical associates and engage with and care for customers every day. Service Managers enjoy a flexible work schedule, competitive pay, career – development opportunities and a full range of benefits. Join us today! Responsibilities Customer Service Hiring, training, motivating and coaching a dynamic and high-performing service selling and technical team Supervising and managing the work load of all service department associates Effectively operating the service department to achieve overall business performance objectives, including sales, productivity and profitability goals Ensuring the service department operates under safe conditions according to established policies and procedures and in compliance with federal, state, county and municipal regulations

item.title: Interior Designer/Interior Design Sales Consultant
item.description: Details: Design with talent, style and passion in a fashion forward fast-paced creative environment. Imagine an opportunity to create beautiful rooms with thousands of the latest fabrics, dozens of fashion-forward finishes, and high-quality furnishings in almost every imaginable style. Add our vast, exclusive accent and custom drapery programs and best-in-business training and support, and you can see why Ethan Allen is “the place" to ignite your interior design career. Our Design Consultants enjoy outstanding earning potential with commissions of up to 9.5%. You’ll receive excellent training. The tech-savvy, high-energy and on-trend designer will bring talent, sales ability, and customer focus to the table as well as a passion for design and flexibility with your work schedule which includes weekends and some holidays. If you love working with people and are motivated by the thought of limitless earning potential, this is the position for you! Ethan Allen Retail has been a leader in the luxury home furnishings and interior design business for more than eighty years. We are a global style authority, spanning twelve countries on three continents. We built our company on a vertically integrated business model that has stood the test of time. We believe our associates are our greatest assets, and that talent, drive, and customer focus should be rewarded. We employ the best in the furniture industry and offer exceptional training and support by utilizing the latest technology and proven business practices. We provide a clear career path for interior design professionals and design-minded business people as well as superb earnings opportunities and outstanding benefits.

item.title: Counselor
item.description: Details: Counselor Job Description Reports to: Clinical Supervisor Job Summary: Adheres to the vision and mission of the Company. Maintains a caseload according to state regulations and provides direct counseling and case management services to patients, consisting of individual, and group services, including assessment, individualized treatment plans, counseling and aftercare services. Counselor I will work closely with the Clinical Supervisor to ensure that clients needs are addressed on an individual basis ensuring exceptional service. Will mentor those in a Counselor II positions. Participate in clinical and interdisciplinary team meetings on a weekly basis. Can be requested to provide coverage for clinical supervisor. Duties & Responsibilities: · Assures incoming patients have psychosocial assessment and interpretive summary according to the timeline in the ARS policy manual. · Completes, with patient participation, a Preliminary Treatment Plan according to the timeline in the ARS policy manual. · Completes a Quarterly Case Consult according to the timeline in the ARS policy manual. · Completes a Treatment Plan Review and update for each patient after completion of the Comprehensive Treatment Plan according to the timeline in the ARS policy manual. · Prepares an aftercare transition plan for all patients at the earliest possible time and to review prior to discharge. · Prepare annual review, BPS update, annual case consult and annual bill of rights for each patient on a yearly basis. · Follows up, according to the Follow-Up Policy and Plan with each discharged patient. · Provides individual addiction counseling according to the Comprehensive Treatment Plan. · Provides group addiction counseling according to the Comprehensive Treatment Plan. · Documents each individual, group, case management or other patient contacts by way of progress note written in “DAP" formula in accordance with ARS policy manual standards. · Ensures all paperwork is filed into patient charts in a timely manner that meets ARS policy manual standards. · Ensure that patient has an accurate form of funding and that authorizations are reviewed in a timely manner to ensure payment for services. · Completes all paperwork that is associated with take homes and state exceptions. · Complete 30 hours of training in first year of employment and 25 hours thereafter. · Attend required clinical and treatment team meetings on a weekly basis to allow consultations of current caseload. · Participates in Peer Reviews and other Quality Assurance activities as assigned. · Is proficient in understanding and applying State Licensure Standards, CARF standards, HIPAA and 42 CFR expectations and Company policies.

item.title: PHARMACY TECHNICIAN-Vincennes, IN
item.description: Details: Genoa, a QoL Healthcare company is a leader in behavioral healthcare specialty pharmacy solutions. Serving more than 300,000 individuals with a mental illness across 34 states, we are a rapidly growing and successful organization with a strong reputation in serving the mental health community via a network of full-service pharmacies co-located (or embedded) within mental health clinics throughout the United States. The company strives to make a positive impact in our partner clinic and clients’ lives to improve care and outcomes. We seek a Pharmacy Technician to support all functions of the Genoa Healthcare mental health pharmacy, primarily through dispensing medical prescriptions, and performing necessary clerical duties while under the direct supervision of a registered pharmacist. Major Duties & Responsibilities: Provide exceptional customer service to all patients and members of the clinic staff Under direct supervision of the registered pharmacist, fills compounds and prescription orders and makes them available for verification by the Pharmacist. Once verified by the pharmacist, dispenses the prescriptions. Order, receive and store incoming pharmacy supplies. Receive and process wholesaler medication orders. Verify medication stock and enter data in computer to maintain inventory records. Help maintain a clean organized work environment. Perform various clerical duties relating to the department. Work with the pharmacist to assist in the pharmacy functions and keeping the pharmacy in compliance with all federal and state requirements. Occasional medication delivery to consumers. Other Duties as assigned. Educational or Skills Requirements: Must be a licensed Pharmacy Technician in the state your are applying too. Some Pharmacy Technician experience is required PTCB Certification is preferred, but not required for all states Candidates for the position will be subject to a standard reference, background check and drug screening. Knowledge of Microsoft Office and telephone protocol. Duties require professional verbal and written communication skills.

item.title: Account Payment Coordinator
item.description: Details: A company in the Greater Cleveland area that specializes in the food & beverage industry is currently seeking an Account Payment Coordinator for their credit and collections department to do the following: * Responsible for successful and timely payment application and deduction resolution * Applies payments for specified group of customers * Identifies, analyzes, and investigates deductions and unapplied cash * Obtaining and gathering supporting documentation to enable identification and resolution of deductions * Ensure documents are readily available for appropriate parties to audit * Develop process improvements, including recommendations for systems, policy and procedure enhancements * Analyze and resolve root cause of customer related issues and ensure customer satisfaction Qualifications: Bachelor Degree in accounting/finance/or pertinent major Excellent 401K, and Benefits Package Available If you are interested in this opportunity please contact Joseph Kim at 216-573-5648 to schedule an interview. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Receptionist - Front Desk
item.description: Details: We are currently seeking a Front Desk Receptionist part time from 10 am to 4 pm Monday through Friday in Burlingame. Position requires previous experience transferring high volume inbound calls on a multi phone line system. This is a temp position expected to last for 2-4 months with the possibility of becoming a permanent position. Hourly pay rate is $15.

item.title: Sales Consultant
item.description: Details: Our desire at Havertys Furniture Co. Inc. is consulting with our customers to design a warm and inviting home, where they can enjoy spending time with their loved ones and entertaining their friends. If you are interested in building relationships and helping customers design the home of their dreams, being part of our team could be the career choice for you. Whether your background is in retail, interior design, furniture, commission sales or just time for a change. Join our brand with a 130 year history of service to the customers and our communities. At Havertys you are supported by a team focused on quality, value and service to meet the customers expectations in a timely manner. Cutting edge point of sale technology and selling tools enable you to take your income potential to the next level and become a Million Dollar writer. The role of furniture sales consultant includes: Creating and building long lasting relationships with your customers Assisting customers select the right products for their homes to meet their design and lifestyle needs Following-up with customers to complete their entire decor Becoming a believer in Havertys' products and systems Developing personal and professional skills through ongoing training

item.title: Immediate Hire - Entry Level (100% Training)
item.description: Details: Visit Our Website Need Experience? Have a Good Work Ethic? Great Personality? Marketing and Sales May Be The Right Industry For You 312 Marketing is a privately-owned marketing and sales firm, in Midtown Raleigh, with an expanding client portfolio. We are opening 5 more national offices within the next year - each run by a manager who started in the entry level marketing and sales position and progressed through our management training program. We find that candidates with sports backgrounds have valuable skill sets due to their work ethic, competitive drive, and ability to win in all types of situations. All of our positions are entry level, which allow for rapid advancement into a marketing management role, and involve working with people on a daily basis. All of our marketing and sales associates are cross trained in all areas of business management. Those selected will gain experience not only in sales and marketing, but also campaign management, advertising, human resources, and team development. Our work environment is incredibly important as well, and we are looking for candidates who work well in a team and can contribute to an exciting and energetic environment.

item.title: Customer Service Representative
item.description: Details: Direct Customer Service Representative Our goals are simple ; everyconsumer must benefit from our promotions, every client must benefitfrom our services and every representative must benefit from ourtraining and team spirit! Our challenge : We arecontinuously expanding our client base as well as the number ofterritories that we are responsible for nationally. Our current clientbase is extremely diverse, and our territories now stack up to 5 acrossthe nation. We are in need of customer service professionals that canwork on site at our promotional events providing direct customer andclient support through promotional techniques. * Please note: The Direct Customer Service positions that we currently have open are Entry Level positions, with no ceiling on the opportunity for growth. If you arelooking to step directly into a management position, this is NOT the position for you. We require all managers, regardless of past experience, to train at an Entry Level prior to taking on management responsibilities. ________________________________________________________________________ Our Direct Customer Service Representatives work in anenvironment that is centered on being a part of a team and beingincluded in a family atmosphere. We bring together diverse individualswho have an array of expertise, skills and potential helps us createprogressive promotional event solutions for our clients. MM is looking for key individuals to provide customer service and promotional knowledge to our client base. Join a company that invests in its employees and truly wants YOU to succeed. item.title: ENTRY LEVEL Sales Account Exective - Sales Manager Trainee
item.description: Details: IMConsultants has full time ENTRY LEVEL SALES ACCOUNT EXECUTIVE positions available! We are currently accepting applications for this position to work as part of our SALES TEAM. We are seeking candidates that are outgoing, personable & comfortable working in a competitive sales environment. We promote growth from within and encourage our sales team to work together to reach client goals and improve skills. We continue to train within our company to maintain the values and integrity that have allowed us to become one of the fastest growing outsourced sales providers in our market. We are currently hiring sales representatives to work and expand our client's campaign. Job Description/Responsibilities: Sales & marketing consulting / product presentations Daily in-person interactions with clients New customer Acquisition Territory and campaign management Management of weekly marketing and sales meetings Participation in training workshops, campaign meetings & conferences as directed Contribute to a positive & energetic environment Maintain professional standards in sales & customer relationships

item.title: Project Engineer
item.description: Details: . Superior Group is looking for a Project Engineer -Catia Designer! Responsible for the design development, qualifications and documentation of electrical harnesses. Thermocouples and speed sensors. Support business development through customer problem resolution, report writing, proposal generation and presentation. communicate directly with customers. Provide engineering support to existing manufactured product through investigation, doeumentation, problem resolution and training to improve processes, reduce lead times and reduce costs. FAA-PMA or DER-Repair preparation and approval an advantage.

item.title: Senior Product Manager (Professional Services)
item.description: Details: Our client, a leading global provider of medical technology solutions is seeking a Senior Product Manager of Professional Services in their Alpharetta office. This is a full-time opportunity to become a permanent addition to this premiere client’s staff. The Managed Services organization is seeking a Director-level Product Manager of Professional Services who can independently develop, validate, manage, and execute a portfolio strategy (and corresponding practical plan) that builds and supports revenue generating offers in a Professional Services business. This includes driving actionable deliverables and measurable outcomes by aligning services to the customer’s organizational strategic plan (i.e. how we work together with the customer to help optimize their use of information technology as well as their clinical and business processes). The position includes both strategic development and the associated operational tasks necessary to drive portfolio success and manage offers through their lifecycle from idea generation, evaluation, incubation, development, deployment, growth, maturation, and discontinuation. Position Description Serve as portfolio owner and be responsible for the success of the solution from ideation to execution and throughout lifecycle. Accountable for financial objectives for the portfolio. Establish requirements to effectively manage and track to a plan of record, including total sales, revenue, churn and contribution. Identify, monitor and analyze internal (e.g. financials, movement, revenue, cost, sales) and external (e.g., industry trends, market share, competitive intelligence) performance parameters in order to reposition, enhance features as well as identify new users for the service. Defining, developing, and implementing channel strategies and integrated go-to-market strategies. Expanding the geographic footprint of the organization. Creating practical deliverables to support McKesson’s ideas and thought leadership (i.e. white papers, webinars, symposiums, etc.). Develop compelling positioning, value proposition and selling tools. Work with Marketing and Sales to develop service delivery and channel enablement plans. Prepare solution artifacts including, but not limited to: Market/business requirements, use cases, and service description. Act as foremost expert within the product management discipline and an acknowledged authority within the organization. Leading and driving Professional Services Solution development teams on time and on budget, including the effective motivation and direction of resources that do not report to him/her (i.e., leading by influence). Defining, developing and leveraging high value offers to provide both revenue pull-through and executive intimacy/relationship with targets and within accounts. Leading the Idea prioritization process (i.e. collect ideas for new offers/solutions, drive the process for selecting and prioritizing those that warrant further evaluation, create/review business cases, advise the business leadership regarding viability, level of effort, time to market, and size of opportunity for potential offers, etc.). Ensuring Sales and Delivery (and others as needed) are trained on the various Solutions as they are developed and subsequently evolve.

item.title: Title Curative Associate and Loan Closing Coordinator
item.description: Details: SetPoint Consultants is a national recruitment firm that specializes in the Title, Legal, Mortgage, Real Estate, Banking, Information Technology and Customer Service industries. We have a growing firm in Pittsburgh that is currently looking for an experienced Title Curative candidate and a Loan Closing Coordinator for an immediate start. Candidates with 2 plus years of recent title or mortgage experience are encouraged to apply. Salary is commensurate with experience. JOB DESCRIPTION: Title Curative Associate Performs clerical duties to assist in gathering information for clearing title Performs basic clerical functions to set up new files Assists in reviewing and clearing discrepancies on title Make and receive phone calls about title issues Must be able to multi-task and work many files simultaneously Mortgage Loan Closing Coordinator: Candidates must have 1-2 years of experience working with a title insurance company, mortgage company, real estate law firm or other real estate services company. Closing experience is highly preferred but we will consider candidates with other title/mortgage skill sets. If you are interested, please submit your resume today for immediate consideration. All qualified candidates will be contacted. This is an immediate need and our client is currently interviewing so do not delay. We look forward to hearing from you. If this job does not interest you why not submit your resume anyway? We are also looking for the following positions in the Pittsburgh Market- Title Closer, Title Processor, REO Closer and Title Clerks

item.title: Entry Level Openings Due to Internal Promotion
item.description: Details: Entry Level Openings Due to Internal Promotion IMConsultants is currently accepting applications from ENTRY LEVEL candidates for our MANAGEMENT IN TRAINING PROGRAM . We are outsourced by some of the largest companies in the nation to manage their sales and direct marketing campaigns. Our specialty is taking a relationship-based approach to marketing in a face to face setting with our customer base. We measure growth and success by an individual's performance. Our promotional scale is merit based. The success we have experienced in the Philadelphia region has allowed us to experience rapid growth . Our firm has expanded into the Boston and Raleigh areas in the past year. We are projecting to double our growth by the end of 2015. We are currently hiring for our Entry Level Junior Marketing Associate position to enter into our MANAGEMENT IN TRAINING PROGRAM . This is an ENTRY LEVEL position with room for upward mobility and advancement to management for the right candidate. We only promote from within our own organization and reward employees with unlimited potential for advancement. Experience in sales and marketing is not as valuable to us as a candidate’s personality traits. We provide full and paid training .

item.title: Assistant Store Manager
item.description: Details: Assistant Store Manager We are a private, fully integrated real estate company focused on developing, acquiring and managing Class A self storage facilities. We are seeking dynamic full-time and part-time Sales/Maintenance and Maintenance Only Workers to join our team. As a Sales/Maintenance Worker you must be accomplished in sales, customer service and collections as well as be self motivated, able to multi-task and posses basic computer skills. Due to job duties you must have vehicle available to you during work hours. Duties include: Perform relief management duties: Sales, Collections, Auctions, etc. Prepare units for rental by sweeping, removing trash and/or or abandoned property from the unit Maintain the parking lot and grounds by performing snow removal, landscaping, lawn mowing and removal of debris and garbage Any other minor maintenance work as required. As a Maintenance only employee you will be responsible for the general maintenance of our facilities, cleaning and general upkeep of the buildings (interior and exterior) and surrounding grounds (including parking lots). You must have a vehicle available to you during work hours. Duties include: Preparing units for rental by sweeping, removing trash and/or or abandoned property from the unit. Maintaining the parking lot and grounds by performing snow removal, landscaping, lawn mowing and removal of debris and garbage. Monitoring all work performed by outside contractors. Storage Door and Garage door repair. Replacing light bulbs Any other minor maintenance work as required. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Automotive Sales Representative

item.title: Instructional Designer (Technical)
item.description: Details: JOB SUMMARY: Designs and develops technical and non-technical training plans, instructional strategies, content, activities, goals and objectives, and evaluations for varied training needs. Works cross-functionally with subject matter experts and with team members to create the required materials on our product launches and operation of product, and may train others on the delivery of these materials. JOB REQUIREMENTS: Administers, organizes, and conducts training and educational programs connected with our products, management, customers, dealers, processes, and employees. Analyzes and evaluates organizational situations and issues to determine need for training programs. Analyzes tasks, target populations, and skills hierarchy, and prepares proposal to assist in evaluation of organizational impact and to develop training content at the appropriate levels of skills and knowledge. Segregates problems which can be addressed by training from other types of organizational concerns. Prepares detailed program specifications and implementation plans. Collaborates with subject matter experts, product managers, dealership personnel, and field service to design and develop program components including content, audio visual, and printed materials. Designs and writes training plans and programs. Facilitates training using multiple methods (i.e., instructor-led, virtual classroom, one-to-one coaching), presenting to internal and external audiences. Communicates topics effectively by properly understanding the needs of the audience and also targeting the sessions to meet its education level and skill. Communicates effectively with technical personnel and is able to write technical information in easily understood terms. May train trainers to implement programs. Designs and implements evaluation processes. Demonstrates solid project management skills, able to meet goals and deadlines of tasks in an organized fashion. Occasional travel will be required. Performs related work as assigned.
