item.title: Marketing Automation Specialist
item.description: Details: This position is responsible for supporting all stages of the email and digital marketing initiatives for our fast growth demand generation function, ensuring our engagement and nurture programs result in profitable, long-term relationships with our customers and prospects. This position requires a multi-skilled, self-sufficient person who is driven to deliver compelling email, search and database marketing campaigns that drive measurable business results. List of Essentials Functions: Collaborate with business stakeholders to define campaign objectives and goals for each company initiative, and drive each objective to completion Create and set up ad hoc, transactional, and nurture campaigns in our Marketing Automation Platform, including loading of HTML, testing dynamic content, building segments, and scheduling for deployment Manage Email Communications Calendar and proactively send out email deployment alerts to company Pull daily and weekly reports to track the overall performance of our campaigns and provide recommendations for campaign improvements Become an expert on the segmentation and dynamic capabilities of our Marketing Automation Platform, and provide recommendations on how to leverage that technology to improve the engagement and conversion of our campaigns Strategize with members of the Digital Team to optimize campaign performance to achieve traffic and revenue metrics including open and click rates, conversions, retention and incremental revenue lift Work closely with team to ensure all campaigns are delivered on time and accurately, and that all digital activity is tracked and analyzed to support ongoing optimization Coordinate and support the web operations function in ensuring all website related projects are on schedule. Majority of the time will be spent on Marketing Automation Initiatives. Approximately 20% of time will be spent on web operation projects Performs other projects, assignments or duties as assigned.

item.title: IT Technical Systems Analyst
item.description: Details: What Drives You? Career paths with opportunities to learn vital roles and skills? Meaningful work in a stable, promote-from-within organization? Professional satisfaction and helping others A workspace that is dynamic, fast, fun, and challenging? We share your drive. DriveTime is more than a company. We are team of strong, highly motivated performers committed to ensuring the success of every one of the customers and professionals we reach. If you have a real passion for continued learning and growth, are flexible enough to handle various roles, and feel compelled to do what you know is right, we have an excellent opportunity for you. Responsibilities: As a Technical Systems Analyst you will be responsible for driving the daily decisions involved in creating and improving our corporate applications. With our guidance you will be an important part of the team who will assist our developers and business analysts in their efforts to improve our end user experience. Through quality assurance, testing and end user training processes, your decisions will influence changes to the face of our applications and our organization. By listening to what the customer needs, you will assist the development teams in creating the best possible solution. Create and document reasonable workarounds for known software issues while working side-by-side with the Business Analyst to decide how to achieve the desired results. Complete and document requests for future upgrades/changes.

item.title: District Manager
item.description: Details: TMX Finance LLC and Affiliates District Manager State of California The TMX Finance family of companies ('TMX Finance') is one of the largest and fastest growing consumer specialty finance organizations in the United States. With brands that include TitleMax, TitleBucks, InstaLoan, EquityAuto Loan, TMX Credit, and AutoCash, TMX Finance provides a diversified product offering. These brands are represented nationwide and TMX Finance has aggressive plans to double in size over the next three years. The rapid growth of TMX Finance has created a wealth of career opportunities in both our stores and at our corporate offices. If you are looking for a dynamic career with significant earning potential and tremendous advancement opportunities, you've come to the right place. TMX Finance is currently seeking a highly competitive and results driven District Manager to oversee a market within the state of California, one of the newest hubs in our growing national footprint. TMX District Managers are vital members of our innovative executive team and are instrumental in driving the company's key performance indicators. This role requires individuals that demonstrate exceptional leadership in their ability to coach, develop, and motivate their teams to unparalleled financial success. Our District Managers have the opportunity to interact at every level of business in an engaging work environment by taking a hands-on approach to customer service and employee training. This role serves to lead by example, advocating proper operational execution to drive results. Additionally, this position works to collaborate with Regional and Divisional Managers and is critical in setting new precedents for determining the direction of our rapidly expanding organization. Each District Manager at TMX Finance is prepared for individual success with our field training program, incorporating firsthand management experience for six months in an existing market. Essential Functions of District Managers: Work strategically with executive management to drive revenue of assigned market Strategize and collaborate with department heads to develop and maintain annual budgets Analyze audit findings and provide training opportunities for field employees Establish and execute strategies for driving Key Performance Indicator (KPI) results Maximize team performance to achieve sales plans and goals Perform on-site visits of all stores in district to provide ongoing coaching and development Maximize the potential of each store by providing support in areas for improvement Collaborate on recruitment efforts to build a qualified team and maintain a succession plan Participate in a six month training opportunity in an established market Qualifications: Minimum of three years experience at a District Manager level or above Management of at least 8 locations with at least 10 direct reports Employee coaching and development experience required Successful financial management experience including full P & L and budgets required Proven track record of successfully growing new and existing store locations Innovative and strategic approach to increased brand awareness Bilingual English/Spanish is a plus but not required All TMX Finance entities are Equal Opportunity Employers. PI87437412

item.title: Clinical Director
item.description: Details: Compassionate Care Hospice (CCH ) is a family run company that was formed 20 years ago and now operates Hospice and Palliative Care programs in over 55 locations across the country. Our professional staff provides services in the home, in long-term care/skilled nursing and assisted living facilities and in hospitals. We seek energetic, empathetic individuals who want to make a positive change for our patients by offering competitive salaries, continuing education, and tremendous room for growth. We are currently seeking a Clinical Director for our Haines City program to cover East Polk County . Our Clinical Directors act as an intricate part of our interdisciplinary team as their primary responsibility is to coordinate and manage the team and the activities of the clinical program. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication (both written and verbal) skills as well as interpersonal and organizational skills. He/she will have some management experience, preferably in Hospice and will have at least 3 years experience in Home Care.

item.title: A/R Specialist
item.description: Details: This position is responsible for collection calls and/or correspondence in a fast paced goal oriented AR department. This position is also responsible for assisting with continual process improvements and cost effective delivery of services. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES • Works high volume customer collection calls and/or correspondence to collect overdue customer balances • Provides customer service regarding collection issues, process and recommend account adjustments, resolve client discrepancies and short payments • Monitors and maintains assigned accounts including reducing delinquency for assigned accounts • Enlists the efforts of sales and senior management when necessary to accelerate the collection process • Communicates & follows up with sales dept regarding customer accounts on a timely basis • Ensures daily, weekly and monthly reporting to direct supervisor • Prepares monthly delinquency notices, as necessary • Participates in team planning meetings • Delivers on defined operational goals and activity metrics within assigned area and ensures timely and accurate completion of work • Maintains accounts receivable balances to align with business rules and company policies • Works queue and processes workflow to ensure production and performance goals are met • Maintains customer files and makes sure that necessary documentation is received and filed • Processes claims and research past due invoices • Prepares customer statements, as necessary • Processes credit memos for assigned customers in accordance with company policy • Processes AR transactions including offsets of debits and credits, write-off, etc for approval and processing • Researches all unexplained deductions and follow-ups with the Central’s customer service department to determine if deductions are legitimate • Resolves customer invoice collection and dispute issues. Requires partnering with Sales, Customer Service and Commercial, Supply Chain and Corporate Finance and other parties to resolve all customer invoice issues and bring to closure o Monitors customer past due amounts. Contacts customers, as necessary, to work out payment arrangements or advises if orders have to be held o Work with the customer service department to determine if production orders or scheduled shipments should be held or released and when • Builds and maintains customer relationships and conducts miscellaneous customer contact (sending invoice copies, checking for credits, checking on status, sending out statements). • Performs other assigned tasks and duties necessary to support the ITC Department (Invoice to Cash).

item.title: Assistant Brand Manager
item.description: Details: Position Summary Assist business & marketing leadership with recommendations and support in the creation and management of annual marketing and business plans for identified business unit, including creation and management of marketing activity calendar, budgets, media plans, events and trade shows, and public relations activities. Responsibilities Work with college operating and website teams to maintain company web site content for identified School/College/Segment. Ensure ongoing accuracy of site information. Recommend upgrades and lead sub-teams to completion. Initiate and drive internal marketing communications to ensure accurate college content & messaging to in-house stakeholders to include, operations, academics, faculty, enrollment advisement teams, academic advisor teams and new student advisor teams in addition to other internal stakeholders as needed. Work with Public Relations team to ensure college specific messaging is accurate. Partner with Public Relations team to analyze possible college leadership opportunities and assist with overall internal strategy/message in market. Work with the Legal and Compliance teams to ensure timely review of college marketing assets. Work directly with college leadership team to promote Dean and Executive Dean within social media channels, such as Twitter, Blogging, etc. Working directly with the company's Work Force Solutions team to assist with marketing strategy to help drive business-to-business results for the college with leading corporate employers. Support and assist Brand Marketing leadership in the identification and management of key performance indicators, as identified by senior management, for individual School/College/Segment Determine current internal stakeholder's needs and assist with identifying new opportunities through internal research and dialogue from various business units. Analyze program success and ROI (return-on-investment) and incorporate insights into future program planning. Requirements & Competencies Bachelor's degree is required (in English, Communications, Marketing or related field). MBA Preferred. Minimum of 2 years marketing experience (traditional and digital) required. Ability to define a target and develop positioning, messaging, features, benefits, value propositions etc. Strong copy-writing and editing skills Ability to conduct post program analysis inclusive of return-on-investment and articulate a reason for continued or initial investment. Creative problem solving ability Comfort working in a large, matrix organization Bachelor's degree is required (in English, Communications, Marketing or related field) Minimum of 2 years marketing experience (traditional and digital) required.

The primary objective is to provide continuity of care for prenatal and postpartum clients, and their infants through home visits and other community visits.

item.title: Customs Trade Operations Supervisor
item.description: Details: JOB SUMMARY Reporting to the Client/Functional Manager, the Restricted Party Screening (RPS) Supervisor is responsible for the management of team performance as it relates to trade operations. Works in conjunction with the client manager and external parties as necessary to meet and, when appropriate, exceed client deliverables. Is also responsible for overall compliance with the regulations of various government agencies, for following the Quality Operating System and its objectives, and taking corrective action as necessary. Qualified candidates will come from the Customs Brokerage/Import Export field with Restricted Party Screening experience. KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES Obtain, analyze, and interpret international trade data, as required, such as Restricted/Denied Party lists for different global governing agencies. Secondarily, a working knowledge of the Harmonized Tariff Schedules, Code of Federal Regulations (CFR), Special Trade Programs, Commerce Control List (ECCN), Export Administration Regulations (EAR), etc. for import and/or export transactions is important. Generate metrics and internal / external reports; analyze productivity, cycle time and accuracy for continuous improvement opportunities Audit internal team and/or service providers Team with third party service providers, e.g., customs brokers, freight forwarders, etc., as necessary, to implement and/or maintain logistics processes in support of client trade operations. Work in conjunction with other business units, e.g., Product Management, Quality, Sales, and Consulting, as required. Support and adhere to the Quality Operating System and its objectives by generating metrics, root cause analysis, and corrective/preventative actions to achieve continuous improvement. Provide outstanding customer service to clients (internal and external) and partners Contribute to customer satisfaction through positive interaction with the client, responsiveness to requests, attention to schedules, and high quality work. Monitor the quality level for all aspects of individual or team projects and ensure that quality issues are properly addressed and resolved. Identify, monitor, and escalate critical issues and risk associated with client account(s) and provide corresponding mitigation plan. Assist client manager in managing business to Service Level Agreement targets and minimums and publish to client in agreed upon format on a monthly basis. Seek out opportunities to drive efficiencies within Operations. Responsible for the overall success of project(s) assigned. Ensure that all committed tasks are completed on time. Manage project and client expectations to resolve difficulties. Ability to work additional hours as necessary.

item.title: New Model Quality Engineer
item.description: Details: Responsibilities: Manages supplier’s overall part and process maturation throughout new model development timing. Reviews supplier process related to tooling and equipment including FMEA, PQCT, Operations Standards and critical control points. Provides technical support with supplier to ensure resolution of any quality and/or tooling/equipment/concerns. Assures part conformance through dimensions analysis and specification testing. Confirms that supplier is planning to correct volume and that process cycle time is achieved to support planned capacity. Assesses impact of design changes to exclusive investment. Conducts countermeasure approval for supplier related defects. Performs part approval prior to use on saleable product. Daily Tasks: Manages part and process development including: capacity analysis, design change compensation assessment, identification of critical process points and inspection methods, and verification of supplier past problem history and countermeasure activity. Experience: Minimum of three months experience related to quality assurance desired. Knowledge: Strong understanding of manufacturing processes (injection molding, extrusions, stamping, machining, assembly, welding). General understanding of process quality assurance, control charts, audits, Cp, etc. Knowledge of vehicle systems (interior/exterior trim parts, steering, suspension, braking, fuel, heating and air conditioning, audio, SRS, etc.) preferred. Required Skills: Ability to lead meetings and/or present technical reports. Ability to work in teams and achieve a common goal. Ability to manage and prioritize multiple tasks. Ability to read drawings (blueprint reading). Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Strong leadership skills. Desired Skills: Quality engineering co-op experience. Internal auditor experience. Strong leadership skills. CATIA/Enovia experience. Ability to conduct complex problem solving. Ability to use QC tools (SPC, Pareto, X-R charts, etc.). Degree: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical/Industrial Engineering or related field desired or equivalent experience required. Position Factors: Willing to travel (up to 50%) and work overtime with short notice.

item.title: RFP Proposal Coordinator/Writer
item.description: Details: Scope and Purpose ofPosition: As part of the Superior Vision RFP Response Team, thisposition is accountable for assessing RFP requirements, understanding customerneeds and developing and writing RFP question responses that are accurate, concise,responsive and strategic. A criticalcomponent of this position is the ability to work with focus and poise within afast-paced, deadline-driven environment in which close collaboration andcontinuous communication are critical. Job Function: The role is responsible for managing the RFPprocess for small and mid-market sales and generating standard RFP responses. This includes identifying prospectrequirements, working with Sales to develop customer-oriented solutions andpartnering with Underwriting to develop rates. Additional responsibilities include generating additional informationrequired to provide a customer-oriented response, e.g., geo-accessreports. Specific responsibilities include, but are notlimited to, the following: Generating standard proposals for small- to mid-size markets. Responding to prospective and existing customer requests for proposals (RFPs) while adhering to quality metrics,( e.g., accuracy, consistency, response time), and the Superior Vision style guide Understanding and incorporating sales strategy and value propositions into proposal responses Producing clear, crisp, client-focused summaries that position Superior Vision as the preferred vision benefit provider. Partnering with key stakeholders (e.g., sales, underwriting, provider relations, account management) to develop and articulate the proposed solution. Assisting in identifying process improvements and re-defining the proposal processes, including content development/capture. Tracking RFPs and responses in salesforce and producing reports on status/outcome. Managing multiple projects with an awareness of tight deadlines and working in a collaborative environment. Qualifications: A healthcare background, strong interpersonal skills,

item.title: MACY'S IS HIRING: Seasonal Retail Fitting Room Associate, Part Time - Spokane, WA - Spokane Valley
item.description: Details: Job Overview: As a Seasonal Fitting Room Associate, you will be an integral part of bringing the Magic of Macy's to life. Your individual responsibilities are critical to offering our customers the best experience when they shop in our store and include: clearing fitting room stalls, price checkers and wrap stands of merchandise, sorting merchandise and preparing it for return to the selling floor, and replacing merchandise on the correct fixture according to Macy's merchandising standards. In order to present our customers with the best holiday shopping experience, many of our Seasonal Fitting Room Associates arrive prior to store opening and remain after closing to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Holiday associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule on a temporary basis, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas. And don't forget - just in time for holiday shopping, you will receive an employee discount of up to 20% starting your first day! Essential Functions:- Check fitting room stall vestibules, sort merchandise to racks as defined by sorting process in the store - Ensure merchandise is placed on appropriate hanger with the correct size ring that matches the garment size - Ensure merchandise is floor-ready; work merchandise back to the sales floor immediately - Maintain high customer readiness standards by delivering a clean, neat, easy to shop store environment - Be available to customer service needs in a friendly and helpful manner when approached - Perform these functions in an efficient manner, and move between areas of the store, as directed by the Coordinator - Be flexible to store workload; work in other areas as assigned after floor ready duties are performed - Follows shortage programs and procedures - Regular,dependable attendance and punctuality - Perform other duties as needed Qualifications: Education/ Experience: High School degree or equivalent. Minimum 1 year previous merchandising or retail operations Experience preferred. Language Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management. Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Reasoning Ability: Self-starter, able to work independently with minimal supervision and as part of a team. Physical Demands: This position involves heavy lifting and constant moving and standing. Involves standing for at least two consecutive hours. Involves lifting at least 30 lbs. May occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, crouching, and climbing ladders. May involve reaching above eye level. Other skills: Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and adapt quickly to changing priorities and the needs of the business; Should be comfortable with the use of computers and frequent use of RF equipment. Work Hours: Flexible with scheduling and available to work retail hours, which may include day, evening, weekends, and/or holidays. This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: Truck Driver
item.description: Details: JOB SUMMARY: Responsible for being knowledgeable of the geographical area assigned and operate the vehicle within state / federal statues and/or guidelines. Perform responsibilities in the most efficient and effective manner saving time, money and complying with The Salvation Army’s policies and procedures. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: This job description should not be interpreted as all-inclusive. It is intended to identify the essential functions and requirements of this position. The incumbents may be requested to perform job-related responsibilities and tasks other than those stated in this job description. Acquire pick-up tickets and organize route in the most time efficient and fuel efficient manner. Pick up donations from the various locations. Load donations on the trucks in the most organized manner possible to enable as many pickups as possible on each truck load. Load donations in an orderly and secure manner to minimize potential damage/breakage to donated merchandise. Ability to read and speak the English language sufficiently to converse with the general public, to understand highway traffic signs and signals in the English language, to respond to official inquiries, and to make entries on reports and records. Maintain a positive work atmosphere by acting and communicating in a manner so that you get along with vendors, donors, customers, beneficiaries, co-workers and management. E mployees in this position must meet all DOT requirements for vehicles associated with this position at all times. OTHER RESPONSIBILITIES : Perform other job-related responsibilities and tasks (other than those stated in this job description) when directed by management. MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT USE: Trucks and other vehicles.

item.title: ColdFusion Developer
item.description: Details: seeking a Sr. ColdFusion Developer. Position offers competitive pay, quarterlybonuses, great benefits , career advancement, casual dress code, employeefriendly company culture, wellness program, state of the art work outfacilities, volleyball court, walking trails, on-site dining, private school andmuch more! Wewould be glad to provide you with additional detailed information about thecompany, the opportunity and the area! We are doing a full scaletransition from ColdFusion development to .Net (C# / ASP.Net / MVC). This rolewill initially consist of ColdFusion v.9 development working individually or onsmall teams. As we start the re-write of our core enterprise applications thisindividual will start learning .Net and make the gradual transition to full-timeC# / ASP.Net web development. This role does NOT require prior .Net experiencebut the individual must be willing to learn and make the transition to .Netdevelopment long-term. Though not required, prior .Net experience is highlydesired! Please Note: This position is located in Knoxville,TN. Remote work is NOT an option for this opportunity.

item.title: Business Development Manager
item.description: Details: The Translational Genomics Research Institute (TGen) is a Phoenix, Arizona-based non-profit organization dedicated to conducting groundbreaking research with life changing results. TGen is focused on helping patients with cancer, neurological disorders and diabetes, through cutting edge translational research (the process of rapidly moving research towards patient benefit). TGen physicians and scientists work to unravel the genetic components of both common and rare complex diseases in adults and children. Working with collaborators in the scientific and medical communities literally worldwide, TGen makes a substantial contribution to help our patients through efficiency and effectiveness of the translational process. For more information, visit: www.tgen.org . J ob Summary TGen is growing its business development team. We are looking for a business development professional with experience in the life sciences who is passionate about patient care. TGen is a leader in developing tools for personalized medicine. The business development manager will help match TGen’s capabilities and mission with appropriate partners, collaborators and customers. Job Duties: Identifies trendsetter ideas by researching industry and related events, publications and announcements and links potential opportunities with TGen competencies. Screens potential business deals by analyzing market strategies, deal requirements, potential, and financials; evaluating options; resolving internal priorities. Developing formal proposals including the financial components. Working with the Legal department on the creation and coordination of contracts. Meeting coordination. Participate in meetings with potential partners and internal research staff, occasionally conducting formal presentations.

item.description: Details: Business Analyst/Jr. Project Manager Opportunity in Richardson TX Kelly IT Resources Every day, Kelly IT Resources (KITR) connects IT professionals with opportunities to advance their careers. We currently have an exciting Contract to Hire opportunity for a Business Analyst/Jr. Project Manager in Richardson Texas. Apply today! item.title: Modis is seeking a Saleforce trouble shooter/Developer for s short contract in Sacramento
item.description: Details: Modis has an urgent need for a Sales force developer/ Troubleshooter for our client in Rancho Cordova, CA this is a short contract that might extend a few months and best case This job could roll into a Full time position Strong knowledge of Sales Force troubleshooting code of Sales force Able to explain and speak technically how the program needs to be repaired If you feel your a fit for this contract please apply on line to the Modis Web Site and recruiter will be calling you

item.title: Call Center Team Lead Job Jacksonville, FL
item.description: Details: Call Center Team Lead Job Jacksonville, FL A Call Center Team Lead Job in Jacksonville, FL is currently brought to you by Ajilon Professional Staffing. To be considered for this opportunity you must have call center and supervisory experience. Duties for the Call Center Team Lead Job include: • Coaching, mentoring, call monitoring with weekly call reviews • Review individual goals with each representative and give feedback/opportunities for improvement • Working over the phone with customers, answering inquiries and clarifying desired information • De-escalating and resolving problems by researching and clarifying issues Additional Qualifications: • At least one year of supervisory experience • 3-5 years of Customer Service/Call Center experience • Great communication skills • Data Entry, Listening, Phone skills required • MUST HAVE basic proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Outlook You will work for an organization that was voted top place to work in Jacksonville along with great benefits. If you are interested in this Call Center Team Lead Job in Jacksonville, FL then please click “apply” below. If you would like to review other opportunities, please visit: www.ajilon.com

item.title: Medical Director
item.description: Details: Medical Director Job Description Reports to: Executive Director Job Summary: Responsible for and is the ultimate authority for the prescribing, dispensing and administration of Methadone and Suboxone in accordance with all applicable federal and state laws and regulations. Duties & Responsibilities: Adheres to the vision and mission of the company. Prescribes and terminates all Methadone and Suboxone dosages. Supervises either directly or indirectly any physician, physician’s assistant and/or nurse practitioner. Ensures all information obtained during the course of physical examinations, laboratory results and other diagnostic evaluations are duly recorded in all patient records. Ensures all physical examinations are completed, certifying each applicant is eligible for narcotic treatment. In conjunction with the Executive Director, ensures that a 24-hour emergency contact is available. Attends treatment team meetings.

item.title: Administrative Assistant
item.description: Details: Opportunity for an Administrative Assistant with Nissan in Englewood, Colorado!! Grow your career by joining Kelly Services' Team at Nissan. Kelly Services is a full-service contract employer with locations globally. For 60 years, Kelly Services has provided outstanding employment opportunities, including temporary, direct hire, and temporary-to-hire, to the most talented individuals in the marketplace. Today, we are proud to offer a contract position for an Administrative Assistant II for Nissan in Englewood, CO. Administrative Assistant Duties including: • Limited Travel • Calendar Maintenance • Scheduling • Office Suite (Word, Excel, PPT - all at an intermediate Level) Details : Supports one or more mid to senior-level managers. Must work in a diverse and more complex environment; and includes some customer and executive contact. Performs more complex administrative activities including managing projects, composing letters and reports, preparing/editing presentations, and recommending or making purchase decisions. Possess strong written and verbal communication skills. Duties may include more complex administrative activities: coordinating projects, managing budget and payroll, composing letters and reports, developing newsletters, preparing presentations, recommending or making purchase decisions. Has intermediate to advanced computer skills including: word processing, spreadsheet, and basic presentation or database applications; and may train others. item.title: Training Lead
item.description: Details: SUMMARYDevelops and implements training and development programs for Corporation employees. Supports the design and deployment of strategic learning programs across the organization. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES1. Conducts training sessions covering specified areas such as new employee orientation, skills training, use of computers and software, health and safety practices with a strong emphasis on production skills training2. Participates in needs assessments, assists in developing appropriate training solutions, and conducts a variety of training and development programs3. Determines instructional methods such as individual training, group instruction, lectures, demonstrations, conferences, meetings, and workshops4. Identifies or develops teaching aids such as training, multimedia visual aids, computer tutorials, and reference works5. Identifies or develops appropriate course evaluation procedures6. Assist subject matter experts in design and delivery of training programs7. Develops strong relationships with business functions and support training and development efforts consistent with business objectives8. Designs and delivers training solutions in support of business goals and objectives

item.title: Accountant (non-profit)
item.description: Details: Contract position: Essential Duties and Responsibilities • Prepare and post journal entries. • Prepare and analyze account reconciliations. • Prepare reports detailing monthly expenses by cost center. • Analyze total Corporate expenses, including comparisons to forecasted results and trended results. • Assist Corporate Accounting Supervisor in preparing Corporate forecast by cost center. • Invoice other Jabil locations for intercompany charges. • Track and allocate costs associated with U.S. expatriate employees working overseas. • Ad Hoc analyses as needed. • Correspond with other Corporate departments to ensure proper accounting for purchases and expenses. • Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor. • Comply and follow all procedures within the company security policy. Other duties will be assigned.

item.title: Training Curriculum Developer
item.description: Details: Join the Leader in the Call Center Business! Trusted by leading Fortune 500 and government agency clients, Alorica is an innovator in outsourced Contact Management Solutions for both the Business-to-Business (B2B) and Business-to-Consumer (B2C) sectors. Alorica offers a wide range of call center services designed to help you create, cultivate and maintain our customer’s precious asset— their customer relationships. We are currently seeking a Training Curriculum Designer who will be responsible for the development and facilitation of all training programs. Responsibilities: • Design and deliver learning curriculum and programs that include new hire, skill enhancement training and other curriculum as assigned. • Design and develop instructor led training program and online help for call center applications • Develop and facilitate learning through a variety of delivery methods to develop participants' skill sets. Training methodologies may include classroom instruction, on-line learning, hands-on labs, peer to peer coaching, and team meeting trainings, conference calls, instructing positions more senior to their own and train the Trainer sessions. • Support training materials using company styles, standards, and development tools • Ensure that all information is consistent, easy to understand, and well organized • Observe all employees during training, manage and report issues to their manager. This includes, role modeling the core competences, skills and behaviors of a company leader, tracking attendance, reporting inappropriate behavior and documenting performance, both strengths and development needs, with manager support. • Observe training and operational environments to modify or develop curriculum that will enhance performance to the desired outcome. • Perform all administrative duties associated with developing and conducting training. This includes, conducting all pre-training prep work, administering learning schedules and calendars, and maintaining participant records (e.g., test scores, evaluations and attendance). • Will exhibit a commitment to Continuous Learning. This includes, pursuing development activities and opportunities to obtain additional expertise and strengthen core skills, building and improving job-related knowledge and leadership skills; seeking feedback from others and maintaining focus to continue the learning cycle. • Will work with the Clients, Operations, Training and Client services team to design and develop high-level instructor-led training programs and e-learn programs.

item.title: Superintendent
item.description: Details: Status: Exempt Reports To: Project Manager Secondarily Reports To: Operations Manager Primary Responsibility Responsible for the daily operations of the project, including scheduling and coordination of material, tools, equipment, safety accessories, subcontractors and TRG field personnel relative to the specific construction phase, while continually updating the Project Manager of progress, issues and problems. The Project Superintendent is responsible for implementation of contract documents and achievement of quality, schedule, and safety and budget requirements. Ensures costs, crew and use of equipment achieves project and company standards. Responsibilities Oversee each stage of project; communicate daily and weekly via phone and written report with the Project Manager in order to keep the manager apprised of progress of project and associated issues or problems that may affect progress. The method and frequency of communication will be coordinated with the Project Manager. Review contract documents and assists the Project Manager in preparing the construction schedule. Prepare three-week look ahead schedule weekly for distribution to the Project Manager, subcontractors and suppliers. Adhere to company’s purchasing procedures while ordering or receiving any needed material and equipment within delegated authority. Obtain project temporary trailer, utilities, access roads, storage facilities, fencing and other needed jobsite facilities. Identify key areas and stake property accordingly. Conduct or schedule field engineering. Install bulletin boards and post warning signs for site hazards such as gas lines, traffic access. Post emergency numbers, implement safety procedures to achieve OSHA guidelines are followed, enforce company’s safety policy, identify security issues and address (such as fences, barricades, lighting, alarms, public access, and watchman) and obtain appropriate signatures from subcontractors and suppliers. Coordinate and administer weekly safety meeting with METS Coordinator, subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel. Monitor daily costs, making adjustments as needed. Continually review contract documents for coordination issues prior to delivery of every product to site for installation. Identify items to be submitted as Request for Information to the Architect/Engineer or Owner prior to problem development at the project. Contact subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel to coordinate mobilization and continued support during respective phase of the project. Inspect the project daily for quality, production and safety. Identify items for improvement; implement changes by coordinating with appropriate individuals with respective subcontractor or supplier. Review and ensure deliveries/invoices are timely and accurate. Provide direction to Project Engineer on critical path items in order to determine priorities to maintain schedule. Communicate with local authorities on local interests as required. No contact with news reporting entities is permitted unless coordinated through CEO. Coordinate and administer weekly project meetings with Project Manager, subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel. Update “as-built” conditions or changes in contract documents and coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel for implementation. A minimum of a weekly update is required. Maintain and update production and safety logs. Monitor and schedule maintenance of equipment and tools with Material, Equipment and Tools Coordinator and Safety Manager. Ensure all certificates and final inspections have been obtained prior to project close out. Create punch list for subcontractors, suppliers and TRG personnel for completion prior to Substantial Completion. After Substantial Completion, review, identify pertinent subcontractors and verify completion of Architect’s punch list timely. Test alarm systems, return keys to owner and ensure mechanical systems are tested prior to close out. Coordinate with Project Manager to provide direction to Project Engineer for development of Close-out Documents (“As-builts”) for the project. Carry out any other assigned tasks given by the Project Manager. Monitor staffing needs, evaluate performance, and address employee relation issues as warranted for field staff.

Update “as-built” conditions or changes in contract documents and coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel for implementation. A minimum of a weekly update is required. Maintain and update production and safety logs. Monitor and schedule maintenance of equipment and tools with Material, Equipment and Tools Coordinator and Safety Manager. Ensure all certificates and final inspections have been obtained prior to project close out. Create punch list for subcontractors, suppliers and TRG personnel for completion prior to Substantial Completion. After Substantial Completion, review, identify pertinent subcontractors and verify completion of Architect’s punch list timely. Test alarm systems, return keys to owner and ensure mechanical systems are tested prior to close out. Coordinate with Project Manager to provide direction to Project Engineer for development of Close-out Documents (“As-builts”) for the project. Carry out any other assigned tasks given by the Project Manager. Monitor staffing needs, evaluate performance, and address employee relation issues as warranted for field staff.

item.title: Superintendent
item.description: Details: Status: Exempt Reports To: Project Manager Secondarily Reports To: Operations Manager Primary Responsibility Responsible for the daily operations of the project, including scheduling and coordination of material, tools, equipment, safety accessories, subcontractors and TRG field personnel relative to the specific construction phase, while continually updating the Project Manager of progress, issues and problems. The Project Superintendent is responsible for implementation of contract documents and achievement of quality, schedule, and safety and budget requirements. Ensures costs, crew and use of equipment achieves project and company standards. Responsibilities Oversee each stage of project; communicate daily and weekly via phone and written report with the Project Manager in order to keep the manager apprised of progress of project and associated issues or problems that may affect progress. The method and frequency of communication will be coordinated with the Project Manager. Review contract documents and assists the Project Manager in preparing the construction schedule. Prepare three-week look ahead schedule weekly for distribution to the Project Manager, subcontractors and suppliers. Adhere to company’s purchasing procedures while ordering or receiving any needed material and equipment within delegated authority. Obtain project temporary trailer, utilities, access roads, storage facilities, fencing and other needed jobsite facilities. Identify key areas and stake property accordingly. Conduct or schedule field engineering. Install bulletin boards and post warning signs for site hazards such as gas lines, traffic access. Post emergency numbers, implement safety procedures to achieve OSHA guidelines are followed, enforce company’s safety policy, identify security issues and address (such as fences, barricades, lighting, alarms, public access, and watchman) and obtain appropriate signatures from subcontractors and suppliers. Coordinate and administer weekly safety meeting with METS Coordinator, subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel. Monitor daily costs, making adjustments as needed. Continually review contract documents for coordination issues prior to delivery of every product to site for installation. Identify items to be submitted as Request for Information to the Architect/Engineer or Owner prior to problem development at the project. Contact subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel to coordinate mobilization and continued support during respective phase of the project. Inspect the project daily for quality, production and safety. Identify items for improvement; implement changes by coordinating with appropriate individuals with respective subcontractor or supplier. Review and ensure deliveries/invoices are timely and accurate. Provide direction to Project Engineer on critical path items in order to determine priorities to maintain schedule. Communicate with local authorities on local interests as required. No contact with news reporting entities is permitted unless coordinated through CEO. Coordinate and administer weekly project meetings with Project Manager, subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel. Update “as-built” conditions or changes in contract documents and coordinate with subcontractors, suppliers and TRG field personnel for implementation. A minimum of a weekly update is required. Maintain and update production and safety logs. Monitor and schedule maintenance of equipment and tools with Material, Equipment and Tools Coordinator and Safety Manager. Ensure all certificates and final inspections have been obtained prior to project close out. Create punch list for subcontractors, suppliers and TRG personnel for completion prior to Substantial Completion. After Substantial Completion, review, identify pertinent subcontractors and verify completion of Architect’s punch list timely. Test alarm systems, return keys to owner and ensure mechanical systems are tested prior to close out. Coordinate with Project Manager to provide direction to Project Engineer for development of Close-out Documents (“As-builts”) for the project. Carry out any other assigned tasks given by the Project Manager. Monitor staffing needs, evaluate performance, and address employee relation issues as warranted for field staff.

item.title: Development Analyst
item.description: Details: Reports to: Development Manager Secondarily Reports to: Vice President of Pre-Construction Responsibilities 1. Review identified development opportunities with Development Manager in order to determine necessary personnel to successfully complete development proposals. 2. Assist in the due diligence analysis for potential and actual development projects. 3. Track and manage specific deliverables that include, but are not limited to, relevant studies, plan compilation deadlines, financial benchmarks, permitting, closing, and assist in the ongoing project management throughout the development, construction, and asset/property management phases. 4. Assist in the preparation of development milestone schedules, cash flow forecasts, development proformas, and periodic project status reports. 5. Complete quantity take-offs from architectural and engineering plans. 6. Assist in the qualification of consultants used during pre-design and pre-construction services. 7. Participate in the coordination of the project design with in house operations and estimating teams, architects, and engineers in evaluating new and existing development opportunities. 8. Represent the organization in various public capacities. 9. Conduct data-driven research on targeted markets, competing properties, and financing sources and compile reports that accurately reflect findings. 10. Interface with both construction and permanent debt lenders on the closing, monthly funding, and refinancing of the newly completed developments. 11. Participate with Business Development Department in opening new opportunities in niche markets – locate and analyze project opportunities for growth of the company. 12. Visit and observe ongoing projects to further develop personal knowledge and offer technical assistance to the team. 13. Serve as a resource for others in the department at times to fulfill their assignments.

item.title: Project Manager
item.description: Details: Status : Exempt Reports to: Operations Manager Secondarily Reports to: Chief Operating Officer Primary Responsibility Complete the project and verify that it meets expectations with regards to quality, schedule, plans, specifications and budget. Act as the liaison between the Owner and Ross Group. Responsibilities 1. Actively manage the budget on each project and develop scenarios which enable the budget to be achieved. Determine approaches that will enable the project to be completed under budget. 2. Review the budget at least once a month to determine if variances are accurate and update estimate accordingly. Include project management team (Superintendent, Assistant Project Manager and Project Engineer) in review process to provide insight into approaches which will assist in completing the project under budget. 3. During the Pre-Bid Phase, consult with Business Development and Estimating in order to remain current on activities. If assigned project, coordinate with referenced departments to study and monitor plans thoroughly prior to submission of proposal, update estimating of design deficiencies, alternates, staffing and equipment requirements. 2. Attend Owner/Architect pre-bid, project and closeout meetings, 3. Solicit subcontractors and suppliers for proposal prior to proposal submission time. 4. Review/ negotiate contract with Owner and Operations Manager and prepare contract for Vice President to sign. 5. Submit request for surety bond(s) and insurance certificates. Submit with signed contract to Owner. 6. Prepare correspondence with Owner, Architect, Engineers, Subcontractors, Suppliers, etc. Examples of referenced correspondence include, but not confined to the following items: Schedule of Values, project schedule, memos, request for information, transmittals and submittals. 7. Submit building permit application, follow-up on review progress and receive upon approval. Submit Check Request to Finance for associated fees according to Check Request procedures. 8. During Pre-Construction meeting with Owner/Architect, establish procedures for submission of application for payment, request for information, change orders and submittals and for coordination of owner furnished equipment. Document management is to be defined and determined for routing and response. A chain of command is to be established for preconstruction, construction and closeout phases of project. 9. During Construction Phase, proactively manage project to achieve quality, schedule, budget and safety. Utilize and maintain tools: schedule and document management to track and record project performance. 10. Maintain customer (Owner, Architect, Engineer, Subcontractor, Supplier, Public Official and TRG Employees) relations and conduct project meetings. Ensure prompt payment from Owner and payment to Subcontractor and Suppliers occurs according to percentage complete timely upon receipt from Owner. 11. Document quality and progress of each Subcontractor and Suppliers. Update Subcontractors and Suppliers of any changes to the plans, specifications and/or schedule. 12. Inform management of productivity, costs, quality control, document management and processing of applications for payment. Notify management of any issues that arise which affects quality, budget, progress and safety. 13. Coordinate closeout requirements with the Architect, Owner, Subcontractors, Suppliers, Public Official, TRG Employees, TRG Management and any other relative agencies that may be involved. Tasks include, but not confined to obtaining, reviewing and submitting required certificates, insurance, operation and maintenance manuals, warranties and as-builts. Review each punchlist generated by Architect, Engineer, Subcontractor and TRG Superintendent prior to commencement and upon completion. 14. Monitor staffing needs, evaluate performance, and address employee relation issues as warranted for staff.

item.description: Details: Status : Exempt Reports to: Operations Manager Secondarily Reports to: Chief Operating Officer Primary Responsibility Complete the project and verify that it meets expectations with regards to quality, schedule, plans, specifications and budget. Maintain customer (Owner, Architect, Engineer, Subcontractor, Supplier, Public Official and TRG Employees) relations and conduct project meetings. Ensure prompt payment from Owner and payment to Subcontractor and Suppliers occurs according to percentage complete timely upon receipt from Owner. 11. Document quality and progress of each Subcontractor and Suppliers. Update Subcontractors and Suppliers of any changes to the plans, specifications and/or schedule. 12. Inform management of productivity, costs, quality control, document management and processing of applications for payment. Notify management of any issues that arise which affects quality, budget, progress and safety. 13. Coordinate closeout requirements with the Architect, Owner, Subcontractors, Suppliers, Public Official, TRG Employees, TRG Management and any other relative agencies that may be involved. Tasks include, but not confined to obtaining, reviewing and submitting required certificates, insurance, operation and maintenance manuals, warranties and as-builts. Review each punchlist generated by Architect, Engineer, Subcontractor and TRG Superintendent prior to commencement and upon completion. 14. Monitor staffing needs, evaluate performance, and address employee relation issues as warranted for staff.

item.description: Details: Status : Exempt Reports to: Operations Manager Secondarily Reports to: Chief Operating Officer Primary Responsibility Complete the project and verify that it meets expectations with regards to quality, schedule, plans, specifications and budget. item.title: Project Engineer
item.description: Details: Status: Exempt Reports to: Project Manager Secondarily Reports to: Assistant Project Manager Primary Responsibility Coordinator and generator of documentation (RFIs, Submittals, Memos, Transmittals, Purchase orders, Subcontracts, Change Orders) and associated monitoring required for scheduling delivery of materials, equipment tools and safety accessories and mobilization of subcontractors and TRG personnel for Project Superintendent. Verify submittals for accuracy, identify any discrepancies, confirm final drawings, inspect materials installed match shop drawings and contract documents and identify any changes on the “as built” drawing during closeout process. Responsibilities 1. Actively assist the Project Manager in managing the budget on each project and develop scenarios which enable the budget to be achieved. 2. During all phases of the project, responsible for studying the plans and specifications, setting up project files and maintaining all copies of plans and specifications while ensuring appropriate distribution of copies to field offices. In conjunction with other staff members, anticipate any deficiencies and take steps to correct. 3. Contact subcontractors to inform them of upcoming bids. Distribute plans, specifications and addenda to subcontractors. Ensure subcontractors have adequate certificates of insurance prior to allowing them to start project. 4. During all phases of the project, responsible for creating and tracking logs for submittals, transmittals, requests for information, shop drawings and plan distribution. 5. Confirm all materials are in compliance with drawing and specifications. Ensure all materials and equipment deliveries are on target as planned. 6. Exhibit strong communication skills by maintaining good working relationships with subcontractors, vendors, architect, engineers, other associated entities and management. 7. Prepare, submit and track all Requests for Information. 8. Administer quality control in monitoring progress to ensure that the project is following plans, specifications and approved submittals. Confirm current plans are being used on site, monitor receipt of materials received on site and work with superintendent on project safety. Administer quality control and safety program on respective project. 9. Maintain all communications with architect/engineer, keep notes on all conversations with entities involved with project, file all correspondence in project files, assist in preparation of reports and attend any meetings as required by Project Manager. 10. Responsible for all close-out procedures including O&M manuals, as-builts, warranties, keys, extra materials, etc. 11. Record and distribute meeting minutes. 12. Assist with estimating- perform quantity take-offs, review subcontract and supplier quotes for accuracy. 13. Generate work plans, safety plans, and storm water pollution prevention plans. 14. Document job site activities including pictures of progress. 15. Develop and maintain project schedules. 16. Carry out any other assigned tasks given by Project Manager, primarily and Superintendent, secondarily.

item.title: Assistant Project Manager
item.description: Details: Status : Non-Exempt Reports To: Superintendent Secondarily Reports To: Project Manager Primary Responsibility Complete the project and verify that it meets expectations with regards to quality, schedule, plans, specifications and budget. Act as the liaison between the Owner and Ross Group. Responsibilities A. Duties During Mobilization Phase Assist the Project Manager and Superintendent in arranging for utilities at the jobsite. Insure that permits are obtained. Obtain any contract documents that will be needed by the Superintendent and subcontractors. Insure all subcontractors have obtained permits. Study the plans and specifications. Prepare phone list of jobsite staff. Duties as assigned by the Project Manager. Be sure that all pertinent individuals, i.e. Owner, Architect, are aware of the project mailing address and phone number. Set up Project Managers project files. Maintain office copy of plans and specifications, update as needed. Set up submittal log. Set up proposed change log. Set up current drawing log. Obtain concrete mix design. Get approval of construction joint locations. Insure that subcontractors receive needed plans and specifications and make note on plan distribution log. Assist superintendent in setting up field office. Familiarize yourself with the AIA general conditions in the contract. Insure that permits are filed where they can be found again as needed. B. Duties During Construction Phase Material and Equipment Review submittals, as experience dictates, seek assistance from other personnel. Prepare Submittal Log. Prepare Submittal Summary Log. Maintain telephone log. Insure all equipment is being properly scheduled. Change Orders Prepare proposed change log. Obtain quotations from subcontractors on any change orders. In conjunction with the Project Manager, prepare price changes. Prepare quotation for the Owner. Prepare purchase contract quotation for Owner’s approval. Update numbers to reflect any change orders. Write subcontract change orders. Subcontracts Maintain good communication with all subcontractors. Distribute plans, specifications and addenda are distributed to subcontractors. Consult with Architect on answers to subcontractors Requests for Information. Insure you have a thorough understanding of all subcontracts. Monitor all back charges. Review submittals and submit to Architect/Engineer for approval. Prepare subcontractors change orders after receiving Owner’s approval. Insure that all subcontracts are signed and returned promptly. Plans and Specifications Set up and maintain plan distribution log. Update office copies and insure the field office receives an updated set. Prepare or assist in the preparation of “as-builts”. In conjunction with other staff members, anticipate any deficiencies and take steps to correct. Field Quality Control Monitor progress to insure that the project is following plans, specifications and “as-builts”. Insure current plans are being used on site. Monitor any material received on site. Work with Superintendent on project safety. Owner and/or Architect Prepare RFI’s and maintain RFI Log. Take thorough note of any conversations, either in person or telephone. Assist in calculating weekly labor costs, if instructed by the Project Manager. Maintain all correspondence in job files. Assist in the preparation of all reports. Attend any meetings as instructed by the Project Manager. C. Duties During Closeout Phase Insure closeout procedures are following the specifications. Assist in the preparation of all closeout documents. Turn in all keys to Owner and obtain a receipt. Insure the completion of any final subcontractor change orders. If required by specification, turn over extra materials to Owner. Insure the Owner receives brochures, manuals, etc. as required. Switch all utilities into Owners name. Give “as-builts” to Architect. Prepare a list of names and phone numbers for warranties. Box up files for storage, after warranty term expires. Assist in obtaining Certificate of Occupancy from the city.

item.title: MEP Quality Control Manager
item.description: Details: Status : Exempt Reports To : Project Manager Secondarily Reports To : Operations Manager Primary Responsibility Responsible for the daily quality control of the project, including review of all work items performed by project personnel, review all material submittals and tracking approval through use of appropriate submittal register. The QCM conducts preparatory, initial, and follow-up inspections for all features of work, provides coordination of testing services and supplemental testing required throughout the project. Perform inspections of completed and ongoing work and coordination with the Owner’s quality assurance representative to ensure all project requirements are met. The QCM continually updates the Project Manager on quality issues or problems and progress of resolution. The QCM is responsible for implementation of the requirements for quality contained in the Contract Documents and achievement of safety practices by onsite personnel and visitors. The QCM must work with the project Superintendent to coordinate all aspects of the project and incorporate the interest of all stakeholders in the project while considering the goals of Ross Group for a project as a member of the Contractor’s Quality Control staff.

item.title: Outreach Coordinator
item.description: Details: Overview The Outreach Coordinator develops, plans and implements outreach, marketing programs and strategies in sync with program standards and goals. The goals of successful outreach are to (1) increase program presence and awareness in varied customer segments targeted to achieve program participation outcomes; (2) build and strengthen relationships with community stakeholders, as well as current and prospective service recipients; and (3) increase program participation and lead efforts to augment customer satisfaction. Job Skills/Requirements JOB DUTIES 1. Ensure that successful outreach and program marketing is achieved in accordance with client key performance indicators (KPIs). 2. Develop outreach strategies to support program performance goals through the coordination of strategic program promotions and outreach activities. 3. Establish and track marketing and outreach metrics to ensure outreach strategies remain consistent with overall program goals and objectives. 4. Analyze data and trends in order to assess potential issues and provide gap stop solutions. 5. Advise internal teams on any relevant program concerns and recommend changes to current procedures based on market research and new trends. 6. Work closely with Marketing support staff to lead communication messaging strategies for overall program including Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) messaging development, collateral content development, and customer satisfaction enhancements. 7. Participate in and conduct ongoing outreach training of staff. 8. Establish community support channels; work with contractors, property management associations, clients and community stakeholders to ensure success of program. 9. Participate in the supervision of CSRs by working closely with Contact Center Supervisor to coordinate staff coverage for all outreach events. 10. Organize and coordinate outreach events from inception to completion. 11. Attend events to oversee outreach staff and solely support events as needed. 12. Interface with management and other departments to plan & meet company benchmarks. 13. Prospect potential program participants and conduct eligibility site audits. 14. Deliver weekly prospect list of all contacts made and contact details of each generated lead for single family residential and Multifamily programs. 15. Drafts and delivers client reports and communications as needed. 16. Performs related work as required. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS 1. Bachelors' degree in Public Relations, Marketing, Communications, Business or related area, or equivalent education and work experience. 2. Proven successful track record in motivated marketing and outreach efforts. 3. Proven ability to effectively plan, direct, organize and administer diverse activities to ensure effective delivery of work programs. 4. Ability to prioritize activities, meet deadlines and manage multiple tasks, from program planning to client meetings. 5. Ability to work independently, take initiative, and handle a variety of activities concurrently. 6. Ability to anticipate challenges, plan for solutions, and work within existing structures to overcome barriers. 7. Ability to work in cross-functional and matrix-managed teams. 8. Possess an innovative and open-minded approach to all aspects of work Solid project management skills. 9. Intermediate level of proficiency in Excel and other Microsoft Office Suite applications. 10. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 11. Ability to travel as needed.

item.title: Principal Data Management Specialist
item.description: Details: Why Halliburton? How about global opportunities, interesting work within small cohesive teams, extensive training, and the opportunity to take your career wherever you want it to GO, with all the support and stability of a truly global organization. With more than 72,000 employees in approximately 80 countries, Halliburton is one of the largest and most respected energy services companies in the industry. Since 1919, our customers have relied on our industry-leading technologies, scientific expertise and, most importantly, our knowledgeable and experienced professionals to help them meet the world's demand for energy. Whether you are a new graduate seeking your first job, or an experienced professional looking to make a career change, we have fantastic opportunities across our organization. Are you ready to GO? It's more than making a living. It's finding a purpose. Use your knowledge of product data management in this role of Principal Data Management Specialist. You must be able to coordinate the creation of product data management systems and manufacturing systems material data for customers at multiple locations. You must be knowledgeable about the maintenance of engineering database files, be able to resolve issues with technical team members, and be capable of making recommendations to improve and streamline work flow processes and standardization efforts. Completion of an undergraduate degree in Business Management or similar discipline is required. Minimum 8 years experience processing technical documentation associated with Manufacturing and/or Technology or 12 years of equivalent experience. APICS certification may be required. Must have a demonstrated proficiency in Manufacturing Requirements Planning (MRP), Matrix ,SAP and in computerized solutions typical of the Windows/Microsoft Office environment. Halliburton is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer & Web Portal Developer
item.description: Details: Senior Web Developer: Responsibilities This web developer, receiving prioritized requirements from the Navy Warfare Development Command Software Development Lead, works with end users to achieve robust, maintainable and effective simulation and collaboration tool. interfaces and supports the continuous improvement of the software infrastructure. The developer will be required to work with a team of developers and subject matter experts to develop, enhance, integrate, and support a web interface and collaboration tool interface, through web development and plug-in development. Primary development is done on Red Hat Linux platforms using JAVA and Web languages such as javascript. Shell scripting is used to help automate tasks and query information. GIT is the primary revision control system.

item.title: File Clerk
item.description: Details: Aerotek is currently seeking a file clerk to work with one of our clients in Washington, DC. Work consists of filing slides for a hospital center. This is a full-time position with overtime. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Nurse Epidemiologist HIV Emerging Infectious Disease
item.description: Details: Job Title: Nurse Epidemiologist HIV Emerging Infectious Disease City: Indianapolis / State: Indiana Job Description Responsible for investigation of selected emerging infectious diseases and implementation of interventions for the control and prevention of communicable diseases. Also, responsible for developing and maintaining surveillance systems, community education and provider education relative to prevention and control of infectious diseases. Serve as consultant to physicians, public health nurses, hospital infection control personnel and the general public in matters related to emerging infectious diseases, HIV and other communicable diseases. Responsible for investigation of HIV/AIDS cases in Marion County and application of control and prevention modalities. Responsibility also includes coordination, surveillance, evaluation and health education relative to prevention and control of HIV.

item.title: Facilities and IT Coordinator
item.description: Details: As our Facilities and IT Coordinator, you will be at the core of our new office’s operations. We have an incredible new space in vibrant downtown Palo Alto and are growing our team rapidly. You’ll be the go-to person to make sure everything is running smoothly with our IT and facilities. Furthermore, as we expand into new office space in 2015, you will own the entire process, from identifying the right space to coordinating the move. Facilities Set up new hires with appropriate hardware, software, and other equipment Manage installation and repair of office furnishings (desks, white boards, lighting, etc.) Coordinate future office moves IT Provide ongoing hardware and software tech support Manage purchasing and billing of technology and telecommunication services Setup for meetings and events, both internal and external Help maintain the telephony of our temporary, onsite call center Partner Management Manage ongoing relationships with our IT and facility vendors Identify new vendors and manage contract process

item.title: Business Analyst - Process Design
item.description: Details: One of our financial clients in the Charotte area is seeking an experienced Process Design Consultant (Process Business Analyst) to join their team. Excellent candidates will have extensive experience with mortgage servicing, auditing, process design/mapping, and with various Microsoft Office tools (Visio). Mortgage line-of-business experience is required. It must be within the last 5 years at a minimum. This resource will be part of a new initiative to build ILQA processes. They will build a sustainable, repeatable ILQA process and provide reporting on error rates to ensure processes are being adhered to. There will be required remediation plans and retesting as needed. DUTIES: - Design and execute test plans, the process and procedures - Perform reviews and inspections of internal processes - Record and document results and compare to expected results - Detect failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected - Generate historical analysis of test results - Document anomalies and issues - Maintain database of defects - Develop and document ILQA findings and provide reporting to Sr. Leadership - Ensure compliance processes - Deliver messaging and root cause analysis of findings in Sr. Leadership meetings. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: 1. Minimum 5 years experience supporting "critical" projects 2. Minimum 5 years of process design and improvement experience 3. Ability to work independently and in a high pace environment 4. Strong relationship building skills 5. Ability to deliver messaging and root cause analysis of findings in Sr. Leadership meetings 6. Ability to develop and document ILQA findings and provide reporting to Sr. Leadership About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Director of Education
item.description: Details: Department: Education Reportsto: COO Job Code: DOEGTSS FLSAClassification: Exempt DateModified :November 2014 Summary: This is a full time 12month position responsible for supervising the overall operation of the Education Program, includingthe Autism Support Program and Emotional Support Program, including deliveryand assessment of the curriculum, instruction and related service; on-goingsupervision and evaluation of staff performance; appropriate reporting andadherence to Department of Education regulations. item.title: Senior Buyer
item.description: Details: Noranco Inc. is a world class, integrated manufacturer and solutions provider to the international commercial and military aerospace sectors. We provide added value to our customers through a wide range of sophisticated capabilities including high precision machining and sheet metal fabrication, processing, assembly, testing and supply chain management. Job Function: Lead in the development of the Procurement Department to effectively utilize the capabilities of the ERP system to achieve customer demands. Responsible for procurement rel ated to a specific set of commodities. Requires experience with procurement/purchasing, strategic and tactical execution of day to day operations, planning, expediting, and forecasting. Individual must be able to influence cross functional groups to promote corporate strategies and daily objectives. Individual works to ensure proper Planning of product in an MRP environment. **InFor Visual 7.0 MRP Experience highly desirable** Position Summary: Work to maintain Buyer’s portion of commodities associated with MRP exception messages that supports business forecast, including establishing lead-times, purchased lot sizes, adherence to order policies, and safety stock. Maintain/create scheduling of material flow to meet production schedules and customer requirements Commodities Managed: Castings and Hardware Works with and statuses Planning to ensure supply levels are properly maintained and work orders commence on time to plan Maintains Buyer’s workbench: Ensure purchase orders are released on time Ensure supply levels match current demand (i.e.: no shortages, no excess inventory, etc.) Follow up purchase orders to ensure on time delivery from Vendor Supports the production schedule(s) Monitors material inventories and actions push out or pull in messages accordingly (focus on optimizing working capital/inventory levels) Coordinates with Planning Department changes and updated requirements for purchased goods and materials in relation to Work Orders Coordinate with other departments to achieve overall organizational inventory goals. Evaluates and recommends actions to improve on-time delivery performance from Vendors – help continually develop supplier scorecards and metrics. Responds to issues related to Customer Service, Sales and Product Management. Monitors purchasing metrics and drives continuous improvement. Identify price increases (PPV) and present to customer Execute return to vendor (RTV) transactions in coordination with Quality and Finance Completes other assigned tasks, as required by management Identifies process improvement opportunities and takes action Designs and implement actions plans to promote organizational and process growth Negotiates supplier contracts- pricing, terms and delivery
