item.description: Details: Compassionate Care Hospice (CCH ) is a family run company that was formed 20 years ago and now operates Hospice and Palliative Care programs in over 55 locations across the country. item.title: Professional Review
item.description: Details: Job is located in Orange, CA. Orange, CA office has an opening for a skilled Hospital and Surgery Workers' Comp bill review specialist. CPC required. Must have the ability to work on several concurrent tasks within the office as well as prioritize workload with minimal direction. Attention to detail and strong organizational skills are a must. The Professional Review coder provides analysis of medical services to determine appropriateness of charges on medical bills and review of medical reports to determine billing accuracy. Clinical and/or technical expertise is utilized to address the provision of medical care and to identify inappropriate billing practices and errors inclusive of, but not limited to; duplicate billing, unbundling of charges, services not rendered, mathematical and data entry errors, undocumented services, reusable instrumentation, unused services and supplies, unrelated and/or separated charges, quantity and time increment discrepancies, inconsistencies with diagnosis, treatment frequency and duration of care, DRG validation, service/treatment vs. scope of discipline, use of appropriate billing protocols, etc.

item.title: Program Manager
item.description: Details: GENERAL SUMMARY Under the direction of the Executive Director, the Program Manageroversees the Program Specialist; Staffing Supervisors and Safety Mentors aswell as all aspects of the day-to-day operations of the In-home Care Program. Thisincludes, but is not limited to: finance, budget planning, staff developmentand leadership, contract negotiations and legal compliance with all AccessingIndependence standards and Program regulations. RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Assistand direct the day-to-day management of ILS service delivery Ensure the preparation of program budgets, revisions, cost reports and financial statistics to ensure effective management of program funds. Create a plan to meet or exceed those budgeted projections. Provide leadership and guidance necessary to maximize the protection of each individual and thus creates a credible, reputable and ethical program that is expected internally and with peers. Evaluate the recommended strategic options and areas for growth. Develop plans and possess the ability to execute those plans successfully. Identify leading and lagging indicators, track and monitor the financial performance of the division and develop strategies when performance levels are off track. Meet or exceed all regulation standards. Oversee the Quality Assurance (QA) process; program audits and audit corrective action plans. Develop the necessary training and guidance which ensures compliance. Monitor the billing and collection process; insure corrective procedures have been established to minimize lost Accounts Receivable (AR) or reverse billing. Oversee fraud and abuse process. Work with other UDSF programs to create strong working relationships and harmony between departments to enhance referral opportunities. Create and oversee the mapping process to be sure effective use and efficient territories of supervisor caseloads. Train and supervise program staff (including monthly 1:1 sessions) to ensure services are provided according to agency policy and funding requirements. Conduct regularly scheduled department meetings. O versee and reinforce a dherence to agency-wide and departmental SOPs and policies. Directsthe provision of Direct Care services ensuring that services are provided toconsumers in accordance with Program Requirements. Ensure effective communication within ILS and the community. Establish the necessary rapport with providers and partners. Maintain good relationships. Maintain current familiarity with Program regulations, requirements, directives and Provider Standards. Coordinate and track consumer referral process in the Accessing Independence – ILS regions; ensure appropriate eligibility determination is made; and assign consumers to Staffing Supervisor or provider agency Review and approve personal support plans, budgets, and revisions for all service regions and SAR intake region. Manage the procedures and processes to assure that Consumers requests for services, appeals and consumers input is in accordance with program requirements. Assist with assembling exhibits and/or represent the Agency at the Department Appeals hearings and local grievance processes as needed. Oversee and monitor services to enrolled consumers to ensure consumer satisfaction with services; appropriate utilization of services; and proper use of authorized hours. Confirm that priority care and back-up plans, are in place as needed, to consumers ensuring basic service needs are met in accordance with program requirements. Act as a liaison and assure positive and productive working relationship with OLTL, community agencies, and assists with specific needs of the program in accordance with program requirements and community outreach efforts. Understands and complies with all required/mandated regulations and communicates same to other departments as to their roles and responsibilities under said regulations. 3. Maintainappropriate database; complete and prepare all related forms, documentation andreports including: Maintain consumer records as required by the Home Care Licensure . Review log notes on a monthly basis. Submit monthly invoices, mileage sheets, verified visits, accounts payable and other required documentation within the established departmental time frames. Coordinate and assist with the completion of all forms of documentation as required by the fiscal and human resources departments to ensure accurate employee information. Formulate, maintain and submit service statistics and other reports, submission as requested by supervisor and/or DPW/OLTL. Monitor and oversee tracking of authorized hours.

item.title: Sr. Systems Administrator
item.description: Details: We make IT personal. CLICK is an IT staffing solutions company where people are at the heart of every assignment. The way we see it, our job isn't done until we make the connection between rewarding careers for our candidates and successful projects for our clients. Launched in 2013 by veterans of the IT staffing industry, CLICK takes a personal approach to helping clients and candidates, making lasting connections with everyone we serve. CLICK provides staffing services on a contract, contract to hire, and direct hire basis. CLICK IT is currently seeking a Sr. Systems Administrator for a PERM position in Cincinnati, OH. JOB SUMMARY Responsible for the technical design, planning, implementation, and the highest level of performance tuning and recovery procedures for mission critical enterprise systems. Serves as a technical expert in the area of system administration for complex operating systems. Recommends the design and configuration of operating systems and system applications. Investigates and analyzes feasibility of system requirements and develops system specifications. Identifies methods, solutions, and provides project leadership and management in order to provide a high level of service to the customers of the department. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS Engineering and Projects Serve as lead technical resource for Projects to implement new or upgrade / migrate existing core systems, especially with Active Directory, storage, Linux, and Window, including: Planning of required phases, activities, and tasks. Defining scope and requirements. Performing research and product evaluations. Defining system architecture. Installing, configuring, and engineering of the desired solution. Coordinating with other technical resources such as DBA’s, Network Engineers, and Desktop Standards staff. Defining operational processes and procedures. Performing implementation and migration. Stay abreast of industry and technology best practices to ensure engineering decisions are based on mature and proven approaches. Support Projects for non-core systems such as 3rd party packaged applications, provisioning server and operating system resources per provided specifications, and establishing standard operational processes. Engineer and implement solutions to address day to day or longer term operational needs. Research and implement innovative and wherever possible automated approaches for system administration tasks. Contribute to and maintain system administration standards and operational procedures. Operations and Support Perform daily system monitoring and validation to ensure the integrity and availability of systems and processes. Respond to and address any issues that arise during and after business hours, typically in response to alerts from our monitoring systems. Repair and recover systems when needed. Communicate and coordinate with other team members and peer technical teams such as DBA’s or Network Engineers. Provide Tier III support when issues are escalated by Help Desk. Maintenance Apply OS patches and Service Packs on a regular basis, and upgrade administrative tools and utilities. Maintain operational, configuration, or other documentation / procedures. Perform periodic performance reporting to support capacity planning. Perform ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. Stays current with technological developments in systems administration technology and recommends ways for PCC to take advantage of new technology.

Automation industry knowledge required Security and/or Information Technology required Demonstrated leadership capabilities, creativity and strategic development, and a proven ability to drive results. Strong communication skills and an ability to work within a team environment also critical to achieve the business objectives. Desired Qualifications: Previous experience with product management or product development Knowledge of Rockwell Automation sales models and distribution channels MBA with emphasis in Marketing or Product Development Cisco CCNP or CCNA Security certifications Rockwell Automation is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. item.title: Warehouse Project Specialist
item.description: Details: North American is a recognized leader in distribution, marketing services, and integrated business solutions. Founded in 1919, North American has built an innovative and highly specialized business practice in helping companies improve supply systems that have grown inefficient, non-customer-centric and costly. North American is a privately held corporation which serves world-class organizations and their brands through national programs with a business-to-business focus, delivering dramatic results through programs as unique as the clients they serve. The Company operates in three segments: Commercial Group is a leader in the Jan/San distribution market, disposable supplies, personal care and hygiene systems, and packaging materials and equipment. The Commercial Group provides these products, services, and solutions to the following market vertical segments: Healthcare and Education, Hospitality and Retail, and Commercial Real Estate and Building Service Contractors. Through highly customized programs, the Group focuses on an end-to-end service and supply approach. NVISION Marketing Supply Chain Group is the marketing supply chain outsourcing division of North American. The fundamental business is building and managing all elements of marketing supply chains, including materials creation, production, inventory management and distribution, for Fortune 500 companies. Key product areas of the business include commercial and digital printing, point-of-purchase displays and customer branded merchandise. Industrial Group offers the full line of products and services sold by the Commercial Group along with full-service packaging solutions, from equipment and supplies to technical service and support, from installation and training to technical support that maintain efficiency while reducing material costs. Developing customized packaging systems to drive maximum productivity and efficiency for companies operations while reducing production downtime and material waster. The Industrial Group provides service to a rapidly growing national customer base across general manufacturing, food processing, electronics, pharmaceuticals, transportation and logistics and contract packaging markets. Position Overview: North American is currently looking for a Warehouse Project Area Specialist at our headquarters in Glenview, IL. The Warehouse Project Area Specialist will perform the monthly job costing/billing tasks required to ensure profitability for the project area. The position also supports the administrative needs of the department and any special projects required. The successful candidate’s responsibilities will include, but not be limited to : • Job cost projects by verifying hours and projects for employees and temps. • Daily access time entry, update projects, employees, and rates as needed, track labor costs via Access for billing and informational purposes. • Track and report temp hours and costs and verifying billings from agency. Track purchasing costs and overhead. • Update and print new project list in project quote and verifying no duplicate numbers, or multiple projects assigned to 1 project number. • Run monthly billing by running labor reports and adding additional administrative hours, run shipping reports and copying as necessary for invoice backup. • Create invoices for individual projects based on labor, shipping, and material costs as determined by computer reports and RFQ job descriptions, as well as quotes if applicable. • Create and maintain spreadsheets for tracking of monthly projects. Input data into monthly registers, set up, maintaining, and box Project Files. Proof, copy and enter QC info into Excel report. • Miscellaneous administrative duties and special projects to support the needs of the project area and distribution center in general. (HR Paperwork, Safety information, etc). The ideal candidate will have: • 2-3 years of administration or bookkeeping. • Excellent verbal and written communication skills. • Strong analysis and judgment skills. • Proficiency in Excel skills • Proven ability to work independently. • College degree or equivalent experience This position offers a compensation package that is competitive and commensurate with experience, consisting of an attractive base salary and a comprehensive benefits program. North American (and its subsidiaries) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that we consider all applicants for employment and employees eligible for employment without regard to race, marital status or civil union status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation and/or any other characteristic protected by law. We also provide reasonable accommodations to our applicants and employees with disabilities in order to assist them in the performance of their essential job functions.

item.title: Maintenance Technician
item.description: Details: Maintenance Technician-NewBrunswick, NJ The Community Builders, Inc. (TCB) is one of the leading nonprofitdevelopers of mixed-income housing in the United States. Our mission is tobuild and sustain strong communities where people of all incomes can achievetheir full potential. We realize our mission by developing, financing andoperating high-quality housing and implementing neighborhood self-helpinitiatives to drive economic opportunity for our residents. Since 1964, wehave constructed or preserved over 320 affordable and mixed-income housingdevelopments and secured over $2.5 billion in project financing from public andprivate sources. Today, we own or manage more than 10,000 apartments in 14states and Washington, D.C. We are headquartered in Boston with regional hubsin Chicago and Washington. Due to anticipated growth and ongoing needs, we aresearching for a Maintenance Technician to join our team. Position Description: The primary responsibilities of the Maintenance Technicianinvolve the upkeep oftheproperty in order to enhance andmaintainitscurb appeal, respondingpromptly to all assigned work orders, andensuringthat vacatedapartmentsare thoroughly restored to “market ready" conditionaccordingto the Property ManagerorMaintenance Supervisor’s timetable.TheMaintenance Technicianwill also assist the rest ofthestaff, as directed, intheir efforts to manage theproperty inan efficient manner.Maintenance Technicians are responsible for the safety forthemselves, residents, staff and visitors.They are responsible also for security of the premises andare to insure proper andsafe use of tools, equipment andmaterials. They are responsible forassigned inventory of cleaning materials, supplies,hardware, handtools, powertools, etc. Technicians must have very strongmechanicalabilities, experience performing general maintenance, must meet allphysicalrequirements and be able to take direction. Technicians may be required to cross-trainin other functions to ensure satisfactory operation of the property. Anemployee in this position must be knowledgeable and skilled in the safe use of cleaningfluids as well as other potentially hazardous materials, andbeskilled in the safe use and maintenance ofall tools normaltothe functions of this position. A ll Technicianpositions are requiredto establishandmaintain professionalrelationships with residents and staff. These are full-time forty (40) hours per week positions.TheMaintenance Technician positions are paid onan hourlybasis. These positions have on-call / after hours responsibilities for weekends, holidays and emergencies. These are Non-Exempt (eligible for overtime) positions.

item.title: Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Coordinator
item.description: Details: Environmental, Health and Safety (EHS) Coordinator Prestigious Tier 1 Automotive Supplier located in the Lansing, Mi. area has an opening for an experienced Environmental Health & Safety Coordinator. This position is a corporate level position responsible for 2 Manufacturing Plants in the Lansing, Mi. area. This is a Direct Hire-Permanent position an excellent salary and a wonderful benefits package. Industrial automotive experience is preferred. Key Areas of Responsibility (Answerable for the following end results) Establish and maintain written Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) standards. Track and audit plant level training schedules, reviews and updates annually to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and Company policies and procedures. Supports inspections by the governmental agencies and ensure timely response and closure. Oversee and audit plant level administration and completion of all Environmental Management Systems (EMS) related items and permits as required to comply with federal, state/province, and local regulations. Supports completion of compliance reports as required by each plant, e.g., Storm Water permit, SARA Title III Form R, Annual Waste Water Report, Green House Gas, etc. Ensure facilities update documents to remain current with latest governmental requirements and legislation. Participate in safety reviews and report on the development stages of current, as well as pending, manufacturing process equipment. Oversee and support plant selection of personal protective equipment (PPE) and the appropriate fit testing of said items. Establishes plant level administration of Worker’s Compensation claims and associated litigation. Monitors open WC issues with appropriate action plans. Maintain plant recordkeeping, incident rates, dart rates, etc. Compiles meaningful statistics to management in a timely manner to assist in continued improvement of workplace EHS and loss control. Participate in and monitor EHS incident investigation and analysis processes. Manage and track completion of plant level employee training on all necessary EHS programs. Establish standardized orientation and training material for all new hires in the area of EHS. Support and track plant level activities surrounding the Joint Health and Safety Committees. Develop all tracking of plant level hazardous and non-hazardous waste storage, handling, shipment and disposal. Establish standards to manage and track all plant level recycling programs. Manage any open written consent agreements with Federal, State/Province governments and associated record retention. Manage and track plant level ISO 14001 compliance. Track Corrective Action Request (CAR) reports and ensure timely closure by plant. Document all activities as required. Any additional responsibility deemed necessary by management.

item.title: Pest Control Technician
item.description: Details: Dewey Pest Control Long Beach is currently seeking a highly motivated and EXPERIENCED Licensed Pest Control Technician. Must have a Pest Applicators or Branch 2 Field Rep License. Must have experience running a pest control route and in treating for all types of pest, inspections and exclusion.. We offer full time employment, medical, dental, 401K, profit sharing, vacation, etc. We will provide you with a company truck for work purposes, gas, uniforms, cell phone and all other materials that you will need to complete your jobs during normal business hours each day. All technicians are required to continue to build their routes{sell}. You must provide your own transportation to and from work. Clean H-6 DMV and good driving record a must!! Must pass background check and drug screen! Great customer service skills needed! Must speak and read English! Must bring H-6 DMV print out to schedule interview! Interviews will be conducted Monday - Friday 9AM - 4PM

item.title: RN Treatment Nurse - Registered Nurse
item.description: Details: JOB TITLE: TREATMENT NURSE REPORTS TO: DIRECTOR OF NURSING RESPONSIBILITIES: To provide nursing care to residents as prescribed by the physician and in accordance with standards of nursing practices, regulations and directed by the Director of Nursing. To lead or direct licensed and non-professional staff in the delivery of direct Resident care and support functions. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 1. Must have working knowledge of the basic principles of infection control and wound care. 2. Must have demonstrated competence in providing wound care that is sterile and/or aseptic. 3. Must have knowledge and understanding of the special needs of the geriatric client and the geriatric client’s skin. 4. Must be free of any communicable disease and must maintain hands with clean, non-jagged nails which are of appropriate length to assure residents are cared for in a risk free manner. 5. Provides wound care (bandages, cleaning, applying medication) and assessing for appropriateness of bandage integrity during time between dressing changes. Assuring availability of treatment supplies and topical medications (as prescribed by the physician) and procuring supplies to assure adequate inventory or Treatment Cart is readily available at all times. 7. Providing gastrostomy tube feeding care, including needed bandage changes. 8. Providing colostomy and urostomy care and dressings as directed by the physician. 9. Provide weekly documentation. 10. Complies with facility guidelines for documentation and physician’s orders. 11. Relates well to patients, families and other team members. 12. Interacts well with therapists and implements individual programs as developed. 13. Maintains equipment and supplies for treatment. 14. Maintains consistent patient care schedule and is efficient in use of time. Coordinates restorative treatments with other facility departments. 15. Able to perform duties with a minimum of supervision. 16. Identifies potential problems/issues and reports to supervisor in a timely manner. 17. Maintains a professional approach with confidentiality. 18. Is supportive of facility goals and objectives. 19. Is able to use AccuNurse system to convey/receive resident information. 20. Cooperates and maintains good rapport with nursing staff, medical staff, other departments, and visitors. 21. Obtains and documents nursing history from the patient and/or significant other that is comprehensive of present condition and prior problems. 22. Performs basic assessment of the patient, indicating adequate knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and pathology. 23. Records vital signs, notes changes, and pursues more-specific investigation as needed. 24. Assesses for and notifies physician and other appropriate parties of changes in condition. 25. Uses assessment information to develop a care plan before the end of duty time that communicates enough information for incoming personnel to adequately care for the patient. 26. Uses care plans as a basis for providing safe and therapeutic care to patients. 27. Consistently follows established standards, policies, and procedures in providing nursing care. 28. Accepts accountability for clinical care of assigned patients, including supervision of nonprofessional personnel. 29. Communicates with the patient and his or her family and other members of the health care team in carrying out the goals of the care plan. 30. Performs competently those technical skills considered basic to the type of care given on that unit. 31. Responds appropriately in urgent and/or emergency situations. 32. Supports standards of nursing care through adherence to existing policies and procedures. 33. Seeks guidance when encountering nursing procedures and responsibilities that have not been mastered. 34. Promotes positive public relations with patients, residents, family members and guests 35. Uses tactful, appropriate communications in sensitive and emotional Situations. 36. Use appropriate work place behavior and adhere to dress code at all times. 37. Other duties as assigned. WORK CONDITIONS: As assigned; including some weekends, evenings and holidays. Non - Exempt Position. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Have the ability to safely perform movements such as pushing, pulling, lifting, bending, kneeling, reaching and lifting up to 50 pounds with or without reasonable accommodations.

item.title: Construction Project Manager
item.description: Details: Project Manager - Construction Do you excel at taking a construction project from estimating through on-time, quality completion? Are you interested in focusing on local/regional work that has you home most nights? Are you recognized both for your technical knowledge and your ability to work well with customers, partners and site workers? If this describes you, let’s talk. Charles C. Brandt Construction Company is seeking a seasoned Construction Project Manager to add to its team. In this role you would oversee multiple projects within the region. A typical project takes 2-6 months to complete. Because of the local and regional focus of our business, overnight work is rare. This position demands a motivated, energetic and dedicated leader who thrives on taking ownership and pride in his or her work. The duties involve being a direct liaison between clients, architects, engineers, management, support staff, field crews/activities, and subcontractors. You would supervise and delegate responsibilities to crew members, deal with all aspects of the job (from project inception to project closeout) and have the responsibility of delivering significant projects on time and within a fixed budget. Charles C. Brandt Construction Company is a dynamic, medium sized, closely held firm with over 100 years of continuous operations. Our clients recognize us for our professionalism, quality and ability to build their visions into reality. A key secret to our success is holding a team of exceptionally bright, committed employees who take personally the success of every project and the satisfaction of our clients. As a Project Manager with us, you would find challenging projects that you can have ownership over and be proud of. We would support you with competitive pay, professional operations, and unique opportunities to learn and grow.

item.title: Hospice Registered Nurse
item.description: Details: Normal 0 false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 General Purpose: Plans, organizes, directs and provides hospice care to meet the identified needs of patients/families in accordance with Interim HealthCare Hospice policies and procedures, accepted standards of nursing practice and palliative care, and applicable law and regulation. Essential Functions: • Completes an initial/comprehensive assessment of the patient/family to determine hospice needs which includes a history of current and previous illness(es), as well as a physical assessment of the patient, with emphasis on the management of pain and other symptoms. • Completes ongoing assessments of the patient's physical status and the psychosocial status of the patient/family. • Initiates and develops a plan of care in collaboration with the Interdisciplinary Group (IDG), the patient/family and the attending physician. • Makes necessary revisions to the IDG plan of care as the patient's/family's status and needs change. • Primarily responsible for the coordination of care among IDG members and other healthcare providers external to the IDG, to ensure the continuous assessment of the patient/family needs, as well as the implementation of the IDG plan of care to guide the delivery of services and achieve the goals of hospice care. • Evaluates and coordinates the need for services provided to the patient/family in accordance with the IDG plan of care. • Facilitates the consideration of another level of care (i.e. inpatient, respite, continuous care) when indicated by the patient's/family's status/needs. • Administers medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician and in accordance with nursing standards of practice. • Ensures that equipment, supplies, drugs and biologicals and other necessary items and services are available. • Provides education and interventions to support the effective management of the patient's pain and other physical symptoms as well as assesses the patient/family's response to intervention and treatment. • Provides education/instructions to the patient/family in accordance with the IDG plan of care. • Directs the services provided by and supervises the LPN/LVN, Hospice Aide, and Homemaker assigned to the patient/family. • Completes accurate and timely documentation of patient/family services provided. • Regularly attends Interdisciplinary Group meetings. • Participates in on-call duties as defined by the office on-call policy. • Actively participates in the quality assessment and performance improvement (QAPI) program. • Completes other assignments as requested and assigned. • May have access to personal health information ("PHI") necessary to fulfill the above duties and responsibilities. Access to use and ability to disclose PHI is further defined by each organization/department. st1\:*{behavior:url(#ieooui) } /* Style Definitions */ table.MsoNormalTable {mso-style-name:"Table Normal"; mso-tstyle-rowband-size:0; mso-tstyle-colband-size:0; mso-style-noshow:yes; mso-style-priority:99; mso-style-qformat:yes; mso-style-parent:""; mso-padding-alt:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; mso-para-margin:0in; mso-para-margin-bottom:.0001pt; mso-pagination:widow-orphan; font-size:10.0pt; font-family:"Times New Roman","serif";} Benefits: Locally Owned and Operated Flexible Assignments to fit your needs Competitive Salary & Benefits Paid Holidays 401K Paid Overtime Health Coverage Dental Coverage Our offices service the following cities: Kansas City, North Kansas City, Independence, Overland Park, Olathe, Lenexa Keywords: Registered Nurse, RN, Home Healthcare, Full Time Interim HealthCare is America's leading provider of home care, hospice and healthcare staffing. We offer one of the most comprehensive selections of career opportunities in the industry ranging from per diem to full-time. If you're looking for a stable career opportunity, look no further. We offer the freedom of a flexible work schedule combined with the security of working for an established company. Nationally, Interim HealthCare has been providing great jobs to great people for over 45 years and there are more than 300 offices across the country. That kind of stability combined with our commitment to integrity makes us your perfect career partner. Interim HealthCare, EOE

item.title: Home Health Aide / HHA - Full Time
item.description: Details: Essential Functions: • Assist as assigned with activities of daily living such bathing, grooming, toileting and elimination, and adequate nutritional intake. • Assist as assigned with ambulation, transfers and/or range of motion exercises. • Maintain a clean, safe and healthy client environment. • Assists client as assigned with incidental activities of daily living such as shopping, meal preparation, socialization activities, homemaking and medication reminders. • Utilizes basic infection control measures such as hand washing and personal protective equipment (PPE) appropriate to the task and assignment. • Read and record client temperature, pulse, and respiration when assigned. • Recognize and document changes in client condition and safety and report to supervisor. • Organize self to carry out visits/shifts and tasks. • Attends mandatory in-services. • Provide requested documents to keep employee file current. • Follow the assignment sheet/service plan performing only tasks that are assigned. • Document observations, activities and service provided in an accurate, complete and timely manner. Benefits: Locally Owned and Operated Free Education Courses Flexible Assignments to fit your needs Competitive Salary & Benefits Paid Holidays Paid Overtime Salary: $8.00 - $10.00 per hour Our offices service the following cities: Boise, Caldwell, Meridian, Emmet, Eagle Keywords: Home Health Aide, HHA, Full Time Interim HealthCare of Boise is America's leading provider of home care, hospice and healthcare staffing. item.description: Details: Dietitian 1 - Marshalltown Full-time position available with the WIC/Maternal Child Health Program in Marshalltown.

item.title: Industrial Painters
item.description: Details: 1) 3-5 years of paint experience 2) 1-3 years of working on cars or trucks 3) 1-3 years of prepping experience. taping parts, detailing 4) Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds 5) Must have a High school diploma or GED Painters will be working in the paint booth prepping industrial vehicles and painting them up to customer specifications. Painters will be mixing paint and applying it to large concrete boom trucks. They will be in a full paint suit and may need to wear a respirator. Painters will also assist in some assembly work and may do some paint prepping as well. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Social Media Specialist
item.description: Details: Position: Social Media Specialist Location: Tampa - St. Pete Status: Full Time Estimated Duration: Full Time Starts: Ready to Interview! Rate: Up to $30k DOE +/- for the right candidate Job Description: Our client, a technology company, is looking to hire a Social Media Specialist on a full time basis! The ideal candidate will have 2+ years of experience with social media. The Social Media Specialist will also need to have experience posting videos and pictures to all different types of social media (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, etc.). The candidate must have a bachelor's degree and can show their experience with social media. If you are readily available, apply today! If you feel you are qualified for this position please send your resume (and samples if applicable) to: View additional job opportunities at www.creativecircle.com

item.title: Auto Mechanic / Automotive Technician (ASE Sign-On Bonus!)
item.description: Details: Automotive – Motor Vehicles – Parts – Automotive Technician Bridgestone Retail Operations is currently seeking Automotive Technicians / Automotive Mechanics across the Greater Omaha Area. We are looking for Experienced Technicians – with at least two years of experience. Multiple openings and opportunities! Our Auto Technicians are eligible for excellent benefits, including: Competitive Compensation and Benefits w/ Unlimited Earning Potential ASE Certification Sign-On Bonus Available Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Prescription Drug Plan Tax-Free Flexible Spending Account Paid Vacation, Holidays, and Sick Days 401K plan with company match Continuing Education Assistance- Tuition Reimbursement Product and Service Discount for Teammates, Friends, and Family Tool Insurance Responsibilities: Automotive Technicians / Automotive Mechanics repair to specifications – brake and hydraulic systems, exhaust systems, air conditioning, steering / suspension systems, maintenance services, tires, and wheel alignment Auto Techs / Auto Mechanics adequately explain mechanical diagnoses and needed repairs to non-mechanical individuals, which may include teammates and customers on an as-required basis Continuously learn new technical information and techniques through formal training sessions in order to stay or become proficient in automotive diagnosis and repair Auto Technicians / Mechanics Keep store management aware of service area mechanical repair problems as they occur Perform vehicle inspection / courtesy checks as required following current BFRC inspection procedure manual Take your career further – apply to be an Automotive Technician on our automotive service team today!

item.title: Outside Sales Meter Specialist
item.description: Details: Position Summary The overall responsibility of this position is to sell meters, metering systems, and to aid existing salesforce in the same. In addition, the Outside Salesperson will coordinate with the Regional Sales Manager, Branch Manager and Inside Sales team to ensure a smooth transition of orders from the Bid Phase through final product deliveries. This includes managing resources and coordinating efforts of team members and customers to deliver product packages according to expectations. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Work closely with GM, Regional Sales Manager, Estimators, Branch Manager, Outside Sales and Inside Sales to ensure a smooth Bid Delivery process. Be thoroughly aware of all upcoming bids; maintain close communication on pending bids with customers, engineers and owners in addition to utilizing various Construction Data Services Through frequent municipal utility and engineering visits , develop a close personal relationship with all accounts Have a strong understanding of municipal and project specifications Have a strong understanding of metering, AMR, AMI for exclusive manufacturers as well as competitive metering products and companies Partner with vendors to visit with engineers and municipalities to be sure they understand the benefits of the products we sell Manage all bids to ensure Fortiline quotations are well organized, thorough, meet specifications and are price competitive Maintain continuing education to stay on the cutting edge of metering technology Work with meter manufacturers to secure exclusivity in any given territory Work closely with vendors to ensure we are receiving the best pricing and customer service Oversee metering sales in assigned territory Coordinate regular travel with existing sales force to train, pursue, and ultimately close projects Ensure proper and effective verbal and phone communication with customers. Acknowledgement of orders, monthly project summaries and project delivery status Respond quickly to Branch Manager on edit list issues for pricing and cost Keep order backlog and quote front log updated and accurate in Mincron Play an active role in securing quick payment on all invoices. Coordinate and respond to the Credit department on all payment issues Present a professional image at all times to customers and vendors Perform other related duties as assigned General computer skills (Outlook, Excel, Word) A working knowledge of Mincron – Bid entry, pricing and order management Able to perform takeoffs on all metering projects

item.title: General Laborer
item.description: Details: Now hiring General Laborers in the Franklin, MA area! Trillium Drivers, a leader in the staffing industry is currently seeking General Laborers in the Franklin, MA area! Candidates are needed to load and unload trailers of dairy products by hand. Hours are Monday-Saturday, 5pm-1am. If you are interested in the position and meet the qualifications below, please apply today at http://trilliumstaffing.com/jobs/job/367870-general-laborer-franklin-massachusetts.html . Trillium Staffing has been recruiting and placing professionals for over 30 years. From Fortune 100 companies to small businesses, our philosophy remains the same: to achieve excellence by providing quality employees and an uncompromising level of service. We believe in honesty, integrity, and a simple philosophy of providing value to our customers and our employees. We strive to be unsurpassed in the recruitment and placement of quality and skilled professionals. Trillium is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Business Analyst - Process Design
item.description: Details: One of our financial clients in the Charotte area is seeking an experienced Process Design Consultant (Process Business Analyst) to join their team. Excellent candidates will have extensive experience with mortgage servicing, auditing, process design/mapping, and with various Microsoft Office tools (Visio). Mortgage line-of-business experience is REQUIRED. This experience must be within the last 5 years. This resource will be part of a new initiative to build ILQA processes. They will build a sustainable, repeatable ILQA process and provide reporting on error rates to ensure processes are being adhered to. There will be required remediation plans and retesting as needed. DUTIES: - Design and execute test plans, the process and procedures - Perform reviews and inspections of internal processes - Record and document results and compare to expected results - Detect failures so that defects may be discovered and corrected - Generate historical analysis of test results - Document anomalies and issues - Maintain database of defects - Develop and document ILQA findings and provide reporting to Sr. Leadership - Ensure compliance processes - Deliver messaging and root cause analysis of findings in Sr. Leadership meetings. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: 1. Minimum 5 years experience supporting "critical" projects 2. Minimum 5 years of process design and improvement experience 3. Ability to work independently and in a high pace environment 4. Strong relationship building skills 5. Ability to deliver messaging and root cause analysis of findings in Sr. Leadership meetings 6. Ability to develop and document ILQA findings and provide reporting to Sr. Leadership About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Corporate Credit Analyst
item.description: Details: AgFirst Farm Credit Bank, a growing agricultural lender with over $27 billion in assets, is seeking a Corporate Credit Analyst. Primary responsibilities include the analysis of large and complex potential and existing AgFirst portfolio loans, and the analysis of loan actions originated by District Associations that require AgFirst approval. The analysis process includes qualitative (borrower, industry, transaction metrics, etc.) and quantitative (historical financial statements, projections, sensitivity scenarios, etc.) analyses of transactions. Also, assists AgFirst Relationship Managers and Capital Markets Officers with credit administration of the AgFirst loan portfolio (periodic credit reviews, Association assessments, counterparty analyses, etc.). Performs various duties related to monitoring risk on Bank investments. Provides support to the Lending staff and the Loan Origination and Servicing group with various aspects of closing new loan participation/syndication transactions and servicing actions on existing AgFirst portfolio loans (processing of waivers, amendments and other actions). Furnishes general analytical support to the AgFirst Lending Division.

item.title: Mid-Level Paralegal
item.description: Details: Beacon Hill Legal seeks mid-level paralegals for an opportunity with a large law firm in Washington, DC. Ideal candidates should possess not only a common core of legal knowledge, but also the following core competencies: writing skills, multi-tasking, research and investigative skills, technology/computer skills, effective communication, organizational skills, and attention to detail. Responsibilities will include: organizing and coordinating document productions, drafting legal documents, assisting with pleadings and briefs, conduct research with resources including WestLaw and Lexis Nexis, have experience with eDiscovery databases, coordinate trial set-up and logistics, and assist attorneys in trial. Trial Director experience preferred. Candidates must have a Bachelor's degree and 5-7 years of experience, preferably in commercial litigation. Company Profile: Founded by industry leaders, we deliver coordinated staffing solutions with unparalleled service, a commitment to project completion and success, and a passion for innovation, creativity and continuous improvement. Our niche brands provide direct hire, executive search, temporary staffing, contract consulting and temp/contract-to-hire solutions to emerging growth companies and the Fortune 500 across market sectors, career specialties/disciplines and industries. Learn more about Beacon Hill Staffing Group and our specialty divisions by visiting http://www.beaconhillstaffing.com/ . Find Us on Facebook! Follow BeaconHillLegal on Twitter! We look forward to working with you.

item.title: Resort Maintenance Manager
item.description: Details: Do you like working with your hands? Are you a maintenance professional looking for a dynamic and growing organization that will both challenge and reward you? Join our team at Sun Communities and embark on an exciting new opportunity! We are looking for a Resort Maintenance Manager to oversee the maintenance and upkeep of the resort grounds. OVERVIEW Resort Maintenance Managers are responsible for the overall maintenance and upkeep of resort grounds, facilities, streets, equipment and utility systems at an individual property. They supervise all aspects of new model home set-ups and ensure completion of all city permits and coding. Resort Maintenance Managers also supervise and oversee individual resort maintenance team members. JOB DUTIES Coordinates team member selection, training, scheduling and development and ensures all team members comply with appropriate policies and procedures. Oversees and assists maintenance team with all aspects of property maintenance and repairs of grounds and facilities such as lawns, clubhouses, pools, streets, curbs and gardening/landscape. Coordinates and ensures completion of routine maintenance and minor emergency repairs. Prioritizes and resolves resort service requests, including maintaining records of types and frequency of service requests received. Establishes emergency maintenance on-call schedule. Assists in move-in procedures as follows; performs resale inspection authorization, prepares commencement inventory checklist, ensures management presence at time of move-in, prepares and oversees lot modifications, supervises all contractors, and maintains exterior of model homes until sold. Maintains vehicle/equipment maintenance logs and ensures proper maintenance of resort vehicles. Performs water testing and other maintenance duties related to a well-water system or on-site water meters, if applicable. Ensures water samples are taken on a regular basis. Prepares all maintenance-related logs in accordance of the Operations Manual. Maintains inventory of equipment, tools, and supplies. Purchases supplies, equipment and services as needed while ensuring to adhere to budget guidelines. Completes regular inspections of resident sites throughout the resort. Issues resident rule reminders and violation notices, and follows-up as needed. Other duties as assigned. REQUIREMENTS High School Diploma or GED Minimum of 3 years experience with general maintenance techniques, repair work, and groundskeeping Minimum of 1 year supervisory experience Demonstrated knowledge of plumbing, electrical, construction, pool and grounds maintenance Proficient skills in operating various hand tools and power equipment Excellent organizational skills Demonstrated ability to motivate and train staff Good verbal and written communications skills Basic computer proficiency including the ability to use the Microsoft Office Suite, email, and internet Ability to respond to resort needs during non-business hours

item.title: Community Manager
item.description: Details: Are you an experienced property manager looking to take your talents in a more entrepreneurial direction? Are you looking for a dynamic and growing organization that will both challenge and reward you? We are looking for a Community Manager who has just the right balance of management and sales skills and a real knack for great customer service. You will live onsite and oversee and direct the day-to-day property management operations for one of our manufactured home communities. An equally important part of your job will be to generate new revenue through sales and leasing of our homes, which will in turn generate additional income for you. We provide you with free onsite housing and utilities, as well as a great deal of latitude and independence in how you manage your community. If you like the idea of helping to build and maintain a community in which you live, and you have the qualifications and background we’re looking for, we want to talk with you! OVERVIEW As a Community Manager, you will have responsibility for the operational aspects and the continued profitability of your community and will serve as the day-to-day point of contact for residents. You will be in charge of everything from capital improvements, administrative activities, marketing, leasing and home sales of new and pre-owned homes, to property maintenance, budgeting, human resource management and, most importantly, resident relations. Ensuring a positive atmosphere and responsive service for the members of your community will not only mean satisfied long-term residents, but also better word of mouth referrals! JOB DUTIES Ensure residents receive the highest levels of service consistent with Sun’s Customer Service philosophy Handle and resolve resident/customer service issues in a timely and professional manner Maintain properties to ensure they look their best at all times Develop a marketing strategy and maintain effective advertising to attract prospective residents to community Market model, pre-owned, and brokered homes for sale Coordinate and manage the Lease Purchase Program, including repairs, leasing, sales, refurbishments, closings, and follow-up Meet or exceed home sales and leasing budgets Manage the rent collection process, including depositing income from home sites and filing to collect on delinquent debts Oversee the eviction process for your community with the assistance of your RVP Monitor and manage monthly operating budgets and prepare monthly reports on P & L variances Oversee capital expenditure improvements Other duties and projects as assigned REQUIREMENTS As a Community Manager, you must have a strong business mindset together with the ability to place the highest priority on customer service. Strong organizational, time management and leadership skills are a vital part of your role. High school diploma or GED Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate Studies, Hospitality or Business, a plus Minimum of 2 years property management experience including 2 years of supervisory experience Prior sales and leasing experience Ability to fluently read, write and speak English and Spanish, preferred General knowledge of repair and maintenance duties Solid negotiation skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment Thorough knowledge of federal, state and local laws pertaining to fair housing and employment law Computer proficiency, including the internet and Microsoft Office Suite; experience using Yardi, preferred Flexibility to respond to community needs during non-business hours Ability to live on-site within the community (housing provided)

item.title: Payment Specialist
item.description: Details: Job Summary: As a member of the Cox Media Group (CMG) Finance Resource Center team, the position will be responsible for the timely and accurate processing of daily payments on advertising customer accounts via our internal systems for all CMG newspaper properties. The position will also require cross training in other areas of the billing, credit and collections process. Primary Job Functions Receives daily payments via lockbox, ACH, credit card processor, web based products. Processes all payment types by batching, balancing, and posting to ensure all funds are accounted for and systems balanced to funds received. Identifies any discrepancies and report to management. Processes all refunds, return checks, chargebacks and credit on accounts. Identifies and obtains the appropriate approval for all customer refunds. Reconciles any discrepancies found in the daily payment processing. Collaborates with the Business System Analyst on a daily basis to ensure balancing of the daily payment batches. Collaborates with the collections staff to ensure timely and accurate payment application. Maintains and organizes all pertinent back up information to substantiate payment postings as necessary. Provides feedback to management concerning possible problems or areas of improvement. Makes recommendations to implement improved processes. Researches payment discrepancies. Works with other departments to resolve payment issues. Ability to assist with other areas of the billing, credit and collections process as needed. Participate in process improvement projects, and support other management directives as prescribed. Specific Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies Must be self -motivated, possess excellent interpersonal skills and highest level of professional conduct. Strong customer service focus. Clear communications, both written and oral. Demonstrated ability to work in a deadline driven, team oriented environment. Demonstrated ability to effectively interact with all levels of personnel within the organization. General knowledge of billing systems and credit related functions and operations. Attention to accuracy and detail oriented. Ability to learn new systems and functions. Analytical skills and ability to recognize, research, and resolve issues. Must be a proven team player.

item.title: Social Worker (MSW, LCSW)
item.description: Details: Compassionate Care Hospice (CCH ) is a family run company that operates Hospice and Palliative Care programs in over 55 locations across the country. Our professional staff provides services in the home, in long-term care/skilled nursing and assisted living facilities and in hospitals. We seek energetic, empathetic individuals who want to make a positive change for our patients by offering competitive salaries, continuing education, and tremendous room for growth . We are currently looking for a Full Time Medical Social Worker for our Haines City program, covering East Polk County . The ideal individual will exude the compassion and empathy necessary to assist patients and families with the personal and environmental difficulties that they face on a daily basis, which could interfere with their overall care and well being. The primary responsibility will be to assess the patient’s social and emotional status in order to estimate the client’s capacity and potential to cope with living with terminal illness. He/she will assist the patient in resolving difficulties and will remain aware of potential risks of suicide and/or other potential for abuse or neglect. He/she will provide social services including short-term counseling, crisis intervention, and assistance with advanced directives. He/she will assess the caregiver’s ability to function adequately in a stressful situation. At all times, he/she will remain professional, caring, and calm during stressful situations.

item.title: Communications Program Manager
item.description: Details: Basic Purpose To supervise and administer internal and external communications strategy for the Department. To develop, implement, and evaluate change management solutions to ensure success of Department goals. Major Responsibilities: 1) Oversees communication strategies, requirements, and execution. • Applies expert knowledge of best practices, trends, standards, requirements, and developments in content distribution technologies to formulate innovative ways to support Department strategic objectives and promote continuous improvement • Ensures communications are screened and in compliance with all applicable policies, procedures, rules, regulations, Navy Federal values, etc. • Oversees the administration of content, design, and layout; approves and oversees changes/ improvements • Identifies, scopes, documents, coordinates, and implements business communications requirements in accordance with program and project goals • Oversees the execution of communications; analyzes and measures effectiveness of communications activities 2) Acts as subject matter expert and main point of contact for department/organization communications. • Provides consulting and support services to assist senior and executive management to identify and develop effective communications solutions that support business objectives • Serves as a liaison with Employee Communications and other internal communication teams to achieve communications goals • Collaborates with senior leadership on collateral duty initiatives such as, Public Relations/Social Media, Marketing/Advertising, Enhance/Expand Communications Across Network & Navy Federal Depts., Guiding & Engaging Members • Produces reports and makes presentations to senior management; provides recommendations on communication strategies 3) Develops and implements the Department change management solutions. • Serves as change management lead for Department; applies change management principles and knowledge to develop strategies including organizational assessments, stakeholder analysis and change roadmaps and plans • Evaluates and measures effectiveness of change activities • Develops, tests, and ensures implementation of new and enhanced processes 4) Performs supervisory duties. • Selects employees; sets priorities and expectations, coaches and counsels employees; prepares and conducts performance appraisals; oversees personal and professional development • Directs work, analyzes productivity and results, and resolves problems • Establishes priorities and standards for productivity, accuracy, and customer service • Develops and oversees the section’s budget; makes recommendations regarding equipment and staffing needs; monitors expenses and invoices 5) Performs other related duties as assigned. Qualifications -- Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Target: *Bachelor’s Degree in Communications, Journalism, or related field or the equivalent combination of education, training, and experience *Excellent copywriting, editing, and proofreading skills, including extensive print and online writing and editorial experience *Experience developing and executing corporate internal communication campaigns *Thorough knowledge of change management principles and practices *Strong organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills *Ability to deal tactfully with all levels of the work force and management *Ability to work in a fast-paced business environment and manage multiple projects concurrently, and meet changing requirements and priorities to accomplish goals *Strong ability to research, analyze, and organize concepts *Proficiency with graphics, database, word processing, presentation, and spreadsheet software Desired: *Knowledge of the financial services environment and Navy Federal’s operations, policies, and procedures Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 - 4:30 Equal Employment Opportunity Navy Federal Credit Union values, celebrates and enacts diversity in the workplace. EOE/AA/M/F/V/D

item.title: Intermediate Synthetic GIC Analyst 140003GT
item.description: Details: Company Description: The Transamerica companies offer a wide array of innovative financial services and products with a common purpose: to help individuals, families, and businesses build, protect and preserve their hard-earned assets. With more than a century of experience, we have built a strong reputation on solid management, sound decisions and consumer confidence. The Transamerica companies are wholly-owned subsidiaries of AEGON N.V., an international life insurance, pension, and asset management company based in The Hague, the Netherlands. AEGON has businesses in over twenty markets in the Americas, Europe and Asia serving over 40 million customers across the globe. For more information, visit http://www.transamerica.com/ . ABOUT US: With approximately $60 billion in investment balances, Stable Value Solutions (SVS) is a leading provider of synthetic GICs (Guaranteed Investment Contracts)--the core stable value product serving the pension and savings market. Our synthetic GIC clients are the investment managers of the stable value components of the 401(k) and 457 defined contribution plans and our product serves a broad range of investment alternatives in this asset class. SVS is a business unit in the Investment and Retirement (I&R) division of Transamerica, one of the world’s largest providers of life insurance, pensions and long-term savings and investment products. Check us out at http://www.transamerica.com/ . There is 1 opening in this department. Job and compensation levels depend upon a candidate’s qualifications including the extent of his/her relevant experience and other job related factors and will be determined by hiring supervisors/managers and HR. Please see below for the job description and qualifications, including prior experience, for each level. Job Summary: As a member of SVS Contract Administration team, this role will be responsible for the proper administration of a set of synthetic GIC contracts. The primary focus for this role will be on contract administration, financial and fee processes, underwriting analysis, investment guideline compliance and analysis, account maintenance and customer support. The successful candidate will work closely with other areas in SVS to ensure that contract administration activities result in the highest levels of accuracy, quality and service for our synthetic GIC customers. Responsibilities: Ensure all credit rate resets and financial transactions result in the correct book value, that all contract maintenance is correct, all fee activity is processed correctly and timely, all underwriting analysis is conducted accurately, and overall contract administration is accurate and meets the requirements specific to each synthetic GIC contract. Conduct underwriting analysis annually, or as needed to identify risks and proactively address issues with stable value funds and the plans that offer stable value funds Analyze transaction trends, portfolio data changes, and investment guideline compliance to effectively manage issues and the escalation of issues that have an effect on risk management and marketing activities. Create reporting to identify trends or exceptions that can assist in mitigating risk to the administration process. Drive the timely collection of monthly and quarterly portfolio information from investment managers including aggregate level portfolio data, cusip level holdings and investment guideline compliance information. Proactively develop and maintain good relationship management with each investment manager with a goal to ensure they understand the information provided to them and the importance of our informational needs. Maintain a strong internal business partnership with internal Risk Management, Marketing and Legal areas. Other duties as assigned based on divisional needs. Conforms with and abides by all regulations, policies, work procedures, instruction, and all safety rules. Exhibits regular, reliable, punctual and predictable attendance.

item.title: Case Worker
item.description: Details: Job Summary: The Finger Lakes Case Worker will utilize his/her professional knowledge, skills and experience to address problem issues with clients in an effort to prevent further involvement with either the child welfare or criminal justice system. The Case Worker attempts to utilize a multi-system approach, as well as case management skills, to address individual child and family issues. Ultimately, the Case Workers goal is to either: 1) prevent out of home placement from occurring (Prevention); or 2) return children home from placement and prevent future out of home placements from occurring (Reunification). Critical features of this job are described under headings below. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Performs all work tasks in a safe manner. Is guided by organizational values and Sanctuary Commitments in all interactions. Demonstrates understanding of the four dimensions of safety and can identify gaps. Treats all children, families, staff and ancillary providers with respect and courtesy. Demonstrates and models sensitivity to the cultural background of children, families and co-workers. Provides casework contact to focus on goal attainment and safety. There is a minimum of two visits per week required; one planned and one unplanned. Works with the family on assessing needs and the development of the service plan. Educate the family in needed skill areas i.e. budgeting, cleanliness, hygiene, parenting skills etc. Acts as liaison and facilitator between service providers, the family, and any other agencies i.e. School, mental health, probation, DSS. Minimum contact is every other week or two times per month. Instrumental in providing timely referrals to outside agencies to assist the family in goal attainment. Assists with the co-facilitation of monthly pro-social groups for children & families. Aides DHS with creation of the family assessment and services plans (FASP’s), responsible for progress notes and maintaining both electronic (CONNECTIONS) and physical files to include internal forms such as case opening, family demographic, client referral, and court reports. Will schedule and chair all Service Plan meetings as deemed fit by DHS. Completes progress notes in a timely manner, within 72 hours of service provision. Works together in partnership with the Family Support Specialist(s); provides assistance and guidance to the Family Support Specialist with weekly scheduling and goal assignments. Will attend all scheduled meetings and/or arrange coverage for such i.e. Court, family case conference, family case reviews, DHS reviews, all school meetings, staff meetings etc. Ensure that job-related activities will be in compliance with Glove House’ policies and procedures, OCFS/OMH, relevant professional association ethical standards and accreditation standards. Is required to safely drive on agency business, as required by job demands. Maintain accurate mileage documentation and submits in required agency timeframes. Is required to complete and maintain all mandated training within required agency timeframes and within pre-established passing grade levels. Must maintain timely compliance with all established Agency standards and provide support documents as necessary (physical/TB, driver license, auto insurance). As an employee of Glove House, Inc., one of your primary responsibilities is to protect the privacy of our clients. The Agencies commitment to privacy is based on our longstanding values as well as an array of state and federal confidentiality laws and regulations. Among these regulations are the Privacy Rule and Security Rule issued by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPPA). Collateral Functions: Contributes to in-service training through presentation and participation. Maintains information on community resources, which can be utilized during the course of treatment or to make appropriate referral(s) at the time of discharge. Participates in the process of transferring clients to other levels of treatment as deemed appropriate. Performs other responsibilities as assigned by the Supervisor.

item.title: Harris County Public Health & Environmental Services is HIRING!
item.description: Details: Harris County Public Health & Environmental Services provides public health assessment, policy development and assurance activities for the residents of Harris County, Texas. These activities represent the core functions of public health. For a majority of services, the jurisdiction of HCPHES includes the unincorporated areas of Harris County and over 30 municipalities located within the county. Together, this area represents a combined total population of approximately 2.06 million residents. In addition, for some services, such as mosquito control and refugee health screening, HCPHES’s jurisdiction includes all 4.09 million residents of Harris County, including the City of Houston. Mission Promoting a Healthy and Safe Community Preventing Illness and Injury Protecting You "HCPHES, Your Department for Life" Vision Healthy People, Healthy Communities ...a Healthy Harris County Values Excellence Compassion Flexibility Integrity Accountability Professionalism Equity HCPHES is currently hiring for the following positions: 00051 Animal Control Officer - Late Shift 00075 Built Environment Specialist - Urban Planner 00084 Nurse Practitioner 00098 Public Health Nurse Generalist - Registered Nurse (RN) 00097 Program Manager, Chronic Disease Prevention 00102 Refugee Clinic Administrator / Midlevel Provider (Nurse Practitioner / Physician Assistant) 00094 Nutrition Assistant - Bilingual 00086 Breastfeeding Assistant - Bilingual 00128 Physician, Chronic Disease Prevention 00054 Client Services Specialist - Refugee 00058 Medical Assistant - Refugee 00091 Licensed Vocational Nurse (LVN) 00056 Licensed Vocational Nurse Team Lead 00057 Senior Database Analyst / Programmer 00050 Kennel Operations Technician 00073 Kennel Supervisor 00141 Project Coordinator – Quality Management 00140 Chief, Disease Control & Medical Epidemiology

item.title: Machine Line Operator
item.description: Details: We are seeking a Machine Operator person to work a first shift. Overtime and some weekends are required.The right Line Operator and Operators will receive a dollar increase in pay after 60 days . This is pretty much entry level but you have to be mechanically inclined. You can make a career out of this. Just have to have a desire for work hard. Skills, Requirements, and Job Description: Machine operators work on our plating lines in teams of two and are responsible for checking scrap sheet hourly to assure machines are operating correctly. Check rectifiers continually for correct current and amperage, follow daily voltage settings, constantly check parts from decorative chrome to see if changes to be made Will take hourly temperatures of tanks and watch bath levels and adjust to fill. Will keep machine catwalks clear and check for floating parts. Walk catwalk and monitor machines/lines and clean machines, watch for lost parts, check eye wash stations,and clear any machine jam ups. Skills Needed: Overtime and Saturdays Mechanically inclined, ability to follow directions, team players, to help in maintenance and janitorial duties Must be shift flexible, must have high school or GED, able to lift 50 lb's, and good attendance No hats or baggy pants We have a very clean environment, Call Sarah at 216-367-0671

item.description: Details: Requirements/Business Analyst The Requirements Analyst translates business and system needs into Solution Requirements for Designers, Developers and Testers to consume and uses Requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification and management techniques for the purpose.
