They will also work with people on individual insurance plans since group insurance not available at this stage. Local candidates strongly preferred. No sponsorship available. Hitting the ground running, you will help us build a top-notch team of developers, developing a new platform to dramatically improve clinical research execution. You will be contributing to all aspects of software development, including architecture, infrastructure, testing, design, and programming. You will be crafting innovative solutions using service-oriented development, cloud-based services, and more. You will get to help craft a fun and fulfilling company and tech team culture.

item.title: Software Engineer - Storage Systems
item.description: Details: Software Engineer The Software Engineer role is a direct hire opportunity with one of our clients in Reston, VA. Candidates can be located anywhere, but the preference is Reston, VA, or Raleigh, NC. Target salary range is $120,000 - $140,000. No sponsorship available. Our client is seeking an ambitious software engineer who possesses a strong understanding of software engineering process and methodologies as well as object-oriented design and programming experience. You will work as a software development engineer within a project team responsible for the design and development. You will be monitoring applications - in this case, applications that are specifically targeted for monitoring mass storage systems. Responsibilities of the Software Engineer: Monitoring systems: We are looking for people with experience being responsible for keeping storage systems running and performing well, or for developing the management platforms and/or APIs for the managed storage devices, or for developing 3rd party management systems that manage state-of-the-art storage systems. Anyone who has used or developed various tools to measure performance and track service availability and wished they could offer ideas and improvements to those tools will get the opportunity to “do it better" here. Communicating with vendor’s equipment: HTTP, SSH, SNMP, and other protocols (e.g. SMI-S, ONTAP) are used to provide information to and from third party systems. The data can be encoded in XML, JSON, ASN.1, text, or other formats. We need people who can create efficient, scalable “dynamic applications" of our product to collect megabytes of data from thousands of systems at regular intervals. This is the place to bring ideas about using caching, threads, and other scaling methods for handling large amounts of disparate data. Vertical product knowledge: Bring with you and/or learn details about storage systems and platforms (e.g. Brocade, Dell, EMC, HP, Hitachi, IBM, NetApp) – both state-of-the-art, and leading edge. We need storage management specialists with a passion for making monitoring “right"; not just “good enough". You will attend conferences, use advanced lab equipment, speak with customers to understand their use cases, and work with product management peers to build the best monitoring solutions for storage applications in the marketplace. You will work in conjunction with other engineers in adjacent monitoring areas (e.g. vBlock and FlexPod) to ensure the relationships between storage, network, and compute are not just visible, but provide pro-active, predictive and pre-emptive information for our customers. Our customers? The IT teams of some of the most prominent Enterprises and Managed Service Providers in the industry who are charged with keeping advanced hybrid cloud-based applications running 24x7.

item.title: Data Integration Developer
item.description: Details: Position: Integration Developer Commute: Remote/Downtown Chicago Duration: Contract to Hire Start Date: ASAP Compensation: Flexible Overview: This person will be working with healthcare provider data to extract and load it into our client’s Healthcare Oracle database for analysis. The data will be used to help healthcare providers decide which direction to take patients’ treatment based on their insurance benefits and eligibility. Responsibilities: Ownership of data and providing development/production support Analyzing complex data systems and document data elements, data flow, relationships and dependencies in order to contribute to conceptual, logical and physical data models Designing, developing and maintaining database schema and objects Developing and maintaining ETL scripts to stage data from transactional system and populate cubes for multi-dimensional data analysis and reporting Developing standard/ad-hoc reports using database reporting tools and integration with SharePoint Creating technical documentation and performing knowledge transfer with team members Database performance monitoring and tuning Implementing best practices in database design and coding using SQL Working with Oracle 11G, Linux, PL/SQL, ETL

item.title: Payroll Tax Analyst
item.description: Details: Essential Job Duties: Perform all payroll tax duties in a multi-state and multi-company environment. Reconcile employee payroll tax Multi-Jurisdictional report to ensure accurate reporting of wages, taxes and W2s. Reconcile the Gross payroll to Taxable wages and Gross to Net wages on a semi-monthly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Maintain periodic, quarterly and annual reconciliation of liability transmissions to ADP. Assist management (Associate Director) with quarterly and annual payroll tax filings. Advise payroll processors on system set up for state and local taxes. Update and process state withholding, unemployment and city tax rates to ADP. Assist management (Associate Director) with state and local tax agencies to open and close tax accounts. Prepare and file non-ADP tax returns and make associated tax payments. EMST (OPT) and head tax returns. Research and respond to notices from federal, state and local taxing authorities. Research tax regulatory requirements of payroll items such as ESPP, Non-Qualified Stock, and Deferred Compensation as needed. Establish and maintain all tax records by jurisdiction and tax type. Reconcile W2s for accurate reporting of data to Federal, state and local tax agencies. Assist with system testing for SUI rate updates, new tax jurisdictions and W-2 changes. Assist management (Associate Director) of tax projects, working with internal departments and external advisors. Minimum Requirements: 5+ years of high-volume multi-state payroll tax experience and solid working knowledge of federal, state and local multi-state payroll tax regulations. CPP Preferred. Must have experience working with ADP's PCPW, EV3, EV4, Payforce or EV5 payroll system. Must have working knowledge of the Multi Jurisdictional process and taxable wage corrections within the ADP system. Must be a team player, self-starter, detail-oriented and accurate with strong organizational and analytical skills.

item.title: Regional Sales Representative
item.description: Details: The Journey Begins with you. There's quite a distance between wondering and knowing. And for patients waiting for answers to important health questions, it's a road they want to travel as quickly as possible. At Quest Diagnostics Incorporated, we understand urgency. But more than speed, we focus our energies on accuracy. Currently, we seek a Regional Sales Representative. Work Schedule: Monday - Friday Shift: Day Responsibilities Basic Purpose: The Regional Sales Representative is responsible for achieving sales growth targets in the assigned region by combining direct selling activity with strategic telesales targeting to physician practices. Duties and Responsibilities: Identify, qualify, and close new business opportunities Provide Care360 EHR demonstrations and presentations Manage time and resources effectively to meet territory sales objectives Maintain sales and account contact records and report activity to management Conduct contract negotiations with key decision makers Up-sell new solutions and services into existing Care360 customer base Work with Regional Sales Directors on opportunities that include Enterprise and Ambulatory sales Work with Sales Support team regarding changes to current client services Supervision Exercised: N/A Qualifications: Education Preferred: Bachelors Degree in Business, Marketing or related field or equivalent on the job experience Work Experience: 2-4 years healthcare information technology sales experience is required for this position (EHR, PM, or RCM is a plus) Strong computer skills are highly recommended Salesforce.com or similar CRM experience is a plus Other: Ability to work well in a fast-paced team environment Possess a high level of drive, energy and ambition Excellent interpersonal, oral and written skills Good negotiation & customer service skills Ability to handle multiple priorities simultaneously Knowledge of current information systems technology and healthcare industry trends Ability to demonstrate consistent closing techniques throughout the sales cycle Superior listening and problem resolution skills Ability to use Microsoft Office products Word, Excel, PowerPoint Ability to use Web-based presentation tools WebEx, etc. Knowledge of sales territory management (Salesforce.com) 10-20% travel required How To Apply Please Log In or Register to Upload a Resume and complete the online Application. Because of the large number of applicants to job openings, Quest Diagnostics will only contact candidates to be interviewed Closing Statement Quest Diagnostics has many career opportunities for individuals whose talent, initiative and dedication will complement our belief that the patient comes first and that values do matter. We work to earn our customers trust every day by providing the highest quality diagnostic information services in a professional, accessible and informative way. Our workforce is diverse and talented and believes in our vision: "Empowering Better Health with Diagnostic Insights." [All requirements are subject to possible modifications to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.] Quest Diagnostics is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Women / Minorities / Veterans / Disabled. *CB* - REQ# 3725023

item.title: SR Configuration Manager
item.description: Details: Modis is seeking a SR Configuration Manager for a permanent job in Sacramento Ca. This role is with an established company that has a solid hold on their market. If you are into Big data and mobile technology then this could be your long term landing spot. We are looking for a solid SR Configuration Manager with 5-7 years experience to join this dynamic team. You must come from a large corporate environment as this will be similar in culture. Qualifications: Ability to configure, maintain and troubleshoot Continuous Integration using Hudson/Jenkins on both Windows and Linux platforms. This includes everything from building CI master and node servers to running test cases and reporting build statuses. Deep understanding of SVN and preferably Subversion which includes code trunks and branches. Deep understanding of MVN or Maven. Experience with building Java based applications and deploying in various formats include WAR. Basic systems administration knowledge so that files and applications can be deployed using SCP, SSH, RDP, IIS, Tomcat 6 and Apache 2.2 on both Linux and Windows platforms. Strong understanding of building and signing Windows based applications. Understands and upholds industry standard configuration management practices and principals. Ability to troubleshoot build issues and resolve them without developer intervention. Familiarity with Artifactory, Xaramin Mobile Builds, and Atlassian administration a plus. Understands Javascript builds using NPM, Grunt, and Bower. Only qualified candidates need apply.

item.title: Network Administrator
item.description: Details: GENERAL NARRATIVE DESCRIPTION: This position performs the duties involved in computer technical support. These duties include responding to support requests via the help ticket system and performing assigned projects. Projects and requests will involve computer setup & configuration, hardware & software trouble shooting, following inventory procedures, some end user training, and communication with vendors for product research and support. This person must be organized, have knowledge of Microsoft Office/Operating Systems, VMware, Active Directory/Group Policy and comfortable learning new technology skills as required. This person will provide support to the Level 1 - Support Analysts, if needed. The Network Administrator will work with the entire company staff as well as Alura's external customers. This position is required to take part in an on-call rotation (1 week a month) and will be dispatched to customer sites to complete on-site work as needed. Some evening and weekend work may be required for special events. The candidate we are seeking is someone who can think quickly on their feet, adept at working around traditional parameters to develop solutions for our technical problems. A track record demonstrating initiative and execution are vital characteristics for any candidate pursuing this role. RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES: TECHNICAL 1. Aid customers with software and hardware problems; and resolve by email, phone or in person, to their ability while escalating as needed. 2. Diagnose and troubleshoot computer and related computer hardware/software. 3. Prepare new systems for installations. 4. Maintain a neat and organized workspace. 5. Staying current on new technologies and services within industry. 6. Monitor support ticket queue for support requests and voicemails, liaise with other technology teams to redirect tickets where applicable. 7. Perform OS and software updates as needed. 8. Answer support phone calls, work tickets and document issues via in-house CRM. 9. Perform routine maintenance on computers as needed for support issues or schedule a time for maintenance. 10. Research hardware & software product availability, as requested by management. 11. Handle multiple tickets and projects simultaneously. 12. Work as a team player that assists in all aspects of the company upon request. 13. Occasional on-site support at any of Alura's customers. 14. Report to work on time, as scheduled. 15. Contributes constructively in department meetings. 16. Use the established CRM system to monitor and track projects and technical support issues. 17. Assist in obtaining and preparing data for decision-making, planning and evaluation. 18. Maintains and assures confidentiality of data. 19. Prepares and maintains appropriate written documentation for systems, infrastructure, maintenance logs and procedures, write procedures, use knowledgebase and have good documentation process. 20. Performs other duties as assigned by the supervisor. ON-CALL 1. Respond to after-hour customer emergency calls generated by company answering service. 2. Perform after-hours maintenance as scheduled by system or other technicians. 3. Review daily backup, update and maintenance logs generated by Asset control platform. 4. Review alerts generated by customer equipment reported by Asset control platform. 5. Be part of overflow call queue during week of on-call. SUPERVISES: None EXPERIENCE: 2-5 years of directly related experience. Excellent troubleshooting skills. Good communication skills (written, oral and listening). Strong multi-tasking skills. Must have ability to work independently as well as be a team player. EDUCATIONAL BACKGROUND: Minimum of Associates Degree in Computer Science strongly preferred. Experience with office operations, network firewalls, system security, Windows Server OS and Microsoft Office products and hardware virtualization is required. PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS: 1. Ability to support by phone and in person hardware and software. 2. Provide end user technical support and troubleshooting with network attached equipment such as Smartphones, Laptops, iPads, etc. 3. Experience with MS Operating systems, Windows XP- 8 / Windows Server 2003, 2008 and 2012 4. Strong knowledge Microsoft Active Directory, Group Policy and Domain support 5. Familiar with setup and configuration of Sonicwall, ZyXel Firewalls and Cisco Switches 6. Strong understanding of hardware virtualization techniques via use of VMware 7. Comfortable calling Vendors 8. Comfortable calling external Tech Support and escalating issues if needed 9. Ability to work effectively with a wide variety of individuals and groups 10. Ability to work independently 11. Good skills with keyboard typing and mouse usage 12. Good, clear verbal communication skills 13. Good problem solving skills 14. Good organizational skills 15. Reliable and Dependable PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee is also occasionally required to lift and carry materials up to 50 pounds in weight. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Revenue Cycle Specialist
item.description: Details: At Heart to Heart Hospice, we provide "Compassion and Care, From Our Hearts to Yours". Our employees enhance the lives of patients with life-limiting illnesses and their loved ones, during a time when compassionate care is needed the most. They say "Home is Where the Heart is" and we want you to find your career home with Heart to Heart. We are dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our patients and their families, and we offer individuals the opportunity to be associated with a caring staff and organization, while creating positive contributions in their community. At our Home Office location in Plano, TX, we are looking for a Revenue Cycle Specialist. What You Will Do: Process and submit billing for Medicaid, Medicare and private insurance services Maintain an organized system for tracking billed and paid claims Work quickly to resolve issues related to denied claims Effectively communicate with multiple sites to ensure that proper documents are in place prior to billing Develop working relationships with site level and other billing team members to ensure that billing is completed timely and effectively Resolve credit balance accounts as needed Analyze and correct accounts receivable Post payments/adjustments to individual accounts Retrieve and process information from HIQA, private insurance companies and State agencies Requirements: High School Diploma, College or Associate Degree a plus Two (2) to Three (3) years experience in billing, working knowledge of hospice and Long Term Care room and board billing a plus Familiar with Medicare and Medicaid Billing Must be detail oriented, excellent communication skills, ability to work independently and in a team environment Hospice and/or experience with Allscripts a plus Full Time Employee Benefits At Heart to Heart Hospice, we offer the opportunity for you to join a caring company that believes in the importance of supporting our team members so that they are free to provide exceptional compassion and care to our patients. Heart to Heart Hospice offers a leading employment package that includes competitive pay, flexible positions and comprehensive benefit offerings including medical, dental, vision, short and long term insurance, PTO, paid holidays, 401(k) with matching, tuition assistance, continuing education, company cars to qualified individuals and much more. It is this Agency’s policy to provide equal employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, religion, military status, gender preference, sex, marital status, national origin or disability.

item.title: Speech Language Pathologist
item.description: Details: Do you have a passion for helping seniors improve their quality of life? Volunteers of America is looking for an experienced full-time Speech Language Pathologist to join our team! Located just minutes from the beautiful San Juan Mountains, Western Colorado provides hiking, skiing, boating and other exciting recreational opportunities! The SLP provides ongoing therapy to residents in a timely manner per physician’s orders, communicates progress within the facility of resident progress, evaluates and treats patients, communicates with families, physicians and other health team members and maintains appropriate documentation of services including MDS responsibilities complying with State and Federal regulations. QUALIFICATIONS: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Minimum of a Master’s Degree in Speech Pathology, with Certificate of Clinical Competence (CCC), or the equivalent of minimum of one year experience working with adults with disorders of neurological origin, including language comprehension, expression, cognition, articulation, voice, fluency, swallowing, and hearing. The candidate must also have the ability to function independently within the department. Valid license in Speech Pathology in the state (where applicable) or actively accumulating the supervisory experience required for license. Registration with the Department of Health or eligible. Member of Speech Language Hearing Association. Auditorily and visually integrate and synthesize large amounts of information, (i.e., in-service, evaluations, and therapy tasks). Excellent written and interpersonal communication. Read, write, and interpret professional evaluation materials to maintain knowledge in the field, prepare in-services, administer testing and make clinical judgments. Ability to independently reason and solve problems related to self, residents, and others. Handle stress from caseload who may be frustrated with self or frustrating to work with. Good ability to take complex direction and organize self, schedules, etc. Everyday math skills. Interested in geriatric rehabilitation. Able to utilize computers, Servox, augmentative devices and other electronic devices for tasks such as timekeeping, in-servicing and documentation. EOE M/F/Vets/Disabled

item.title: Service Assurance Engineer
item.description: Details: Xerox is the world's leading enterprise for business process and document management. Its services, technology, and expertise enable workplaces - from small businesses to large global enterprises - to simplify the way work gets done so they operate more effectively and focus more on what matters most: their real business. Xerox offers business process outsourcing and IT outsourcing services, including data processing, healthcare solutions, HR benefits management, finance support, transportation solutions, and customer relationship management services for commercial and government organizations worldwide. The company also provides extensive leading-edge document technology, services, software and genuine Xerox supplies for graphic communication and office printing environments of any size. Xerox serves clients in more than 160 countries. For more information, visit www.xerox.com, www.news.xerox.com, www.realbusiness.com or www.xerox.com/businessservices . Xerox operates a state of the art Managed Services business that provides converged data center network services to enterprise customers around the world.The ideal candidate will have solid technical skills with a technical networking background as well as project management experience. Essential to the position are good customer communication skills and an aptitude for dealing with the urgencies associated with very fluid project requirements. In addition, team leadership and mentoring skills are also required during internal and external customer escalations. The candidate will require process improvement skills.These are essential for feeding back into the organization for the overall reduction of escalations and increased project success. Requirements This position requires the ability to switch priorities quickly and to multitask across several customer escalations. Manage critical and high impact project for customers, and ensure no breakdowns in communication or aspects of the project and ensure ownership of issues until resolved completely. Be experienced in coaching employees to have difficult conversations, focusing on goals and solutions. An ability to maintain an even keel in the face of adverse emotions is paramount. Coordinate with project stakeholders both internal and external where appropriate on incidents and ensure appropriate resources, action plans and communications have been engaged, created, and/or properly scoped. Drive post-mortem process on critical/escalated issues including coordination of conference calls, scheduling of relevant parties for input, and follow-up with all parties with specific actions. Drive post-mortem resolution improvements with development organization for overall quality improvements. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English including the ability to formulate issues and recommendations clearly and communicate them plainly and directly with stakeholders at all levels; experience communicating to executive levels strongly preferred. Service Delivery Requirements Monitor and track escalations within the engineering team and provide analysis of trends and recommendations for changes in process and execution to gain improvements. Provide input to leadership and engineering team on opportunities to improve engineering knowledge and capabilities. Work with team to broaden and develop crisis management techniques and communication skills to include the ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences. Proven ability to handle difficult and sensitive situations involving the most critical and emotionally charged escalations. Preferred Qualifications Position is located in Celebration, FL - remote employees cannot be considered. Experience working directly with project engineering and project management skills preferred. Strong experience in process re-engineering, consensus building across diverse groups and change management. Technical support background and specific Escalation Engineer experiencing strongly preferred. A bachelor’s degree in a related engineering field and minimum 5yrs experience is required. If you meet the requirements of this position and want to work for a world-class company with a great marketplace reputation, apply today. Xerox Business Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by Federal or State law or local ordinance. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with Xerox Business Services, LLC may request such accommodation(s) by sending an e-mail to . #B1 #B2 #B3

item.title: Program Manager
item.description: Details: Paladin Consulting is currently hiring a Program Manager to join our team working onsite at our client's office located in Reston, VA. We work with companies that offer environments for our employees to contribute, learn, and advance their career. We understand what is important to you and work to help you accomplish your career goals. Paladin offers excellent and affordable benefits and a team that works for you. We treat our consulting professionals like they are part of the family. Job Title: Program Manager Work Location: Reston, VA Length of Position: 3 month contract to hire Education Requirements: Bachelors of Science degree or higher in a related discipline Restriction: Due to government contract US Citizenship is required Job Description: The Program Manager is responsible for the overall success of a specific Federal IT program. The Program Manager is responsible for three key areas: Service Delivery, to include successful execution of all active taskings in a financially responsible manner per our financial plan, corporate goals, and objectives; Customer Relationship Management, to include successfully building and managing key customer relationships at the senior and executive levels within the Agency, ultimately resulting in the client being recognized as a trusted business advisor by the client and key decision makers; and, supporting new Business Development, to include identifying, positioning, pursuing new opportunities and growing the business. The Program Manager will oversee the design, development, engineering, and migration of applications to a Federal Cloud Computing environment. The Program Manager will manage the delivery of project schedule, be the point for customer, and maintain responsibility for sub-contractor activity and performance. The Program Manager will forecast, plan, implement and review financial and personnel resources in order to meet defined business requirements in line with company strategic plans, targets and objectives. The Program Manager will oversee and document program risk and implement mitigation and contingency plans. Skills Required: Extensive program management experience, preferably within the Federal Government, including lifecycle experience starting and leading customer engagements, program and business operations, resourcing, scheduling, vendor and service provider involvement, and information sharing. Minimum 15 years' experience in the IT industry with significant experience managing large program delivery ($50M or above) Demonstrated track record of successful P/L management (minimum $10M/year revenue) and positive growth Excellent management skills, including experience with large federal IT programs Demonstrated experience as a leader of IT infrastructure modernization and support projects Experience with cloud infrastructures and cloud-based service delivery (Infrastructure/Platform/Software- as a Service) Relevant certifications in Project Management Professional (PMP) or IT Services Management (ITIL v3 Foundation certification) Working knowledge of IT infrastructure (server, storage, network, security) operations Working knowledge of cloud brokerage services and industry-leading cloud providers such as AWS, Google, Virtustream, and Microsoft Azure Strong interpersonal skills with the demonstrated ability to gain the confidence, respect and trust of senior executives in Government Search our jobs Click Here Join our Talent Network Click Here Why Join Our Talent Network? Joining our Talent Network will enhance your job search and application process. Whether you choose to apply or just leave your information, we look forward to staying connected with you. Receive alerts with new job opportunities that match your interests Receive relevant communications and updates from our organization Share job opportunities with family and friends through Social Media or email Paladin is an EEOC employer. We drug test and background check!

No sponsorship or C2C arrangements available. As a member of our development team with unique problem-solving capabilities, exceptional communication skills, and a passion for quality, you have the talent and experience to lead and create innovative products that change people’s lives. If this sounds like you, we encourage you to keep reading! Responsibilities of the Mobile QA Engineer: Apply QA principles and methodology to define test approaches and test plans, expanding our current test cases and executing required tests Execute functionality, compatibility, integration and regression testing for both mobile and web applications Set up testing environments with re-usable test cases Work closely with Customer Support team and dev team to reproduce bugs and resolve issues Champion on-going process improvement efforts to ensure test planning, execution and reporting is effective and efficient

item.title: Cloud Software Engineer
item.description: Details: Software Engineer The Software Engineer role is a direct hire opportunity with one of our clients in Reston, VA. Target salary range is $120,000 - $140,000. Can be located anywhere in the US, with a preference for Reston, VA, or Raleigh, NC. No sponsorship available. This role will be developing the APIs to enable companies to monitor various cloud technologies (public and private) including AWS, Google Computer, CloudStack, OpenStack, vCloud Hybrid Service, Azure, etc. The project team consists of product managers, architects, software engineers, and QA engineers working in a fast-paced environment to keep ahead of the growth in public cloud offerings. You'll get the opportunity to be an owner and thought leader in your project and field by pushing the envelope developing leading edge monitoring technology. We are seeking an ambitious software engineer who possesses a strong understanding of software engineering process and methodologies as well as object-oriented design and programming experience. Responsibilities of the Software Engineer: You will determine the optimum mechanisms and protocols to communicate with various cloud services via de facto and industry standard protocols (e.g. AWS API). We need people who can create efficient, scalable "dynamic applications" of our product to collect megabytes of data from thousands of systems at regular intervals. This is the place to bring ideas about using caching, threads, and other scaling methods for handling large amounts of disparate data, and determining the "right" from the "good." You will attend conferences, use advanced lab equipment, speak with customers to understand their use cases, and work with product management peers to build the best monitoring solutions for storage applications in the marketplace. You will work in conjunction with other engineers in adjacent monitoring areas to ensure the relationships between all the components that make up today's hybrid cloud are not just visible, but provide pro-active, predictive and pre-emptive information for our customers.

item.title: Regional Sales Manager
item.description: Details: Regional Sales Manager The Regional Sales Manager role is a direct hire opportunity with one of our clients in Charlotte, NC. A Regional Sales Manager covers a specific region within a specific sector in the US. There are two positions available, one for the Northern region and one for the Eastern. Target base salary range is up to $50,000 with a total compensation plan of up to $100,000. Local candidates strongly preferred. No sponsorship available. Regional Sales Managers are expected to achieve at a minimum 100% of target by the end of each quarter, and realistically achieve 120% of annual target to achieve commission bonuses. Build rapport and work directly with the Reseller network to assist pipeline and opportunities created by working on opportunities and delivering sales training where needed. Various KPI’s have been set for the role which include webinars, on-site visits, opportunities created and opportunities converted to evaluations. The role itself is both internal and external with the ability to conduct on-site and face to face meetings. Pipeline building is assisted by a Sales Support Executive who is assigned to generate leads within a specific region to the value of three times your annual revenue target. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for accurate forecasting to their line manager and keeping all CRM elements up to date on a daily basis. A monthly sales analysis report will be provided to their line manager outlining activity in their specific region. As a region owner you will attend national trade shows and exhibitions in order to secure leads and meetings and provide ROI reports after each event. Training opportunities will also be made available to all RSMs. Interact in a positive manner, work as a team and clearly communicate with other departments within the business at all times. Responsibilities of the Regional Sales Manager: Stay up-to-date on the Company’s products and services, the market/industry and any customer developments through regular networking, reading and research, in order to become a source of expertise within the sales team and the business and to provide market direction Share knowledge and best practice ideas with the wider team and company Develop strong working relationships with internal departments Ensure monthly, quarterly and annual sales targets are achieved Ensure daily, weekly and monthly KPI’s are achieved consistently Build and maintain a healthy pipeline of three times your annual target with assistance from a Sales Support Executive. Provide accurate monthly and quarterly forecasting to line manager on a regular basis; specifically during Sales Meetings and Sales Huddles Ensure all aspects of Salesforce CRM system are constantly up to date with assistance from a Sales Support Executive Use Salesforce “Forecast" to manage your pipeline and allow senior management to monitor performance Direct and be responsible for all sales strategy within your region to maximise new business sales with assistance from a Sales Support Executive Ensure Sales Support Executive KPI’s are met on a daily basis as you are responsible for day to day management and direction Attend regional and national trade shows such as InfoSec and IP Expo to generate opportunities in your region Provide trade show ROI reports to line manager after completion and follow up of leads from the event Ensure all processes within the Sales Staff Handbook are adhered to at all times Manage all “closed won" business for a minimum 30 days after date of Purchase Order Establish clear working relationships with Solutions Architects and Engineers assigned to US Sales from the Solutions department for synergy on opportunities Attend weekly one to ones with liner manager for feedback and self-development Attend weekly and monthly sales meetings contributing accurate information and acting professional at all times Keep up to date with all sector related news that could positively or negatively impact sales revenue within your region Network with customers and host sponsored conferences where applicable Day to day management and leadership for your Sales Support Executive to help them meet targets and from a sales/product knowledge development. Ensure Sales Support Executives KPI’s are met on a daily basis as you are responsible for day to day management and direction

item.description: Details: Position Summary Faculty members shall be responsible for teaching assigned classes under the supervision of a Team Leader with support from a Program Head. Respond appropriately to learners needs for clarification or feedback. Provide positive reinforcement and motivational incentives. Performs other comparable job duties as assigned

item.title: Diesel Mechanic
item.description: Details: This position must be capable of performing the majority of required maintenance and service on Ryder vehicles with minimal support from others. Works with the assistance of a T4, TIC, SS or SM when performing highly technical or intricate diagnostic type repairs. Task assignments are directed by shop management to encourage skill development in a productive manner. The Technician III works under general supervision of the designated Shop Supervisor or Service Manager. Exercises some judgment and discretion in resolving issues or making repairs. Post-secondary vocational education strongly preferred Must have minimum tool requirement Must have a valid driver s license Valid CDL (license A) is highly desired; mandatory in some locations Must possess state license as required Must have a minimum of 2 years of experience with mechanical repairs and diagnostics on heavy duty and medium duty equipment. ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS: SBTIII trained within 180 days (SBT220) Complete 2 of the OEM On-Line diagnostic scan tool software courses as required by location fleet mi. (predominant OEM of fleet mix completed within 365days) Must have a minimum of 2 years of experience with mechanical repairs and diagnostics on heavy duty and medium duty equipment Knowledge of and the ability to apply knowledge of computer skills: PC, Windows, mouse, etc. This position requires for you to drive Ryder vehicles. In order to become a Ryder employee you must: Pass a Ryder initiated drug and alcohol screening test Pass a regulatory agency (DOT) specific physical examination Pass a Ryder road test Provide appropriate CDL and endorsements for the position Verify competency in critical skill areas for the specific driving position (e.g., hazmat, doubles, frequent backing) Performs vehicle maintenance and repair duties including: Performs standard vehicle maintenance Performs preventive maintenance Diagnoses complex mechanical and electronic problems utilizing diagnostic computer when applicable Completes complex and detailed mechanical inspections & repairs with minimal supervision Replaces defective components as instructed Works unsupervised on most tasks Performs facility maintenance duties Interacts with customers/drivers to properly determine nature of complaint once assigned a task. Utilizes key functions of Shop Management System and electronic documentation available. Works in accordance with all federal/ provincial and corporate compliance guidelines (i.e., safety, DOT, MOT). Acts as mentor for Tech 1 and Tech 2 levels. Demonstrate the ability to access and use internal and external maintenance documents. Other support duties as required to support operations. These could include but are not limited to Service Island support. Skill Area: Tire and Wheel Maintenance: Tire & Wheel safety trained within 90 days (TW220) Repair and replace tire and wheel assemblies Perform nail hole repairs Verify, diagnose and repair tire related ride quality complaints Skill Area: Preventive Maintenance: PM trained and qualified within 90 days (PM230&PM298) Mentor T1 & T2s in complete and efficient PMs Conduct Quality Inspections on PMs Skill Area: Brakes-Air: Brake Air trained and qualified within 90 days (BA220&BA298) Measure lining thickness Adjust Brakes Perform air brake sections of P.M. Perform brake overhaul Measure drums, rotors, cam bushings Replace S cams, and bushings, slack adjusters and shims Replace foot and relay valves, air dryers, air tanks, air lines, and other similar components Must meet federal qualifications of brake mechanic and inspectors (FMCS 396.25) Skill Area: Brakes-Hydraulic Brake Hydraulic trained and qualified within 90 days (BH220&BH298)* where appropriate Measure lining thickness Adjust service brakes Adjust park brakes Repair or replace minor parts such as lines Bleed brake systems Perform brake shoe replacement Measure rotors and drums Inspects and replace wheel cylinders, master cylinders and boosters Must meet federal qualifications of brake mechanic and inspectors (FMCS 396.25) Skill Area: A/C, Heater & Refrigeration: A/C recycling and recovery certified within 90 days (CF609) & A/C trained and qualified within 180 days (AC220&AC298) Perform basic system checks such as power to compressor, condenser obstructions, belt tension, etc. Identify refrigerant and oil leaks Operate charging and recovery equipment Attach manifold gauges Charge the system according to manufacturer's specification Meet Federal Refrigeration/AC qualifications Flush system contaminants Run OEM performance tests and verify performance Utilize electrical schematics and Diagnostic procedures to identify correct related problems Diagnose and repair all systems and related problems Skill Area: Cargo Handling/Transfer, Liftgates Identify make and mode Add fluid to bring to propler level Make adjustments to lift platform and its controls Identify basic malfunctions Diagnose most mechanical and electrical problems Replace rail cables or cylinders Repair and replace motor and cylinder Skill Area: Charging Systems (electrical) : HD electrical trained within 90 days (DR208) Perform charging system diagnostics and repairs Skill Area: Cranking system (electrical) Inspect and test batteries Visually inspect cables and cranking motor Clean the battery cables, connections and starter Replace batteries Charge & Check batteries Replace or repair defective cables Diagnose and repair cranking system, including replacement of components Skill Area: Lighting System and Electrical Accessories Diagnose, isolate, and repair lighting system problems, such as shorted and open circuits Skill Area: Clutch: Identify proper clutch operation Identify proper clutch brake operation and adjust Adjust hydraulic or mechanical clutches Remove and replace clutch, throw out bearing, pilot bearing, flywheel, clutch brake, etc. Skill Area: Cooling Systems Flush and refill systems Diagnose overheating problems Rebuild fan hubs, idlers, and replace fan clutches Diagnose and repair all cooling system components Skill Area: Drive Axles Inspect housings for leaks Change oil and filter, if required, and clean breathers Diagnose and repair or replace rear axle assemblies Skill Area: Drive line: Perform diagnostics and repairs as required Skill Area: Diesel & Gas Engines- all engines Identify unusual noises, and oil leaks Diagnose, overhaul, replace all assemblies and components with guidance from T4 or Shop Supervisor Skill Area: Fuel Systems: Diagnose and repair gasoline and diesel fuel system components Skill Area: Steering and Non driven Axles and Alignment Perform alignment procedures and adjust as necessary Diagnose and repair all steering components for wear and/or damage Check and adjust trailer axle alignment Adjust wheel bearings Skill Area: Suspension-Chassis and Cab: Diagnose and repair air leaks Diagnose and repair suspension and chassis components Skill Area: Vehicle Coupling System (PM) Repair and/or replace 5th wheels Diagnose and repair vehicle coupling components for wear and/or damage Ryder is item.title: Sales and Operations Management Training Program (Entry Level)
item.description: Details: Description Position Summary Train for your professional sales career in an entrepreneurial environment steeped in a tradition of success. Our TEAM approach engages you in all aspects of our business – sales, operations and maintenance. Learn how we have become the nation’s leading transportation company from the ground up – where the rubber really hits the road! In this Developmental role, you will receive 5 weeks of personalized training and be coached by managers and peers who started in the same seat. We will introduce you to our sales processes, leading edge technology and winning company culture through one-on-one, small group and web-based methods. Within your first 6 months you will be invited to our corporate offices in Reading, PA for our capstone event – facilitated by Senior Leadership, many of whom also started in your very seat. Every 4 months you will be provided feedback on your development and performance, as providing top notch customer service is a key measure of your role. Upon successful completion of the program and successful performance in role, the opportunity for promotion into a manager position exists and future development in operations and sales will continue. Description - Develop consumer and commercial customer solutions to local and national accounts - including many of the Fortune 500. - Manage our large inventory of world class and nationally recognized vehicles, balancing fleet productivity, profitability and customer satisfaction in a fast-paced and dynamic workspace - Generate new business leads as well as foster existing customer relationships Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree required, preferred concentration in Business or Marketing - Effective communication skills, both written and verbal - Internship or related work experience in a customer facing role preferred - Results oriented, attention to detail and good time management skills - A valid driver’s license is required, as is the ability and willingness to drive our Penske vehicles, including a 26’ box truck In addition to competitive wages, you will enjoy a comprehensive benefit package that includes:- Medical, Dental, Life and Vision Plans; Paid Vacation and Holidays; 401(k) with match, plus defined contribution pension plan and special incentive plans Penske Truck Leasing Co., L.P., headquartered in Reading, PA, is a joint venture among Penske Corporation, Penske Automotive Group and General Electric. A leading global transportation services provider, Penske operates more than 200,000 vehicles and serves customers from more than 1,000 locations in North America, South America, Europe and Asia. Product lines include full-service truck leasing, contract maintenance, commercial and consumer truck rentals, transportation and warehousing management, and supply chain management solutions. Visit http://www.gopenske.com/ to learn more about the company and its products and services. Penske is an Equal Opportunity Employer Women and Minorities are encouraged to apply

item.title: Software Sales Account Executive
item.description: Details: Software Sales Account Executive The Strategic Account Executive role is a direct hire opportunity with one of our clients. There are two positions available one for the east coast and one on the west coast. Base salary range is flexible, but total OTE will be around $240,000. This role requires up to 50% travel depending on where you live. No sponsorship available. In this role, you will be responsible for prospecting within an assigned territory to uncover new opportunities and sell our client’s comprehensive offerings. You will identify, nurture and close opportunities with both new and existing customers, manage forecasts on a quarterly basis and track customer data. In addition, you will team up with internal and external partners to improve the velocity of business and to create solutions that serve the best interests of our client’s customers. You will work closely with other members on our team to provide cohesive solutions for our clients. Responsibilities of the Software Sales Account Executive: Be a part of a small, fast paced and growing sales environment Represent company to customer and customer to company in sales-related matters Understand customer's market and business & technology product requirements Sell client’s comprehensive Enterprise solutions Manage forecasts, close deals, and track customer data Be accountable for growing existing business relationships and acquiring new business Take responsibility for meeting individual quota

item.title: Google Analyst
item.description: Details: Associate's Degree Minimum of 2 years experience required Middlesex Hospital currently leverages many components of the Google Infrastructure as part of it’s daily workstream, including Gmail, Apps, Drive, and Sites. We are looking for a highly creative person with a diverse mix of information technology skills & interests (engineering, development, database, scripting, support, etc…) to optimize these tools and lead us in investigating and adopting more functionality from the framework, such as GCE, Cloud SQL, BigQuery, Hangouts, Google Cloud Platform, Google Maps, etc… Basic Responsibilities Support MSH’s existing Google Applications and data store, at all levels within the company. Build new (and optimize existing) Google Sites for use within the enterprise. Investigate new Google functionality, and suggest methods for business utilization and improvement. Author business cases and quantify the value of services. Provide a bridge role between IT and various business units, communicating needs and designing solutions for business operations. Model workloads for the Cloud Platform, and lead adoption efforts. Minimum Requirements: Associates Degree in Computer Science or MIS; Bachelor’s degree preferred 2+ years experience in related field Personal or professional experience with Google Apps, Drive, and Sites Highly enthusiastic with strong communication and collaboration skills. Outstanding customer service skills Experience with the following is edesirable: Google Enterprise experience Cloud hosting experience SQL skills Server (Windows/Linux) skills Social Media skills

item.title: Account Executive - Inside Sales
item.description: Details: Only Hungry Sales Professionals wanting to make $100k+ need apply! Move is currently looking for a talented individual to join our team in the role of Account Executive, which is a unique and exciting inside sales role. We’re interested in people who want to grow with us, who are experienced, hungry sales professionals with a proven track record in closing sales on the telephone for our realtor.com division which is the industry leader in both content and traffic, with over 3 million listings and over 16 million visitors per month. The Account Executive must be a highly motivated, self-driven sales professional with a proven track record. This individual will be responsible for generating new client acquisitions through new and current product offerings and renewing customer product subscriptions within their book of business. All sales activities will be conducted via the phone, and the use of email and computer systems will be necessary. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Generate new sales and retain existing sales made to real estate professionals by: Making outbound cold calls (80-100 per day). Managing and upselling an existing book of customers. Build and manage a sales pipeline by aggressively prospecting which includes setting phone appointments, following up with all appointments, calls, and emails, and performing internet-based marketing and technology product demonstrations resulting in sales. Document and follow up all activities in our customer management system. Become a consultative sales specialist with in-depth knowledge of realtor.com complimentary and paid for solutions, with the capability to communicate how they create a competitive advantage for real estate professionals who use them. Keep abreast of competitive market and industry trends. Provide a high level of sales and customer service. POSITION REQUIREMENTS Minimum 2-3 years of tele-sales experience including: Demonstrated success in achieving and exceeding sales goals through new customer acquisition and management. Demonstrated success in consultative selling and presenting multiple solutions to ensure the best fit with prospect and customer needs. Ability to use critical thinking in a variety of situations and to solve “real world” problems faced by our target audience. Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Strong organizational and follow up skills. Ability to excel in a fast paced and changing environment. Online advertising sales background is a plus Background in Real Estate is helpful but not required. Excellent computer and internet skills, including experience with Microsoft Office programs. Experience with databases &/or CRM tools is a plus. College Degree is preferred. Compensation: Target Compensation $65k - $75k first year. ($35K Base Salary + Uncapped Commission)

Essential Duties ● Drop off and pick up equipment for Traffic Management ● Maintain a clean driver’s record ● Inspect, clean and maintain vehicle ● Load and unload of equipment and product ● Forklift operation and inspection ● Secure loads for transit ● Maintain a daily log of dispatch and load verification ● Assist warehouse supervisor as needed

item.title: Service Del Mgr (SDM) I
item.description: Details: Xerox is the world's leading enterprise for business process and document management. Its services, technology, and expertise enable workplaces - from small businesses to large global enterprises - to simplify the way work gets done so they operate more effectively and focus more on what matters most: their real business. Xerox offers business process outsourcing and IT outsourcing services, including data processing, healthcare solutions, HR benefits management, finance support, transportation solutions, and customer relationship management services for commercial and government organizations worldwide. The company also provides extensive leading-edge document technology, services, software and genuine Xerox supplies for graphic communication and office printing environments of any size. Xerox serves clients in more than 160 countries. For more information, visit www.xerox.com, www.news.xerox.com, www.realbusiness.com or www.xerox.com/businessservices. If you meet the requirements of this position and want to work for a world-class company with a great marketplace reputation, apply today. Job Description Service Delivery Manager The Service Delivery Manager is responsible for the overall quality of service delivery and the day to day operational aspects of the client relationship ensuring client satisfaction. This management position require strong technical, communication, management skills and experience in managing the operations of a business. This position typically utilizes management skills more than technical skills. Key Responsibilities: Plans, directs and manages the Daily Operations of a client support department Strong team leadership - collaborates well with others across all towers and actively incorporates their input. Coordination of activities between client and company personnel involved in problem resolution Strong analytical and problem solving skills; communicates in a clear and sufficient manner and effectively evaluates information / data to make decisions. Oral and written communication skills to effectively communicate information to audiences at all levels of the organization, client representatives as well as provide end-user documentation and self-help solutions. Responsible for deliverables from the team and accountability for team productivity. Responsible for hiring and discipline of all assigned employees. Analyzes productivity data and identifies and implements continuous improvement strategies Ensure the processes and procedures are followed in order to provide quality services and ensure the service level agreement is met. Manage and prevent escalations within the Enterprise delivery sector. Prepare recommendations about strategies that will foster the development or evolution of services. Support team members in resolving technical problems. Ensure frequent communication through direct contact with team members and client Find solutions to questions and concerns that arise when the team is not being used to its full potential or when it does not have the required capabilities. Actively contribute to the process which identifies upcoming projects. Work with the client to manage priorities and expectations Serve as first escalation point for issues within scope of services May lead operational level projects Requirements Bachelor of Science or equivalent experience Entertainment industry experience a plus 5 years Management experience in large scale environment ITIL Certified preferred Xerox is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law. People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply or compete for employment with Xerox may request such accommodation(s) by sending an e-mail to . Be sure to include your name, the job you are interested in, and the accommodation you are seeking. #B2 #B1 #B3

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer
item.description: Details: The ideal candidate should possess 8 years plus experience with a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, or equivalent of education\work experience. Must be able to develop strategies to manage the frequency of appropriate support package/patch application. Should be able to implement solutions and refine procedures as appropriate. Evaluate products and upgrades, accounting for compatibility, feasibility, and overall cost and value . Oversee and implement system upgrade strategies, and develop and analyze complex system standards, thresholds, and recommendations to maximize system performance, reliability, and redundancy. Coordinate with other department personnel on proposals and project plans involving complex system administration projects and solutions. Research current systems technology and serve as subject matter expert on these systems processes and procedures, and make recommendations accordingly. Must be able to work in a 24X7 environment and react accordingly to to issues, as well as be able to be in an on call rotation. The following skills are highly desirable: Must have strong Linux\Unix system knowledge, administer, maintain, upgrade, and patch such servers Must have strong Linux\Unix security knowledge and have ability to configure security for various access on systems Excellent documentation skills, and ability to maintain documentation Excellent troubleshooting skills, ability to prioritize tasks, and work independently Knowledge in the area of Oracle /? MSSQL databases.? Working technical experience with installing, configuring and supporting applications and databases.? Applications systems administration, analysis and troubleshooting.? Familiar with NAS, SAN and MS load balancing.? System networking (config, monitor, tune: lpar and frame) load and i/o management (process, SAN, local: lpar and frame) software install/maint clustering / DR / BC Ability to integrate complex hardware and software systems Ability to work independently and as part of a team

item.title: Wind Turbine Gearbox Mechanic
item.description: Details: Mechanic – Diesel Mechanic – Wind Turbine Technician – Gearbox Mechanic – Gearbox Technician ZF Services is seeking experienced Wind Turbine Gearbox Mechanics in Vernon Hills, IL. The Wind Turbine Gearbox Mechanic is responsible for independently disassembling a damaged wind turbine gearbox, inspecting parts for disposition and then reassembling all components (repaired / replaced / reused) into an operable repaired gearbox. We Offer: Average pay - $18.00-$25.00 an hour – based on experience Health, Dental, Vision Insurance Tuition Assistance 401(k) Company Paid Life Insurance Vacation Purchase Main Responsibilities Include: Utilizes heating, cutting torches, hydraulic presses, high pressure extraction devices, heavy power tools, and liquid nitrogen to remove couplings, gears, bearings and disassemble high pressure joints Rig Gearboxes and main shafts around work shop with overhead cranes and fork trucks Level and align repaired gearboxes for testing with motor Match mark components; label disassembled parts and sketch part assemblies with enough organization for someone else to reassemble the gearbox Measure critical parts using ID micrometers, OD micrometers, and Depth micrometers Machine small components for reassembly to include drilling and tapping holes Reassemble all machined components including gears, bearings and high pressure joints Measure and set bearing endplay to specific work instructions and drawings Machine painting Creates and documents failure analysis reports, orders parts Performs trouble-shooting and function testing of repaired gearbox Performs related tasks or works on special projects/teams as required Supervise a small crew Requirements: 5+ years of industrial gearbox maintenance or technician experience High School Diploma or GED Machining and measuring tool experience Machine repair, hydraulic, and electrical experience Ability to read manufacturing and schematic drawings Headquartered in Friedrichshafen, Germany, ZF is a leading worldwide automotive supplier for Driveline and Chassis Technology. The ZF Group is currently represented by approximately 71,000 employees at over 100 facilities in 27 countries. ZF Services, a business unit of the ZF Group, combines SACHS, LEMFORDER, BOGE and ZF Parts product brands as well as the global offering of the ZF Group in retail, services and customer service. ZF Services aims to strengthen international customer service and to expand the after sales business with new products and services.

item.title: Industrial / Process Engineer
item.description: Details: Responsible for evaluating and devising the most efficient and effective methods to create our product by utilizing available resources, technology and employees. These methods should eliminate waste in terms of time, energy, money and materials during the production process, while focusing on workers’ safety, environmental concerns and cost in order to streamline the manufacturing processes for maximum company growth. Drive Direct and Indirect Labor work standards Create standardized systems Integrate Safety, Material Handling, Ergo, Process & Plant Operation request into plant AutoCAD layout. Develop, analyze, and assist with the implementation of plant productivity improvement actions, capacity actions, Ergonomic improvements, and Health & Safety improvements. Review and assist plants with cost saving projects, rebalance plans, and launch allocation planning including completing and evaluating time studies.

item.description: Details: Position: Hedge Fund Client Services/Tech Support Analyst Location: New York, NY Comp: $Competitive + Bonus Description Leading investment operations and trading infrastructure solutions firm seeks bachelors with 1-3 years financial services or asset manager client support or fund administrator/back office experience with emphasis on data analysis or data process flows from portfolio/fund accounting systems or trade order management system processes and data flows; must have working knowledge of securities and investments (fixed income or derivatives products) from either a banking or mutual fund, hedge fund or asset management environment. Recent grad (high GPA a +) with strong analytical and problem solving skills and 1-2 years experience in financial services highly preferred. Exposure to SQL , SAS or light technology a plus but not required. Our client are looking for someone with the ability learn proprietary trade and back office support systems and processes with the ability to interact with hedge fund clients, manage issues and provide ongoing product support. This role has excellent growth and career development for the successful candidate. Requirements Bachelors degree in Economics, Computer Science, Finance or related 1-3 years experience in a back office or fund administration environment Data processing and/or strong data analysis experience a + Working knowledge of investments and products – fixed income, derivatives, equity Excellent communication skills Please submit resume in Word.doc format to: *AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER*

item.title: Macy's Seasonal Retail Selling Floor Recovery, As Early As 7AM - Fairfield, CA - Solano Town Center
item.description: Details: Job Overview: As a Seasonal Floor Recovery Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. You will be required to move between selling areas as directed to maintain high customer readiness standards. You will deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment, while building quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and other operational tasks as assigned. This position is only in our Extreme Hard Shop Locations. Performs other duties as assigned. In order to present our customers with the best holiday shopping experience, many of our Holiday Selling Floor Recovery Associates arrive prior to store opening and remain after closing to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Holiday associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule on a temporary basis, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas. And don't forget - just in time for holiday shopping, you will receive an employee discount of up to 20% starting your first day! Any schedule hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All holiday associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends, or on key holiday events such as the Friday after Thanksgiving. Essential Functions:- Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration - Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills - Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority - Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice - Adhere to all safety and security policies and procedures - Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality Qualifications: Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management. Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Other skills: Ability to work as part of a team, or independently with minimal direct supervision. Strong customer selling orientation. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and open to learning new procedures. Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including evenings and weekends. Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: Industrial Sales Representative
item.description: Details: Selling Quality Industrial Tools by Professional Sales People Snap-on Incorporated is a leading global developer, manufacturer and marketer of tool and equipment solutions for professional tool users. Founded in 1920, Snap-on is a $3+ billion, S&P 500 Company headquartered in Kenosha, Wisconsin and employs approximately 11,300 worldwide. INDUSTRIAL SALES REPRESENTATIVE Toms River, New Jersey Covering the New Jersey Shore Area This outside sales position will promote and sell Snap-on branded and non-branded products to the Industrial market serving the New Jersey Shore area. The ideal candidate will reside in the Ocean County area. An essential point of contact, the account manager establishes, develops and maintains professional relationships while selling in the industrial tool market. An Associate's or Bachelor's degree is preferred, along with a strong work ethic, and prior knowledge of the industrial marketplace. The successful candidate will have 3-5 years outside selling experience, preferably serving the Industrial tool market. A proven track record of prior goal achievement showing solid increases in outside sales and in customer growth is required. Prior outside industrial sales experience in heavy duty fleet market or industrial commercial market is strongly desired. 1-3 years previous outside selling experience to New Jersey state and/or local government, public schools, townships or garages is preferred. This candidate must enjoy working independently and must be self-motivated. This position requires strong presentation and communication skills. Must be PC proficient in using all Microsoft Suite products. A valid driver's license, impeccable driving record, ability to obtain adequate insurance coverage, and reliable personal vehicle is also required. Response Information: Snap-on offers a competitive compensation package, which includes a base expense, commissions, plus sales bonus opportunity. In addition, Snap-on offers a complete benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k Savings and offers a retirement plan. Snap-on offers a drug free work environment and welcomes all qualified candidates to apply. Local candidates in the Ocean County, New Jersey area are strongly encouraged to apply, as relocation is not being offered. Snap-on is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran For consideration, please apply with your resume and salary history to Snap-on's Career Website at: https://ch.tbe.taleo.net/CH01/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=SNAPON&cws=1&rid=3342 Source - Military City - Springfield, VA

item.title: Forklift Operators (Multiple Shifts Available !!)
item.description: Details: Exel, a leader in supply chain management, provides customer-focused solutions to a wide range of manufacturing, retail, and consumer industries in over 500 sites in the United States and Canada. With over 40,000 associates, Exel manages more than 85 million square feet of warehouse space (equivalent to almost 1,500 football fields) and has an annual revenue of almost $5 billion in this region. With headquarters located in Columbus, Ohio, Exel has a customer base including some of the world’s best-known and most successful companies. Exel's comprehensive range of innovative logistics solutions encompasses the entire supply chain from design/consulting through warehousing/distribution services to integrated information management and e-commerce support. Exel will be hiring Forklift Operators for our Roanoke, TX facilities for the following shifts: 2nd Shift: 2:00 PM - 10:00 PM - Monday - Friday, weekends as needed 3rd Shift: 10:00 PM - 6:00 AM - Monday - Friday, weekends as needed Weekend Shift: 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM - Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday 1st Shift : 3:00 AM - 1:00 PM - Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Sunday 2nd Shift: 3:00 PM - 1:00 AM - Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Sunday The Forklift Operator will be responsible for operating powered equipment for the purpose of moving, locating, relocating, stacking, and counting product. Responsible for checking all inbound and outbound products. Ensures products are free of damage and infestation, product code dates are properly recorded and products match customer requirements. Primary job functions include: Load, unload, move, stock, and stage products and materials using a forklift, clamp truck, or other power equipment 80% of specified shift. Pull and prepare product for shipment ensuring the exact number and types of product is loaded Keep appropriate records and reports for inventory accuracy. Comply with all OSHA and MSDS standards. Verify load accuracy; check the load count, stability, and product damage, Report variances as necessary. Changes equipment battery or LP tank and monitors power source as necessary. Maintain the facility’s equipment and materials in a neat, clean, and orderly fashion. Assist in physical inventories. Complete daily inspection of equipment. Perform additional duties as assigned by management or customer.

(TFA), Transamerica Financial Group Division - Member FINRA, SIPC, and Registered Investment Advisor. Non-Securities products and services are not offered through TFA. To become a registered representative of Transamerica Financial Advisors Inc., Transamerica Financial Group Division, you must first become an associate with WorldFinancial Group, Inc.) Job Snapshot Base Pay None Employment Type Part-Time or Full-Time Job Type Financial Professional Education High School Experience Preferable but none required Manages Others No Required Travel None Job ID BFG9000 Pursue your dreams with us by: Helping people from all walks of life reach their financial goals. Empowering thousands of individuals and families to create and grow wealth through a variety of best-in-class financial products and services. Educating clients on financial fundamentals, so they can make wise choices, and better manage and protect their money. Doing what is right for clients, every time!

item.description: Details: NSK is a world-class producer of ball and roller bearings.
